loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 41-year-old housewife. She has two sons and two daughters. Her second son, Samer, is 23 years old and is in his fourth year studying for a banking and finance major at university. Because of the university’s high fees, Samer has a part-time job to help his family, who are paying for his college fees. Unfortunately, it is not enough, so his mother Salam has applied for a loan to pay for a semester so Samer can continue and eventually graduate to work in the banking field.
Because Salam is a conservative person, her son Samer has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay a semester's fees.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 39-year-old business lady from South Rift Valley in Kenya. She is married to John and they have eight children.

Hellen operates a dairy farming business in her locality. She owns several dairy cattle. She has had this business for the last ten years and is taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD. She will use this loan to buy another dairy cow.  She intends to reinvest the anticipated profits into the business.

Her hope is to grow this business to uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: Belén, de 56 años es una señora sencilla. Vive en compañía de Máximo, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en Pampas. Ella es una mujer trabajadora. Se dedica a varias actividades, pues su mayor sueño es brindar a sus hijos lo mejor. En las mañanas se dedica a la crianza de sus 6 vacas de las cuales lleva a pastar, para que le proporcione una buena leche. Pues realiza queso y lleva a vender ella misma a la capital del país. Donde obtiene un dinero adicional, pues es muy conocida. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de maíz, papa, alverja y quinua. Los que cuida gracias a sus esposo, quien también le ayuda. Juntos en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos en la feria de Pampas. Ahora ella desea incursionar en la compra y venta de cerveza, donde espera obtener buenas ganancias, ya que tiene gran demanda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario”los pétalos” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Belén de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y abono para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz; que tiene en 3 hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en: Belén is 56 years old and a humble woman. She lives with Máximo, her husband of 30 years. They both have 3 children and live with 2 of them in their own home, located in Pampas. She is a hardworking woman with various activities. Her biggest dream is to offer her children the best. Mornings she raises her 6 cows that she takes out to pasture, so they can supply good milk. She makes cheese that she herself takes to the capital to sell. This gives her addition money, as she is very well known. Besides growing corn, potatoes, peas and quinoa. She cares for the crops thanks to her husband, who helps her. Together they harvest and sell their food at the Pampas fair. Now she wants to get into buying and selling beer, where she hopes to obtain good profit, since there is a lot of demand.  She belongs to "Los Pétalos" [The Petals] support group, and this is her eighth loan with MFP.  She hopes for your cooperation to continue with her goals. She is also happy to belong to the association because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. If Belén receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in purchasing natural and chemical fertilizer to spread on her corn crops. She has 3 hectares of farmland.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: La señora Valeriana realiza la actividad de compra y venta de ají. El crédito lo requiere para incrementar su capital  de trabajo y comprar más ají, pues tiene muchos pedidos nuevos de tal forma que incrementará sus ingresos.  Valeriana  es casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Irpavi II de la Ciudad de La Paz.  Es la décima primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a kiva.
texts.en: Valeriana is a chili pepper merchant.  She needs the loan to increase working capital and buy more chili pepper because she has many new orders and will be able to increase her income this way.  Valeriana is married and has three children.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Irpavi II zone.  This is the tenth time she’s worked with IMPRO and the fourth with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy chili pepper in larger amounts.

loans.name: Bhagabataswami Shg Group

texts.en:
Bhagyabati is a 27-year-old lady who lives in the small village of Sonepur District, Odisha, India. She is the group leader of a 14-member group. Her family is comprised of three members: Bhagyabati, her husband, and her child. The member standing with her hand raised is the featured member, Bhagyabati. 

Bhagyabati has had a fish business with the support of her husband for the last eight years in her locality. Her husband also helps her to purchase and sell fish in the local market. She is a very active lady who wants to earn some extra income with her own efforts. At present, her family income is about Rs 4,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. It is the first time the group will access a loan from People's Forum. With the loan, Bhagyabati will purchase a stock of fish for wholesaling. 

Regarding the other 13 members of the group, they also want loans for the development of their existing businesses such as a grocery shop, goat raising, a dried fish business, vegetable vending, etc.

All the group members of this group are very excited and very thankful to Kiva for the kind support.

loans.use: To purchase fish to wholesale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. Chavez is married woman, she has a daughter. 3 years ago Mrs. M. decided to help her husband with the house expenses. In addition of her necessities she gets in charge of her sister who suffers a handicapped problem. She start selling food to the neighbors; at the present time she already has more clients, and she needs to acquire one more a stove that allows her to prepare more variety of foods, to cover the demand of his clients. On weekends her husband helps her with the food elaboration and distribution. She comments "I need to work very hard; I want that my daughter continues studying because she is very intelligent; she goes to the school and obtain very good notes". Maria Socorro requires $950.00 to grow her business and realizes her objectives.

Español

La Sra. Maria Martínez Chávez es casada y tiene una hija, hace 3 años la Sra. Martínez decidió apoyar a su esposo en el gasto familiar pues además de sus necesidades quedó a cargo de su hermana que sufre de una discapacidad motriz; inició vendiendo comida a vecinos; hoy ya tiene más clientes y necesita adquirir una estufa más grande que le permita preparar más variedad de alimentos para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. En los fines de semana su esposo le ayuda en la preparación y distribución de lo alimentos que prepara. Ella comenta “Necesito trabajar muy duro; quiero que mi hija siga estudiando pues es muy inteligente; ya va a la escuela y tiene muy buenas notas” María del Socorro requiere $ 950.00. Para hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su objetivo

loans.use: buy a bigger stove and ingredients

loans.name: Margerete

texts.en: Antie Margie lives in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana, a community where charcoal is used in every home for cooking. She is the only retail supplier of the fuel in her area. She buys the charcoal from the producing center and sells it at a profit to her customers. Because the cost of each bag has gone up, she is unable to buy enough bags to supply all of her customers. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 to enable her meet the demand and grow her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory of fresh fish, pay for transportation costs and to reinforce her fish stall

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Blanca A. has been selling gas in cylinders for 4 years now. A friend who also sells gas cylinders got her started in this business by lending her a few cylinders. Later, as she learned the business, she started selling them on her own. She started getting more clients, and today she is very well known in her neighborhood for providing this service. She runs the business from her own home, and she's on the job from 8:00 AM to 10: PM, seven days a week.

Purpose of Loan

Mrs. Blanca A. would use the loan to by more gas cylinders; she doesn't have enough to meet the demand. Also, she would use some of the money to invest in her husband's lumber business.

About the Applicant

Mrs. Blanca A. is fifty. She's been with her husband for thirty-five years. She has six grown children. One daughter attends the university and still lives at home. Blanca and her husband help her with her studies. Her husband sells lumber to different workshops. He transports it from Esmeraldas and sells it in Guayaquil. Her two-story house, made of concrete, is very simple in style. Her daughter helps her run the business from home. She has a strong desire to better herself and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Blanca A. lleva 4 años dedicada a la venta de gas. Ella lo inicio porque una comadre de ella vende gas y le prestaba algunos cilindros, luego doña Blanca fue aprendiendo del negocio y empezó a vender sus propios cilindros de gas. Además que fue captando clientes y actualmente es muy conocida en el sector donde ella vive. Su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio y lo atiende desde las 8:00am hasta las 10:00pm todos los días.)

Uso del Préstamo

La Señora Blanca desea comprar mas cilindros de gas ya que los que ella tiene no son suficientes para satisfacer toda la demanda de sus clientes. Además que su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera y juntos quieren invertir en sus negocios.

Información Personal

Doña Blanca tiene 50 años de edad esta unida a su esposo hace 35 años. Tiene 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, solo una de sus hijas vive con ella y esta en la Universidad y ella junto a su esposo le ayuda con los estudios. Su esposo trabaja vendiendo madera a los diferentes talleres, el trae la madera desde Esmeraldas y la vende aquí en Guayaquil. Su casa es de 2 pisos de cemento muy sencilla. Su hija le ayuda atender en negocio en su casa. Ella tiene mucho deseo de superarse y aspira mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.

loans.use: To buy cylinders for gas

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha has already proven to be a very reliable business partner. She has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from Mekong Plus. Her last loan was funded by Kiva. Ha makes traditional Vietnamese desserts, called "che", at home and brings them to the marketplace to sell; her home is 2km away from the market, and she carries the desserts on her shoulder. Her dessert stand earns her about 15,000 VND per day ($0.94).

Without Mekong Plus and Kiva, Ha would be paying interest on her loans and would not be able to save up money to send her 10-year-old daughter to school. She wishes to receive another loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva in order to increase her sales and profits. She wants to be able to save enough money to fix up her house. It is very unstable, and she is scared it may collapse during a storm. Ha works incredibly hard, and she is confident she can repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her dessert stand

loans.name: Saydy

texts.ru:
Saydy B., 23, is single. He lives in the village of Kalfisabad in Yavanskiy region and works on the local oil processing plant. In addition to his job, Saydy raises cattle at home. He has a roomy farm and enough food to be successful in his cattle farming business. Saydy has been raising cattle for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 animals and enough food to feed them for 3 years. Every 40-45 days, Saydy sells some animals and purchases younger ones earning an extra income. He plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоёров Саъди, возраст – 23 года, образование среднее, не женат. Саъди живёт в Яванском районе в кишлаке Калфисабад, работает на маслажир комбинате рабочим. Помимо своей основной деятельности клиент также занимается разведением домашнего скота у себя дома, для этого он имеет вес необходимые условия: большой коровник, корм для его содержания. Этим видом деятельнолси он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На полузченный кредит клиент планирует приобрести 3 головы крупного рогатого скота и необходимое клоличество корма для их откормки. 3 лет. Через каждые 40-45 дней клиент продаёт скот и покупает другой более молодой. Тем самым клиент получает дополнительный доход, так как заработная плата получаемая им на маслажиркомбинате не слишком высокая. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase 3 animals and food for them

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en:
Mimin is 45 years old and the mother of a 10-year-old daughter. She sells cosmetics on credit and usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, U., sells some fruit in Jakarta and earns $10 income per week.

She requests a $50 loan to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics and fruit. She hopes that she can earn more income for her child's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and fruit

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
“I live in Riawind, a small city in Pakistan. My husband has been retired for the past ten years and opened his own grocery store. We would like a loan so that we can stock up our grocery store. I have married off four of my children and the others live with me. One of my daughters makes shoes and I help her out by going to the market and purchasing materials and cutting shoes. I have been borrowing from a local microfinance institution.

I would like to borrow together with a small group and guarantee that other women in my group will repay their loans. Niamat A.’s husband recycles plastic bottles by cutting them up and then sells them to be melted down. Naziran’s son requires a loan to help him purchase inventory for his fruit cart. Musarat’s husband requires a loan to repair their wagon. Asia’s husband requires cash to purchase a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) for her husband. We are all like family and I know them well enough to accept responsibility for them.”

loans.use: purchase inventory for a grocery store and improve the businesses of the other four members of the group

loans.name: Sayu Kade Puspa

texts.id:
Sayu Kade Puspa's kiosk provides all kinds of staple merchandise. She has run this business since 5 years ago. Her daily net income is about Rp 50,000 - Rp 100,000. She uses the business profit to support her life and to fund her son's education. Her son, Putu Agus Wiadnyana is studying in high school. She work hard especially for the sake of funding her son's education. She hopes that her son can go to college so that he can improve the family's economic situation in the future. Now Sayu Kade Puspa needs an additional capital of Rp. 5,000,000 which will be used to expand the kiosk business and to add more merchandise variety so that she can gain more customers and more income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Semua barang kebutuhan pokok setiap hari tersedia di warung Sayu Kade Puspa.Usaha ini sudah dijalankan sejak 5 tahun yang lalu. Setiap hari penghasilan bersih yang didapat berkisar Rp. 50.000.- sampai Rp. 100.000.- Dari hasil usaha ini dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga dipergunakan untuk membiaya sekolah anaknya yaitu Putu Agus Wiadnyana yang saat ini masih duduk dibangku SMA. Semua kerja keras yang dilakukan oleh Sayu Kade Puspa semata-mata hanya untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya dan memiliki harapan yang besar agar anaknya bisa bersekolah sampai tingkat yang lebih tinggi lagi supaya nantinya bisa mengangkat perekonomian keluarganya. Dan saat ini Sayu Kade Puspa membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- yang akan dipergunakan untuk memperbesar usaha warungnya dan menambah barang dagangan agar jumlah pelangganya bisa lebih banyak lagi dan juga lebih banyak pendapatan yang didapat.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of merchandise

loans.name: Sisemi's Moringe. Group

texts.en:
Sisemi is 33 years old, is married woman with 3 children, ages 7, 5, and 11/2. She and her husband also take care of another person, age 22. Sisemi began selling clothes in 2002. She works from 7 am to 5:15 pm every day, and earns about $140 profit a month.

Sisemi received and repaid one loan from BRAC Tanzania. She now requests a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She plans to share this loan with her group members, who own a cafe, sell fish and vegetables, and sell food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz is an exemplary woman with a fighting spirit. Motivated by the necessity of helping her husband with the household expenses, she saw that she needed to find work herself. 6 years ago she began selling catalog lingerie to her neighbors. Now she holds events inside her house in order to generate bigger sales, inviting people from all over.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will repay in 3 months. This loan will go to improve the manner in which she will be able to take orders that her clients pay for when the items arrive, and also to organize more sales events for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Ma. de la Luz, un mujer luchadora y ejemplar, movida por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa se vio obligada a trabajar por su cuenta para apoyarlo hace 6 años empezó vendiendo lencería por catalogo solo con sus vecinos ahora realiza demostraciones dentro de su casa para generar ventas mayores invitando a gente de diversos sectores.

Ella necesita de US $250 que pagara en 3 meses. Este crédito la va apoyar de tal manera que podrá surtir los pedidos que tiene pendientes además de ir organizando más demostraciones para el negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
Mrs. Raymunda is 47, married, with four children. Her husband is a farmer and she belongs to Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial (“Women Fairground Workers’ Community Bank”) selling foodstuffs in the market at Yungay District and Province, State of Ancash. She and her husband work to financially support their children who are in higher education.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she will purchase a cooker, four tables and 16 chairs.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Raymunda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del campo Ferial,se dedica a la venta de alimentos en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 4 mesas con 16 sillas y una cocina. Ella tiene 47 años, es casada con 4 hijos, su esposo es agricultor ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos que están en educación superior.

loans.use: Loan for the purchase of tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Nigora S. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been working in the trading business for two years and has her own small shop in the local market. Her husband brings in shoes to sell from the city of Dushanbe. Selling these shoes is her family's only source of income. In order to improve her family's lives, and also supply goods to the population, Nigora needs to increase her cash-flow. She needs a loan to be able to do this and will be able to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Шарипова Нигора проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 39 лет , замужем и имеет 5 детей. Два года занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Продает обувь, которую привозит из города Душанбе. Товар привозит ее муж. Поэтому их бизнес это единственный источник дохода их семьи. Для того , чтобы улучшить условия жизни , а так же помочь населению с обеспечением необходимых товаров Нигоре необходимо увеличить товароборот. А для этого она должна получить кредит . Погашать сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase Cash-flow

loans.name: Constancia Maria

texts.es:
Constancia María V. comes from the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. She has three children whom she supports and provides for, in hopes that they do well in school.

Currently she is starting to repair her house which has been damaged by natural disasters. For this reason she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase the building materials she needs. In this manner she will be able to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Constancia María V. es originaria del municipio de Villanueva en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es madre de tres hijos los cuales mantiene brindándoles todas las necesidades para que estos se desarrollen en sus estudios. Hoy en día ha iniciado a reparar su casa de habitación por haber estado con grandes fallas producidas por los fenómenos naturales.

Por esto es que hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los materiales de construcción y para continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina is 36 years old, studied until third grade, middle school, she is married and has 5 children who still depend on her. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua”, of “Centro Poblado de Chuachua”, District of Zepita, Province of Chucuito-Juli and Puno Region. She fattens cattle for a living as with her first loan of S/.300 she bought a cow to fatten. She also sells cheese at the fairs at Desaguadero and Zepita and during winter she sells “tayacha”(typical dish) of “oca” and “izaño” (different kinds of local potatoes) to increase her income. With the loan of S/.1,300 ($475), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a “quintal” (46 kg) of “oca”, a “quintal” of “izaño” and a cow to be fattened. Justina had been in the business of “tayacha” for ten years and fattened cattle for one year. Thus she gets her daily income. Her dream is to buy a vehicle to transport cattle, improve her dairy cows and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Justina tiene 36 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, que aún depende de ella. Es socia del Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz de Chuachua, del Centro Poblado de Chuachua, del Distrito de Zepita, Provincia de Chucuito – Juli y Región de Puno. Se dedica al engorde ganado ya que con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró 1 vaca para el engorde. Ella también vende quesos en las ferias de Desaguadero y Zepita, y en la época de helada vende tayacha de oca e izaño, para tener mayores ingresos económicos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará un quintal de oca, un quintal de izaño y 1 vaca para el engorde. Justina indica que hace diez años esta con el negocio de tayacha y el engorde ganado vacuno vienen realizando hace un año. Ya de esa manera cada día genera sus ingresos económicos. Su sueño es comprar carro para traslado de ganado, mejorar sus ganados lecheros y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase "oca", "izaño" (local products) and 1 cow.

loans.name: Hidaya's Hatukati Tamaa Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 43 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 19 and 16 years old. She has been a cassva and charcoal seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

Hidaya is now requesting a loan to buy more cassava and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with potato sales, bites sales, chips and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the widow of K. J. and lives in city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She has been living in this city for the last 25 years. She has no children. After her husband's death, she became very frustrated then she decided to make herself busy with some work. Naseem baji started sewing clothes for her neighbors and then collecting orders from out of her community. She has been in this profession for the last 15 years. She is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine to expand her clothes-sewing business.

Naseem baji is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy tools used to cut wood into pieces. Naziran baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy materials (cold drinks and cigarettes) for her "cold corner". Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy towels and socks to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena O. is married and has one child. He has received schooling through the junior high level. His wife is a fishmonger.

Kwabena makes artifacts and crafts and sells them at Coconut Grove near Elmina. He has been in this business since 2003. Kwabena uses his income to pay his utility bills and other family expenses.

Kwabena will use this loan to purchase carving tools, wood, and other materials for his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwabena plans to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase carving tools, wood, and other materials

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. She is a single mother of two children. She sells candies daily while walking in the main plaza. With her loan she will invest into her business by purchasing gum, candy and cigarettes.  Cirila is currently saving so she can purchase things that she might need in the future. She hopes that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: Gum, candy and cigarettes

loans.name: Virginia Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, desde hace 6 años, pertenece y es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”. Tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, madre de 2 hijos y vive en el Jr. Cutimbo Nº 190, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Al inicio, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su mercadería comprando textos de lectura de distintos autores. Se dedica a la venta de libros. A la edad de 26 años empezó a realizar  todo tipo de negocios y también  vende miniaturas en la Feria de Alasitas en el mes de Mayo. 

En la actualidad sigue vendiendo libros en el Jr. Ilo y al mismo tiempo hace otro tipo de negocios.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará artículos navideños para vender en el Parque de la Madre.   

Su deseo es tener una tienda de venta de libros.
texts.en:
Señora Virginia, since six years ago, has been a founding member of the community bank "Diana de Gales." She is 36 years of age, married, and a mother of two children. She lives at Jr. Cutimbo Nº 190 in the district, province, and department of Puno. In the beginning, with the first loan of 300 soles, she increased her merchandise by buying reading texts of different authors. She is dedicated to selling books. At the age of 26 she began doing this type of business and also sold miniature items at the Alasitas Market in the month of May. Presently she continues selling books on Jr. Ilo and at the same time does another type of business. With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy Christmas articles to sell in the Parque de la Madre. Her desire is to have a book store.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Christmas articles

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Dame O. Julienne est née en 1969 à Abomey Calavi. Originaire de Igolo dans l'Ouémé, elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM1. Elle a été forcée d'abandonner les classes par sa tutrice, et aida celle-ci dans la vente de divers articles: conserves, pates alimentaires, et autres biens de consommation. A 15 ans environs, elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec la vente d'oeufs frais pour laquelle elle est ambulante. Elle a exercé cette activité pendant des années. Aujourd'hui, elle est semi-grossiste dans le domaine. Elle achète des plateaux d'oeufs  qu'elle livre à crédit aux détaillants. Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner  uniquement en plateaux d'oeufs frais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julienne O. was born in 1969 in Abomey Calavi. Coming from Igolo in the Ouémé district, she attended school up to grade 4. She was obliged by her guardian to leave school and help with selling various items: tinned goods, pasta, and other consumables. At around 15 years of age, she began on her own, selling fresh eggs door-to-door. She was in this business for some years. Today, she is a semi-wholesaler in this sphere. She buys trays of eggs which she places on credit with retailers. She is requesting this, her third loan, to bolster her business. She is intending to buy fresh eggs only by the tray.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 75 trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Сафарали Эрматов мужчина 26 лет , женат , отец двоих детей.Жена домохозяйка, сам работает в колхозе трактористом.В хозяйстве имеет 15 коз и 10 баранов.Сафарали уже третий год кридитуется в Микроинвесте.
Сафарали каждый вечер пригоняет скот с пастбищ кишлака,он доволен кредитами и говорит что займы ему помогают в его скотоводчестве.
texts.en:
Safarali E. is a man of 26 years, married and is a father of two children. His wife is a housewife and he works as a tractor operator on a farm. He owns fifteen goats and ten sheep. Safarali has been taking out loans from MicroInvest for three years. He shepherds the cattle from the village pastures every evening. He is very happy with the loans and says that they really help him with his animal husbandry business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animal husbandry

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M., 44 years old with one child, rents one and three quarter hectares of farming land to grow rice. She and her husband work hard on the farm in order to have food for the family. They enjoy working under the heat of the sun, touching the wet soil, removing the weeds to ensure quality harvest. 

Aside from farming, Gemma cooks "bananacue" in their village. "Bananacue" is a filipino term for fried banana on a stick that many children love to eat. Gemma is also able to cover some of the family expenses from the profit made through selling her "bananacue." 

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She will use the loan to buy Urea and insecticide to increase her yield. This way, she can better support her children, especially with their schooling.

CEVI provides all clients, like Gemma, credit assistance for their businesses. Aside from that, they also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita A. D. is a resident of Kabakungan, Claveria Misamis Oriental, Southern Philippines. She is married to Luis D. and they have 2 children.

Her husband is currently the elected councilor of the village. As a wife, she wants to help her husband build a better future for the family and wants to give financial assistance for their everyday expenses. Currently, she is into a food vending business with her own food stall. Her customers are her neighbors, peddlers, and passers-by. Her greatest dream is to see her children graduate and earn a degree. To expand her business and be able to cater for the village needs, she is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase ingredients for additional food for her food stall.

loans.use: purchase additional food ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married to Adriano, a wood carver. The couple was blessed with five children: Adrian-25, an electrical engineer; Ariane - 23, college student; Francis Benedict - 19, works as a laborer; Ma. Luisa – 18 years old, an undergraduate; and Raymart – 15 years old, is a high school student.

Editha is a vegetable vendor in their village. She is planning to purchase more vegetables for the growth of her business. And for the realization of her plans, she is requesting to access a loan of PHP 8,000 that she can use as added business capital. Said amount will be of great help not only for her business but also for their family. With an increase in income, she can support the needs of their family, especially her children.

Editha has been a vegetable vendor for many years and she is doing her best to become successful in reaching her goals. She believes that being patient and through hard work is the best way to success.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Femi

texts.en: Femi is 35 years old and married with 2 children. Femi is a vulcanizer and he also sells tyres and tubes. He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more tyres and tubes to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tyres and tubes to sell

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.ru: Эшматова Бахригул- женщина 40 лет. Замужем мать 5-х детей. Занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынках Булок и Аппон Аштского района. Бахригул закупает товары из рынках Озоди и Нури Хучанд города Худжанда. Муж Бахригула работает трактористом  в колхозе. В свободное время помогает жене в торговле. На полученный займ Бахригул хочет открыть вторую точку. Ей нравятся все наши условия.
texts.en:
Bahrigul E. is a 40 year old woman. She is married and is a mother of five children. She sells food products on the Bulok and Appon markets in the Asht region. Bahrigul buys the goods on the Ozodi and Nuri Huchand markets in the town of Khujand. Her husband works as a tractor driver in a collective farm. In his free time he helps his wife with the sales. Bahrigul wants to use the loan to open a second vendor location. She is happy with the loan terms.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a second vendor location

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 39 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, estas prendas las lleva a los caseríos que se encuentran en zonas alejadas de la ciudad. A Rosario le gusta mucho su trabajo porque puede conocer todos aquellos bonitos lugares llenos de vegetación donde están ubicadas las casas de sus clientes. Además su negocio es rentable, porque su mercadería la compra a precios muy bajos, y sin incrementar mucho el precio, ya que sabe que las personas a las que vende no tienen mucho dinero, aun así obtiene muy buenas ganancias porque en cada viaje todas sus prendas se venden. Para más adelante, Rosario quiere comprar un carro para movilizarse con mayor cantidad de ropa, ya que por ahora sólo vende lo que puede cargar por sí misma. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy interesada en trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que son personas muy dinámicas y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para seguir incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosario is 39 years old. She is a single mother of two children, and lives in her own home. For the past year, Rosario has been selling second-hand clothing to people who live far outside the city. Rosario likes her work, because it allows her to visit beautiful areas full of vegetation where her clients live. Furthermore, her business is profitable, because she buys her products at cheap prices, and although she doesn't raise her prices much because she knows that her clients don't have much money, she is able to sell all of her items during each trip and therefore earn a good amount of money. In the future, Rosario wants to purchase a car in order to carry more clothing with her on her sales trips, as she currently sells only what she can carry on herself. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very interested in working with her communal bank, as she sees that its members are dynamic and responsible. With the loan proceeds, Rosario will purchase more clothing in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. sells shoes to her customers. She is 39 years old and married with two children. Doris is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Floriselda

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo y con mucha alegría, en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Floriselda F. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de carteras las que son vendidas por ella misma en su localidad donde muchas personas le visitan para comprar dichos productos.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un Nuevo crédito para la compra de las carteras ya que debe de invertir en este negocio y así seguir logrando la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes que solicitan las carteras.
texts.en:
In the Mercado Central of the city of Chinandega, Floriselda F. enthusiastically and happily runs a business selling handbags. She sells the bags herself in her shop and many people visit to buy her products.
She has come to Ceprodel to request a new loan to purchase handbags. She needs to invest in this business to continue satisfying each and every one of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handbags

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn N., 28, has been involved in a business of selling vegetables and farming with a typical income of US $2 per day since 2000 in her village in Seim Reap province. N. is married and lives with her husband and four school-aged children. Her husband has to leave his village and go to the town to work hard every day as a construction builder for a typical income of US $4 per day to support his family.

Since her children find it hard to travel long distances to school on foot, N. wants to take a loan of US $200 for the first time from Kiva partner, CREDIT to purchase three bicycles for all of her children. By doing this, her children will be able to travel to school much easier and faster.

loans.use: buying three bicycles

loans.name: Julio Adrián

texts.es:
El joven Julio Adrián D. H. tiene ya mas D. trece años dedicando se al oficio D. chofer D. un taxi. 
Este negocio es la fuente D. ingresos para su familia ya que esta bajos su responsabilidad sus padres que son personas ya mayores D. edad.
El está solicitando un préstamo ya que desea contar con otro vehiculo para generar más ingresos y fuentes D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Julio Adrián D. H. has over thirteen years experience working as a taxi driver. This business is the source of income for his family, but it is not enough since he is also responsible for his parents who are getting older in age.

He is requesting a loan so that he can acquire another vehicle to generate more income and handle more work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another vehicle to generate more business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia sells wines. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for the past 20 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more wines to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more wines to sell

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda A. makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting banana to sell. She is 47 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Alda has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Alda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding an agricultural business

loans.name: Dharma Shova

texts.en:
Dharma Shova B. is the cosmetic shopkeeper in the town of Tangal. She opens her cosmetic shop two months ago to uplift the living standard of her family. In her shop she sells different types of cosmetic goods such as make-up tools, lipsticks, cream powers etc. In Nepal September is the month of big festivals. So the demands of cosmetic goods are very high in this month. So Mrs. B.  is requesting for Rs 20000.00 loan to buys different types of cosmetic goods to meet the demand of the customers.
Mrs. B. lives in a joint family with her husband, father-in-law , mother-in-law and two brother-in-laws

loans.use: to buys cosmetics goods

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoy V., 47, is a duck-egg trader. She is a widow and the mother of seven children of whom five are married and live away from home and the other two are single. Two of her children are employed: her son sells pots to earn a living and her daughter is a garment worker.

Presently, Hoy V. sells eggs that she buys in bulk from suppliers. She is facing a problem with transportation; she also pays a lot of money for her traveling expenses. Therefore, Hoy V. requests a loan to buy a motorcycle which she will use to transport her product to the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport her product to market

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mao K. is a villager in Kampong Prai village in Takeo province. She is a grocer in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery supplies for her business. Her husband, Mr. Chao Meng, is a veterinarian. Mrs. Srey Mao K. is 36 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is four years old and too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. is from the village of Highway Lawis. She is 58 years old. Alma is married and has 4 school-aged children. Alma makes & sells household furniture to local businesses and community members. Alma has been in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $172 US) a month for these activities.

In 2003, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Alma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Alma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For inventory and working capital

loans.name: Eulogio Ramiro

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandaga, el seño Eulogio H. se dedica a atender su propia pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos desde comestibles tales como pan, galletas, tortas y también bebidas como gaseosas y jugos. También el señor Eulogio vende productos como papel higiénico, jabones y ase todos estos comercializados en su establecimiento.
Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dichos productos para comercializarlos en su pulpería y así generar ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, señor Eulogio H. attends to his own general store where he offers all types of food products like bread, cookies, cakes, and also drinks like soft drinks and juices. He also sells products like toilet paper and soap in his store. He is requesting a credit to invest in the purchase of these products to sell in his general store so he can earn income to support his home that needs his support so much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for his general store.

loans.name: Bayarlah

texts.en: Bayarlah O. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Khovd Province in Western Mongolia. She and her family live in a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, called a "ger". Her oldest son lives with his grandparents working as a herder and her youngest son and both of her daughters are secondary school students. O. and her husband sell meat at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2002 with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 USD) and has built a consistent operation over the years. Her busines continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugrugs ($1050 USD). Oyntsetseg's business has enabled her to buy new furniture and create a confortable home for her children. She is saving now to build a new home. O. is working hard for the future and says, “I want to continue to improve my business.” She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug ($1050 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: XacBank-Mongolia Lending Team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell in her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Antonia tiene 39 años y tiene una hija de 12 años y se llama Rosa Gisela. La socia Antonia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su hija. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a vender pan a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad de Urcos. Ella y sus compañeras de negocio desde hace 2 años atrás se les ocurrió crear un pan especial que lo llamaron “chuta navideña” que tiene las mismas características del pan chuta (Pan redondo blando con un olor peculiar y es un pan gigante, pan típico de la ciudad de Urcos) pero le agregaron pasas y frutas. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a la venta de pan y el negocio lo aprendió de su mamá. La socia y sus compañeras de negocio solo preparan este pan “Chuta navideña” para las fiestas de navidad. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar, manteca, frutas y pasas para preparar las “chutas navideñas” para esta navidad y año nuevo ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Antonia is 39 years old and she has a 12-year old daughter named Rosa Gisela. Antonia is originally from the city of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco and she belongs to the Community Bank “Qori Orcco” of the Arariwa Association. The city of Urcos is located 45 Km from the city of Cusco, approximately 45 minutes of travel time. Antonia gets up early to do her household activities such as preparing breakfast for her daughter. After she is done with her household activities, Antonia has to go sell bread at Plaza De Armas (parade grounds) in the city of Urcos. She and her business partners of 2 years now came up with the idea to create a special bread that they called “chuta navideña” which has similar characteristics to the chuta bread (a round, soft bread with a particular aroma and of giant size; traditional bread from the city of Urcos) but they added raisins and fruits. She has been selling bread for 12 years and she learned the trade from her mother. Antonia and her business partners only make the “chuta navideña” bread for the Christmas festivities. She is requesting a loan to buy more consumables such as flour, sugar, lard, fruits and raisins to make “chutas navideñas” for this Christmas and New Year, since it is during this season when they sell the most. Antonia is grateful for the opportunity afforded by this channel and she is committed to make the payments according to the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy consumables such flour, sugar, lard, fruits and raisins.

loans.name: Luceritos De La Noche Group

texts.es: “Luceritos de la noche”  es un grupo de 8 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Exaltación”,  se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de mantas, ropa, dulces, productos medicinales, tejido de chompa y costura de prendas de vestir en tela polar. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan cada una.
texts.en:
“Luceritos de la noche” is a group of 8 women and 1 man who attend meetings in the “Exaltación” Focal Center. They met recently in order to discuss access to the loan, since all of the members need to increase their work capital. All have different businesses, such as selling sheets, clothes, sweets, medicinal products, sweaters and fleece garments. All need the loan to buy merchandise and raw materials, as required by each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy emprendedora de 36 años, está separada hace muchos años del padre de sus 3 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia, pero que está a medio construir.
Desde hace 15 años se dedica al tejido de chompas, negocio en el que viene surgiendo poco a poco, especialmente con diseños típicos para los turistas, gracias a la demanda de estas prendas en los últimos tiempos. Por esta razón, Ana alquiló un puesto en un lugar muy concurrido, lugar cercano a una zona de embarque para viajar fuera del país. Desde entonces ha mejorado considerablemente su situación, pues le han pedido que adicione bordado a sus chompas y ella no dudo en hacerlo, por lo que gana mucho más de que antes. 
Su trabajo lo realiza con mucha facilidad, ya que tiene habilidad en las manos para el tejido desde niña, pero jamás imaginó que este arte heredado de su madre sería el pilar de su economía. 

Este es su 20avo crédito con MFP y promete seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad en sus cuotas, ya que para ella es muy importante contar con créditos posteriores, por ser una herramienta fundamental para su progreso. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de lana, hilos de diversos grosores y plantillas para bordado.
texts.en:
Ana is an enterprising woman of 36 years old. She has been separated for some time from the father of her 3 children, who live with her in her own house, but which is only half constructed. For the past 15 years, she has dedicated herself to the weaving of jackets, a business in which has grown little by little, especially with designs typical for tourists, thanks to the recent demand in these types of pieces of clothing. As a result, Ana rented a stand in a busy area, a place very near the embarkation for trips leaving the country. Since then, she has improved considerably her situation. She has been asked to add embroidery to her jackets and she doesn't hesitate to do so, which means she is making a lot more than before. She does her work with ease, since she has always had skillful hands at weaving since she was a little girl. However, she never imagined that this art form, inherited from her mother would be the basis of her income. This is her 20th loan with MFP and she promises to continue to act responsibly in her payments because it is important for her to be able to depend on future credits that will be a fundamental tool in her business' progress. She plans to invest the money that is applying for in the purchase of wool, threads of various thicknesses, and embroidery templates.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and other textile materials

loans.name: Omotolani

texts.en:
Omotola is a widow with two children under her care. She is 48 years old. She sells plantain at wholesale to buyers who go out to resell. She has been in this business for over nine years.  She does this trade to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes sure her customers demands are met while indirectly improving her finances. From the profit in her business, she takes good care of herself and her children. Omotola hopes to expand her business in the future.

Omotola is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase plantain in bulk at a discount to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain to sell.

loans.name: Neyva

texts.es:
Neyva es socia del Banco Comunal Las Margaritas.
Neyva es soltera, tiene 27 años y tiene un hijo, Neyva viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende pollos para recria y de las ferias compra quesos que vende en la ciudad de Lima.
Necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos.
Los sueños de Neyva es salir adelante, ser profesional y tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Neyva is a member of "Las Margaritas" communal bank. Neyva is 27 years old and single, and she has one child. Neyva travels to various markets where she sells young chickens to be raised, and she also buys cheeses which she sells in the city of Lima. She needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing chickens. Neyva's dreams are to get ahead, be a professional and have a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence R. is a 26-year-old businesswoman who is married with three children. She sells kangas and clothes to her customers in the Pangani area. She has been in this business for a period of about one year and makes a profit of about 3,000 KES per month.
Florence walked into the offices of Kiva partner, KADET, and enquired about loan services by herself. She has not borrowed from another microfinance institution (MFI) before. She hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in the city.

loans.use: To buy more kangas for sale

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Transito

texts.es: Guadalupe del Transito D. D. M. D. 49 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a sus dos hijos D. 20 y 15 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Guadalupe posee una venta D. granos básicos, platos y cucharas desechables, café y todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, los cuales comercializa en su puesto el cual esta ubicado en el mercado municipal D. San Vicente, en donD. ella venD. sus productos por mayor y por unidad. Este negocio representa la mayor parte D. ingresos para su hogar por lo que ella desea mantenerlo estable, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería la cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe del Transito D. D. M. is 49 years old. She lives in the Department of San Vincente, where she lives together with her husband, who works as a businessman, and her two children who are 20 and 15 years old. Her children are studying. Guadalupe has a business selling basic grains, disposable plates and silverware, coffee, and many types of basic household goods. She sells these in her stall, which is located in the municipal market in San Vincente, both wholesale and individually. This business provides the large part of the household income and allows her to maintain stability. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan, with which she would be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise and in this manner achieve larger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a mill

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis M. M. is sixty-one years old. His wife is a farmer and they have three children aged forty years old, twenty-seven years old and twenty years old.

Francis M. sells cows and goats to the local people at Mwingi, a business he has been doing for one and half years now. He is served by SMEP Thika branch. He says that the business is very good and profitable but his major challenge is transporting his livestock for sale to Mwingi market.

Apart from his livestock business, Francis M. also sells cereals to the local people to make more income. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cows and goats to sell.

Francis M. hopes to own his own pickup which he will use to transport his livestock. He describes himself as hardworking, social and humble.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 42 años, es madre D. familia, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en casa D. su madre con su hija y nieta. Mónica se dedica diariamente a vender cartulinas, cuadernos, lápices, láminas en general. Procura siempre D. colocar en orden su material para que sean vistosos y sea fácil la venta. Su punto D. venta es en el interior D. un mercado, favoreciéndola ya que es muy concurrido, siendo los escolares sus principales clientes y demás vecinos D. su barrio. Actualmente su hija y su nieta trabajan con ella,  D. ese modo va D. compras para renovar sus productos. Se siente a gusto con su negocio. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y construir su propia casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita incrementará útiles escolares, mercerías y demás accesorios D. belleza para abastecer su bazar librería.
texts.en:
Mónica, 42 is a very happy and hard-working mother. She lives in her mother's house with her daughter and granddaughter. Daily, Monica sells cards, notebooks, pens, and educational materials in general. She always tries to organize her merchandise so that it is eye-catching and easily sold. Her shop is in a market, which she favours because it is very busy. Schoolchildren and neighbours are her main customers. Currently, her daughter and granddaughter work with her which allows her to go shopping to replenish her stock. She is comfortable with her business. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to build her own home. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that the credit will be very useful for increasing her working capital, so she promises to repay all the quotas on time. With the requested loan she will increase her stock of school supplies, various items and beauty accessories to supply her school supplies shop.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies, goods and beauty products

loans.name: Noreidis Judith

texts.es:
Noredis A. es una joven artesana y comerciante, que vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores en San Jacinto, municipio del Departamento de Bolívar donde  la población sabe perfectamente como fabricar  hamacas, mochilas y las artesanías mas lindas de Colombia, y es que esto es lo que justamente hace ella en su negocio. Por tradición familiar Noredis aprendió este oficio, con el que ahora ayuda a su familia a mejorar su vida, mediante su trabajo y el ahorro que desde ya , está haciendo con el fin de comprar su casa propia y proporcionarle a sus hijos una vida digna.  Ella es una gestora social que pertenece a la cooperativa de agricultores y artesanos y cuenta con máquinas industriales para el uso de los asociados. Este es su  segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y aunque participa en sus programas hace algo menos de 2 años, pero había suspendido  el crédito porque   gran parte del capital lo invirtió en la compra de un lote y estaba esperando mas recuperación de su cartera. Ahora solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 COP para comprar materias primas como hilazas  adornos  y forros para fabricar  bolsos e  hilazas  y adornos para fabricar hamacas.
Ahora su sueño es tener una casa propia, con un local para mi negocio, crecer y asegurarles el futuro a sus hijos. Los desafíos más importantes que enfrenta Noredis son los relacionados con la familia sobre todo por las escasas posibilidades de empleo en que se encuentran en el municipio.
texts.en:
Noredis A. is a young artisan and merchant. She lives with her husband and their two small children in San Jacinto, a town in the department of Bolívar. The town is well known for producing hammocks, backpacks, and the most beautiful crafts in Colombia, and that is precisely what Noredis does in her business. She learned this trade as a family tradition, and her job now allows her to help her family improve its quality of life. Through her job and the help she has already received, Noredis is working so that she can purchase her own house and provide a decent life for her children. She is also a social worker who belongs to the farmers and artisans cooperative, which has industrial sewing machines for the use of its members. This is Noredis’s second loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She has participated in its programs for a little less than two years—her first loan was cancelled because she invested a large part of the capital in purchasing a plot of land and had to wait to recover more of her investment. She is now seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Colombian pesos so that she can purchase supplies such as yarn, ornaments, and lining for making handbags and yarn and ornaments for making hammocks. Her dream is to have her own house with premises for her business, and for her business to grow so that she can ensure her children’s future. The biggest challenges that Noredis faces are above all her relations with her family, since there are few employment possibilities in the town where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies such as yarn, ornaments, and lining for making handbags, and yarn and ornaments for making hammocks

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes P. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Agnes is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Agnes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita F. is from the town of Trento. She is 63 years old. Nenita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Nenita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nenita has been raising pigs for more than eight years. She also owns a store and manages it herself. She sells soy sauce, sugar and other products.

Nenita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nenita is requesting a new loan of 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future and to purchase additional store inventory. This will be the second loan taken out by Nenita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future and for additional store inventory

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Nan R. who has been working in this business since 1992. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US $3 per day. In addition to their farming work, this humble couple takes time to fish in and around the river. The river is full of fish during the fishing season; however, the family does not have tools to use for fishing. Therefore, Nan R. has decided to seek assistance through Kiva’s field partner HKL in order to purchase fishing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Gwaan, Brgy. Balaring, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: dressmaking, fish vending and RTW businesses. Her husband Eduardo D., who is 59 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children aged between 13 and 33. 

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosemarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 9000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing 19000 PHP, for a screen for the house and to buy more clothes to sell so she can continue to save for the future and have her own dress shop someday. 

Rosemarie D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Juana Valentina

texts.es:
la sra. Juana Valentina Z. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, Juana vive en la colonia Araujo de la ciudad de Choluteca.
Todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes.
Juana es madre de 2 hijas, mayores de edad y que le ayudan en su negocio.
su tiempo libre lo dedica a la cria de cerdos y gallinas.   
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Valentina Z. sells popular consumer products. She has a small store located in her home. Juana lives in the Araujo subdivision in the city of Choluteca. Every day she wakes up at 5am so that she can attend to her customers. Juana is the mother of two grown daughters who help her with the business. During her free time, she raises pigs and chickens.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise to restock her business since the demands of her customers are numerous. The earnings are needed to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin L. (pictured here in her farm) is a widow with six children (one son and five daughters).  Five of them are married and live outside the family home and the other one assists her mother in the business.  She lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Rin L. has been farming for more than 30 years. She has asked for a Kiva loan once already and is now requesting her second loan of $600 to continue her farming business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming business.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao U., 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. U. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3.00 per day. Her husband sells knives, earning an income of about USD 5.00 per day. The family has to spend USD 33.00 on food, USD 20.00 on the children's education, and USD 5.00 on other necessary expenses every month.

U. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport knives to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. U.'s husband appears in the photograph because U. was not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorobike.

loans.name: Francisco Leonardo

texts.es:
Francisco de 49 años, es vendedor informal de toallas en los semáforos de Guayaquil (en la foto aparece con la esposa quien le ayuda). Vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Empezó como comerciante informal hace ya 20 años atrás por la falta de oportunidades el tubo que continuar esta actividad. En la actualidad recorre las calles, centro y semáforos de Guayaquil vendiendo toallas a las personas. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. Una de las dificultades de trabajar ha sido durante estos seis meses que lo operaron del apéndice y se le hace un poco incomodo caminar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, hierro y arena para construir mejor su casa, en el futuro quiere construir el segundo piso de su casa y tener un local definido para las ventas de las toallas.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 49, sells towels at the traffic lights in Guayaquil. He appears in the photo above with his wife, who helps him. He lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil, in an area near the tidal estuary.

He started as a businessman in the informal sector 20 years ago, and because of a lack of other opportunities he has had to continue this way. At present he walks around the streets, centre and traffic lights selling towels to people. He works from 8am till 5pm every day.One difficulty in this line of work has been during these last six months since he had an operation on his appendix and it has been a little uncomfortable to walk. 

With the loan he wants to buy cement, corrugated metal sheeting and sand with which to improve his house. In the future he wants to build a second floor on the house and have a fixed location from which to sell the towels.

loans.use: Cement, sand, metal sheeting

loans.name: Sreypach

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypach P. (who we see in this photo), 25, and her husband, Mr. Channy Sorn, 28, have been married since 2003 and have three sons. One of them attends school and other two are still living at home. The family lives in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sreypach makes a living selling fruits (such as mangos, bananas and papaya), buying them under contract from her fellow villagers and transporting them for sale in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a construction worker. Sreypach hopes to expand her business by buying additional fruits to resell, and is applying for a loan for $600 to make this possible.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes their orders on time to earn an income. 

Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electricity repairing services to his clients and also sells electrical items such as tube lights, switches and bulbs. He does his business by operating a small shop in the market and has more than 30 years of experience in his field. 

Rani has given birth to 3 daughters. Only her 2nd daughter is able to get education and the others stay at home.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repairing tools and also buy electrical items such as tube lights, bulbs, and switches to further improve his business. 

Rani is hopeful that her husband, with a vast experience in his field, will successfully be able to improve his business condition with the help of a loan investment. 

She lives in a city called Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is known for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house. She is a new loan applicant for Asasah and hopes it will bring good profits to her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and items

loans.name: Hairat

texts.en: Hairat H. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and son in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His only son, age 3, is in a local kindergarten. Hairat operates a meat trading business in his province with the help of his wife. He purchases livestock from herders at a wholesale price and his wife sells the meat at the local market after slaughtering the livestock. They have been engaged in this business for the past four years and have built a stable and successful operation over the years. Today, his working capital has exceeded 500,000 MNT. He plans to increase his working capital during the period of preparing meat for the winter. Hairat says, " I want to expand my business and buy my own car in the future." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more meat at wholesale

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter G. N. is a member of Jasho Letu group. Being a member of the group, she is able to save her money, share business ideas and easily access loans.  

Wilter has become more focused in running her retail shop. Besides operating a retail shop, she has a van for a transport business.  

She has requested a loan of  80000 KES to add to her stock of sugar, cooking fat, soap and soda.

She dreams of owning rental houses in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of sugar, cooking fat, soap and soda

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Eight members make up the village bank loan. They are located in Anlong Ta Sek Leu village, Kandal province. This village loan selected, Mrs. Khim C., a 29-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. The members of this village will use their portions of the loan for different purposes.
