Mrs. Khim C. and her husband, Mr. Loeung Yoeun, are farmers who own a 1.20-hectare of land, which they use to cultivate rice and different vegetables to sell to support their family living. For this farm, Mrs. Khim C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her crops. Aside from farming, her husband also earns his living by driving an agri machine for a salary. They have two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her crops.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Jeneba. She is married with two children and has three additional dependents who live with her because they lost their parents. In 1997, Jeneba established her food-market business because she wanted a way to help her husband support their family. She operates her business six days a week and 10 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Sierra Leone leones in order to purchase more food items. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Don Rodolfo, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a vender ropa, vive con su madre y una hermana, él es soltero y el negocio lo inicio hace 4 años por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 4:00pm, las ventas las realiza en los pueblos cercanos la Unión y Morazán, donde ya tiene clientela.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para adquirir mercadería como blusas, pantalones, ropa interior y para niños, esta compra necesita realizarla para incrementar el inventario y ver la posibilidad de mejorar también sus ventas.
Él quiere mantenerse en el negocio, apoyar siempre a su madre con los gastos económicos y también los gastos personales.
texts.en:
Rudolfo lives in San Miguel, department of San Miguel with his mother and a sister.   He is 42 years old and unmarried.  He sells clothing, a business he started 4 years on his own initiative.  He works from 5:00 AM until 4:00 PM every day.  He sells his merchandise in the nearby towns of Unión y Morazán, where he has customers.   

Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, trousers, undergarments, and children’s clothing.  He needs to make this purchase in order to increase inventory and also create the possibility of improving sales.  He wishes to maintain the business, and help his mother with financial obligations and personal expenses.

loans.use: To purchase blouses, trousers, undergarments, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
la señora Nely García tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada y vive en la aldea Agua Fria de la ciudad de Nacaome.
doña Nely se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio es muy popular en ese sector.
Nely es una mujer que esta en las cosas de Dios por lo que sus vecinos, amigos y familiares tienen muy buena reputacion de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en su negocio, comprar mercaderia al por mayor.
Nely tambien hace trabajos de costura en sus tiempos libres.
 
su mayor anhelo es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Nely García is 59 years old, married, and lives in the village of Agua Fria, near the city of Nacaome.  Nely's business is selling essential food products and she has a grocery store in her home.  Her business is very popular in the area.  Nely is a religious woman and, for this reason, her neighbors, friends and family members say that she has a very good reputation.

Nely will use her loan to invest in her business, buying merchandise wholesale.  She also does sewing jobs in her spare time.

Nely's biggest wish is to finish building her home.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, soft drinks, churros, butter, oil, beans, corn flour and wheat flour, eggs, soups, soap, toilet paper, candies, candles, juice, matches and batteries

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 64 años y vive con su esposa en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en la parte urbana del distrito de Olmos, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace cuatro años, se dedica a la carpintería. Repara y elabora artículos de madera como camas, roperos, adornos, etc. Es muy conocido en su región y cuenta con una clientela muy establecida. Desea usar su crédito para comprar un pequeño moto para una mesa trifásica la cual usa para cortar madera. Con este dispositivo, podrá aumentar el número de productos que elabora semanalmente. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Antonio is 64 years old and lives with his wife in their own home located in the urban section of the District of Olmos, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Antonio has worked in carpentry for four years. He repairs and manufactures items made of wood such as beds, wardrobes, decorations, and other products. Antonio is well-known in the region and has an established customer base. He wants to use this loan to buy a small motor for a sawing table that he uses for cutting wood. With this device, he will be able to increase the number of products made on a weekly basis. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase a small motor for a sawing table.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.en:
Remigio is 60 years old, married, and has 10 children. His oldest child is 39 years old. His younger children still go to school. Remigio's wife works as a tailor.

Remigio is a farmer. He has been growing rice for more than 21 years now. He sells his harvest at his town's market. Remigio does his best to provide for his family and improve their living conditions.

Remigio's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 46-year-old married man with five children. He lives with his family in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His wife is a farmer. For the past 25 years, Charles has operated a butcher shop and with the income he has generated has been able to pay the school fees for two of his children who are at the university. Charles faces the challenge of high taxes and is requesting a loan to buy cows for slaughter.

With his wife’s support, Charles dreams of educating all of his children through university. He also would like to own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es padre de familia de 32 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 02 hijos. Viven en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmenta mantiene una cosecha de limón. Tiene dos años de experiencia en este rubro. Despues de cosechar sus productos, los vende en los mercados locales de Olmos. Solicita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para su cultivo. Esta inversión lo ayudará lograr una mejor calidad y precio para su producto. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore la calidad de vida d su familia.
texts.en:
Julio, 32, is married and has 2 children.  They live in the Olmos district, a busy agricultural area located in Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  He is a farmer and for the past two years has been growing limes.  After the harvest he sells them in the local markets in Olmos.
Julio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his orchards.  This investment will help him improve the quality and get a better price and that’s why he is requesting a loan of 800 sols from Edpyme Alternativa.  He would like to continue investing in his business so that it will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure for his lime orchards

loans.name: Ofilio

texts.es: Ofilio y su compañera de vida lava y plancha para ayudar con los gastos, tiene a sus hijos estudiando. Su casa es humilde y tienen como  proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, haciéndolo poco a poco por los altos costos de los materiales. Tiene la facilidad de que el tiene la profesión de albañil así no paga lo que es mano de obra. El préstamo que solicitad será para comprar materiales: laminas de zinc, clavos y reglones para cambiar el techo del la casa. Obteniendo mayor protección, seguridad y comodidad por que no se le pasara el agua.
texts.en:
Ofilio and his partner wash and iron clothing to help with household expenses; their children are studying. Their home is humble and they are trying to improve it. It is a project that has to be done little by little because of the high cost of the required materials. Ofilio has an advantage in that he does not have to pay for labor because he is a trained construction worker by profession. 

The loan will be used to purchase zinc roofing sheets and other construction materials necessary to fix a roof that is in disrepair. This will prevent water from leaking through the ceiling and will allow Ofilio and his family to have a greater comfort in their home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her in-laws. Rose has had a tailoring business for 10 years, and works seven days out of every week. She has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more   rolls of clothing materials. Her main business challenges include defaulters, transportation, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see it grow big so that she can employ girls to assist in tailoring. Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es una mujer felizmente casada de 50 años. Ella vive en una pequeña comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo ubicada a 25 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande.

Modesta tiene un negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas que lo desarrolla en un puesto ubicado a pocas cuadras de su casa. Ella tiene  gran experiencia en su negocio, pues lo viene desarrollando desde hace 30 años y cuenta con clientela establecida.

Modesta solicita un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles, a Edpyme Alternativa, para invertir en la compra de mercadería (gaseosas, cervezas, golosinas) y en mejoras dentro de su espacio de trabajo. 

Modesta desea ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos  y una mejor atención (mejoras  de ambiente). Esto le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y por lo tanto tener  mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Modesta goza de buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Modesta is a happily married 50 year old woman.  She lives in a small rural community in the process of developing that is located about 25 minutes from the district of Tambogrande.

Modesta has a business selling food and beverages at a stand located a few blocks from her house.  She has a lot of experience with her business, because she has been developing it for thirty years and she has an established customer base.

Modesta is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the purchase of merchandise (sodas, beer, sweets), and to make improvements to her workspace.

Modesta wants to offer her customers a better variety of products and better service from the improvements in the environment.  This will allow her to continue growing her business and earn more income for the well-being of her family.  Modesta has good personal references.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of products to expand her business.

loans.name: Bethuel

texts.en:
Bethuel has practised farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last seven years. He is 48 years old and married to Elizabeth. They have four school-going children.  

Bethuel was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to get a good harvest and sell the produce in the local market.

In the future, Bethuel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 26-year-old married lady who runs an electronics shop in Mwembe Tayari, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the past five years. Peris is a previous KADET client and this will be her second loan.
  
Peris is requesting a loan to purchase more electronics to sell. She will use her anticipated profits to repay her loan and support her family. In the future, Peris dreams of opening several outlets.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Marcial Orlando

texts.es:
Marcial de 51 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Oyotun que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Marcial es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque, así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y necesidades personales. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicamente.  Marcial es una persona que se preocupa porque sus tierras cada vez sean más productivas para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcial is 51 years old and single.  He lives in his own home which only receives electricity service.  His home is located in Oyotun, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

Marcial's business activity is farming.  He owns his own farmland where he grows corn.  When he harvests his crops, he sells them in the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  This makes him income with which he is able to cover his expenses and personal needs.

Marcial has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crops.  His goal is to be able to sell his crops to traders for a better price so that he can improve his finances.  Marcial is a person who works to make his land more productive so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crops

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.es: Lilibeth de 29 años de edad vende ropa productos capilares y medicina natural, en su negocio ubicado en su propia casa donde vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella inició su negocio hace 10 años pues lo aprendió de su madre que en ese momento tenía su actividad mercantilista, que ofrecía en Sincelejo, capital del departamento de Sucre, ubicada al noroeste del país, en la Costa Caribe Colombiana, lugar donde viajaba con gran frecuencia. Así fue como Lilibeth entusiasmada por su madre aplicó esta experiencia en la ciudad de barranquilla y allí comenzó su estrategia de mercado, e inició su negocio con el que actualmente cuenta para para lograr un importante ingreso y apoya a su cónyuge en el hogar. Lilibeth hoy ha agregado nuevas líneas de productos, como ropa femenina y le ha ido muy bien con sus clientes, pero  su capital de trabajo aun no es suficiente para responder oportunamente a sus compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante un credikiva, pues con él comprará jeans, suéteres y  sandalias en mayor volumen y ganaría descuentos por hacerla de contado y en mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Lilibeth is 29 years old and she sells clothing, skin products, and natural medicines. She has her business in her own home, where she lives with her husband and their 6-year old son. She started out her business 10 years ago, having learned from her mother. At that time she had her business in Sincelejo, capital city of the department of Sucre, located in the north east of the country, on the Columbian coast to the Caribbean. It was a location to where she traveled frequently. Lilibeth started out under her mother's encouragement and by applying her experience in the city of Barranquilla. She started her market strategy and she started out the business which she still has and it represents an important source of income with which she is able to help her husband with the support of the household. Lilibeth has added new lines of products, such as ladies' clothing and it has done very well with her clients. But her working capital is still not enough to respond in a timely manner to her buyers. She applies for a first time Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase jeans, sweaters, and sandals in larger volumes in order to qualify for volume and cash discounts.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, sweaters, and sandals in larger quantities.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, three of whom are in school. Annet has a business of a liquor store. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of retail. Annet has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use these funds to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She also generates additional income through a restaurant. The main business challenge(s) for Annet include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business include expanding to the districts of Kasese for Local Gin. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow and has four dependents who sometimes help her with vending barbecue. Selling this kind of food for over three years is very satisfying. She sells naturally delicious foods such as hot dogs, meats, banana cues (a dessert), camote cue, etc. People of all ages can buy and eat it. She earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from this work.

Angeles currently joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to purchase food supplies for her barbecue vending activity. She aims to increase daily sales, which she thinks may be made possible by this loan. Angeles expects to sell more and manage revolving capital properly to avoid scarcity of resources. She plans to expand the business in the near future and have all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her barbecue vending activity.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 39 years old, married with three children in school.  To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes.  She has been in the business for seven years.  In addition, she does dairy farming for more income generation.  She hopes to expand her business within five years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children.
 
Edward has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries and cakes. He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads.

Edward is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Edward hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads.

loans.name: Edigina

texts.en: Edigina is taking another Kiva loan for 85,000 KES to purchase a motorcycle to venture into the transport business. She dreams of expanding her business and purchasing a matatu (motor vehicle) for the transport business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Luis Adan

texts.es:
Luis Adán es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor de 34 años quien es comerciante de ropa típica y artesanías desde hace 6 años. El con el crédito comprara mercadería en ropa, artesanías y para unos encargos que tiene.
Luis es casado y tiene tres niños de 11, 8 y 3 años los dos mayores están en primaria.
texts.en:
Luis Adán is a hardworking man and entreprenuer who is 34 years old. He has been selling traditional clothes and handicrafts for the last 6 years. With the loan he will buy clothes, handicrafts and items to fill some orders he has.

Luis is married and has 3 children aged 11, 8 and 3 years. The 2 eldest children attend primary school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothes and handicrafts in particular.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.es: Nadine, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, esta separada de su esposo, pero vive con sus padres, en compañía de su hijo, su hermano, y su prima. El trabajo que realiza Nadine es la venta de comidas al paso, para lo cual logró ambientar un espacio en su casa. colocando mesas, sillas y viendo que la zona donde esta es bastante transitada, decidió por empezar este negocio hace diez años. Actualmente tiene mucha clientela, y su hermano y su tía, son quienes más la ayudan atendiendo al público. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que logra tener un ingreso económico que le permite poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder dar un educación a su hijo, al que quiere mucho. Sin embargo el precio de los insumos para la preparación de su comidas cada vez están más caro, pero a pesar de esto, considera rentable este negocio. Este sería el crédito número cinco con la institución MFP, y comenta que se siente muy bien y cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal, ya que considera que son personas responsables y amables, que se preocupan por estar puntuales en sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará cerveza al por mayor, mesas para el local, terminar los acabos de los servicios higiénicos para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nadine, 35, is an enterprising, dynamic woman.  She’s separated from her husband but lives with her parents, her son, her brother and her cousin.  Nadine’s business consists in selling fast food; she equipped a space in her house to do so setting up tables and chairs.  Seeing that this is an area with quite a bit of foot traffic she decided to open the business ten years ago.  She currently has quite a large clientele.  Her brother and her aunt are the ones that help the most with tending to the public.  What she enjoys the most about her work is that she earns income that allows her to cover household expenses and provide an education for her son who she loves very much.  However, the price of ingredients for her meal preparation is more expensive very day.  Despite this she still considers this business to be profitable.

This would be loan #5 with MFP.  She comments that she feels comfortable and very good in her communal bank because she considers the members to be responsible, kind people who try their best to be punctual with their payments.   She will use the requested amount to buy beer at wholesale, tables for the locale and to finish furnishing the restroom to offer better customer service.

loans.use: to buy tables, cases of beer and to equip the restroom.

loans.name: Ntumpemukire Group

texts.fr:
Charles est un commerçant âgé de 41ans qui habite au Quartier Kinama de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Il vend des pommes de terre depuis 6 ans. Il commence cette activite apres avoir termine ses études jusqu’en 10e année secondaire. Il est marie a Joselyne et ont ensemble 6 enfants dont 5 étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva de 300,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de pommes de terre dont il fait ses approvisionnements dans les marches de l’intérieur du pays et les  revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Ntumpemukire»
texts.en:
Charles is a small-scale retailer of 41 who lives in the district called "Quartier Kinama de la Mairie" in Bujumbura. he has been selling potatoes for six years. He began this business after having  completed the 10th grade of secondary school. He is married to Joselyne and they have six children; five of them are enrolled in school. 

The Kiva loan of 300,000 Burundi francs that he is receiving will permit him to grow his working capital so as to buy a lot of potatoes. He buys them from markets in the interior of the country and resells them, making a good profit. 

He is a member of the community group « Ntumpemukire».

loans.use: to buy a lot of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 31-year-old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is dealing in cocoa buying and selling and wants more capital to invest into his business. He is faced with hardships such as price fluctuations, the high costs of transport and bad weather. His dream is educate his children to the university level and build a permanent house. Godfrey wants money to buy cocoa to sell In order to gain the confidence of the client, the loans officer who is putting on a blue jacket had to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married woman with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. 

Carolyne has operated a second hand clothes selling business for the past year.  Her potential clients are local area women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more second hand clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with three children. She is 31 years old since she was born on April 13,1980 and is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Elvie is operating a business venture selling seafood products including fish, crabs, and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for four years. She earns 51,750 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Elvie is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Elvie hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a twenty five year old man from the shores of Lake Victoria, Western Kenya. He is married to Evalyne, and they have 2 children.

Charles has been running a tailoring business in his area for the last 9 years. He is taking his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy textiles for the tailoring business. He plans to reinvest the anticipated profits into his business. His dream is to build a house for his family, and also to educate his two kids.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Lucrecia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 51 años de edad propietaria de un pequeño taller de costura donde su especialidad son los delantales y gabachas. Este negocio lo inicio hace aproximadamente 20 años con el propósito de salir adelante, con el crédito ella comprara materia prima telas, hilos, cintas y bordados.
Ella tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya mayores y una menor de 20 años la cual esta en la universidad.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a hardworking, enterprising, 51-year-old woman who owns a small sewing shop where her specialty is aprons and chef jackets.  She started the business 20 years ago hoping to get ahead.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials: fabric, thread, ribbon and appliqués.  She has three children.  Two of them are adults and one is 20 years old and attending university.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rosario Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosario es una mujer de 61 años que constantemente lucha para salir adelante, es por eso que desde hace 8 meses tuvo la gran idea de crear un negocio de lencería, esta fue inaugurada con mucha expectativa y deseos de superación, sus hijas fueron las principales cómplices de la creación de esta nueva aventura comercial, juntaron dinero y lograron ahorra una buena cantidad de dinero, la misma que les permitió iniciar.

Rosario está muy contenta por la oportunidad que le han brindado sus hijas ya que gracias a ellas ahora puede disfrutar la realización de sus ventas, la señora Rosario actualmente vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Pisco, la misma que sufrió un terremoto de 7.9 grados en la escala de Richter y desmoronó la ciudad, pero con el esfuerzo y dedicación de sus pobladores esta linda ciudad ha logrado progresar y salir adelante como siempre lo ha hecho.

Gracias al apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá comprar muchos más productos (Lencería) para vender por temporada de verano, esto la ayudará a poder incrementar su número de clientes y como consecuencia cumplirá su cometido, ganar mucho más y  convertirse en una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 61 year old woman who fights continually to get ahead, and this is why for the last eight months she has had the great idea of creating a lingerie business. She launched with an eager anticipation and hopes of succeeding. Her daughters were the first associates in the creation of this new commercial venture, scraping together capital, successfully saving a good amount of money, which is what allowed them to start.

Rosario is very happy with the opportunity that her daughters have given her because thanks to them now she can enjoy making sales. Rosario currently lives and works in the city of Pisco, where a earthquake measuring 7.9 degrees on the Richter scale crumbled the city, but with effort and dedication the people of this beautiful city have made progress and moved ahead as they have always done.

Thanks to the help from Kiva loans, she can buy many more products (lingerie) to sell in the summer season. This will help her to increase the number of customers and thereby to fulfill her commitment, to earn much more and to become a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for summer season

loans.name: Monka Farms Group

texts.en:
Anthony is a member of the Monka Farms Group. He is 64 years old. He is married with 5 children who are living on their own.  Anthony lives with his wife in the Asebu District in the Central Region of Ghana.

Anthony has been a farmer for the past 50 years. He started his farming while in school to cater for himself but dropped out on the way. He grows limes, oranges and coconuts on 10 acre land. Anthony is now growing old and finds the maintenance of his farm difficult as it is physically demanding.   He needs to hire labourers for weeding, pruning and harvesting. 

In spite of the physical challenges of his business, Anthony is determined to maximize his output and expand his farm as much as possible. He is now applying for a loan of GHC 2,000 to help cover the labor costs of weeding, pruning and harvesting.    The loan will help Anthony to increase his crop yield and income. He will be able earn his living from the income.  He thanks all his micro-lenders for their generous financial support.

loans.use: to hire laborers for weeding, pruning and harvesting crops.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 37 years old and married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Jackson appreciates the previous loan given to him because he was able to pay school fees for his children. Jackson has a carpentry workshop as his main source of income. He also owns a transport business for a side income. Jackson has dreams of building a house, expanding his business, educating his children and buying land. However, limited capital and competition are major challenges. Jackson wants money to buy timber to make sideboards, chairs and stools to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber to make sideboards, chairs and stools to sell

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.en:
Martha is a single mother and has three sons; she started her business selling tamales, cakes and cookies of fine pastry shop and with the pass of the time she learned to make floral adjustment, so during November and December she offers her products. Martha is requesting for a loan of US$ 550 to purchase raw materials to make her products and will pay this loan in 5 months at least.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Doña Martha es una madre soltera de tres hijos, inició su negocio vendiendo tamales, pasteles y galletas de repostería fina y con el tiempo aprendió a elaborar arreglos florales por lo que durante los meses de noviembre y diciembre ofrece sus coronas de muertos. Ella esta necesitando un financiamiento por la cantidad de $ 550 USD para comprar materiales para usar en la elaboración de las coronas de flores que son tan demandadas en esta temporada y quiere pagarlo en un plazo de 5-10 meses.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Madam Lucy (middle) is a seamstress and owns a shop in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana. She sews ladies dresses and sells to shops and individuals. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 to enable her buy the fabrics and materials she needs to increase her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria X. P. lives in San Antonio Palopó. She is 40 years old. Twenty years ago she married Pedro P. Lopez and they lived with his family in Barrio Xepatul where she practiced "milpa" agriculture and grew vegetables such as peppers and tomatoes. They lived in a small one-bedroom house. The couple separated 10 years ago, and when he found another woman Maria decided to return to her village with her three children. Her children are now married and no longer live with her. Two of them live in Chimaltenango and another in San Antonio Palopó. Maria is a Catholic who follows her customs and traditions. She seeks a loan for 3,000 Guatemalan Quetzals to buy handicrafts like shawls, sashes, handbags and straps for glasses which she sells in Panajachel on Sundays and door-to-door in San Antonio Palopó. With this loan she hopes tol increase her inventory securing her own livelihood and providing for her children should the need arise.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria X. P. residente de San Antonio Palopó, ella tiene 40 años de edad, se casó a los 20 años con el señor Pedro Pérez López pero que actualmente están separados desde hace 10 años, porque el tiene otra mujer, y eso no le gusto a ella por eso se decidió regresar a su pueblo y vivir sola con sus tres hijos, cuando se casó, se fue a vivir con sus suegros en el Barrio Xepatul durante 10 años, allá estuvo trabajando en la agricultura como: en la siembra de milpa, chile, tomate y otras verduras, las casa era pequeña porque solo tenían una cocina y 1 cuarto para dormir. Sus 3 hijos ya no viven con ella, dos están en Chimaltenango y el otro esta en San Antonio Palopó, ellos ya están casados. Doña María es de religión católica y siempre sigue con sus costumbres y tradiciones. Ella dice: Que con Q 3,000.00 incrementa su capital de trabajo para la artesanía como en compra de DIADEMA, CHALINAS, GUIPIL, FAJAS, CORTE, CARTERA Y CINTA PARA LENTES, vende en el municipio de Panajachel el día domingo, pero en San Antonio Palopó siempre sale a ofrecer su venta de casa en casa, su meta ahora es aumentar la cantidad de producto que tiene para poder sobrevivir y ayudar a sus hijos cuando sea necesario.

loans.use: Bracelet and handicraft sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy damaged electronics and purchaes the pieces to fix them

loans.name: Diogo Manuel

texts.pt:
Diogo is married and is the father of 7 children. He lives in Hemoine, one of the districts of the Inhambane province, located in the south of Mozambique. He joined the program in 2006 and this is his sixth cycle. He sells kitchenware, book bags and shoes. His business has done so well that he was able to conclude the construction of his third house, which was interrupted for a long time due to lack of funds. All but three of his children are in school because they are not old enough. His wife looks after their crops, takes care of the house duties and helps him out with the sale of their products.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Diogo e casado e pai de 7 filhos. Ele vive em Homoine um dos distritos da Provincia de Inhambane que se localiza na zona sul de Mocambique. Ele entrou para o programa em 2006.Ele esta no sexto ciclo. Ele vende louca, pastas escolares,e calcado.O seu negocio esta a crescer de tal forma que ele conseguiu ja concluir a sua obra de construcao de sua residencia que estava parada ja ha muito tempo por falta de fundos. Os seus filhos estao a estudar com a excepcao dos 3 mais novos que ainda nao tem idade escolar. A sua esposa cuida da machamba e dos afazeres domesticos, mas as vezes apoia o marido na venda.

loans.use: Diogo wants to use the money to purchase more merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is 44 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver while she sells clothing for children and men in a shop in her town's central market.  On most days she works long hours, often with her older daughter (seen here in the photo).  She has been a Microinvest client for one year, and in that time has used several loans to successfully expand her business. She has come to us for a new loan to buy additional winter clothing to sell to her customers now that the weather has turned colder.

loans.use: To expand her assortment of winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Ramiro Santiago

texts.es:
Ramiro, unfortunately, became ill in his spinal column, and they needed to operate on it. The business that he had before he had to sell he could no longer attend to it, what is more he needed the money to pay for rehabilitaion and medicines. Thanks to his lust for life and the will that his three children not lack for anything, he began to move forward and thought of a business that would allow him to give money to advance his children. After thinking os it, he bought a machine for making flour tortillas and it was thus that he started. First he sold flour tortillas and little by little he would include other food products such as chile rellenos (stuffed peppers) or dishes for banquets.

Currently demand is increasing, however he finds himself without sufficient resources to make them. It is for this that Ramiro is requesting a loan of US $475 that he is set to repay in a four month term, and with this money he will be able to buy basic materials to make his products. With your help, you will succeed in helping Ramiro to move his business forward so that it can grow little by little and be converted into a legacy for his three children in case something befalls Ramiro.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramiro, desafortunadamente se enfermó de la columna, y lo tuvieron que operar, y el negocio que tenía anteriormente lo tuvo que vender porque no podía atenderlo, además de que necesitaba dinero para poder pagar las rehabilitaciones así como las medicinas. Gracias a su entusiasmo por la vida y las ganas de que a sus 3 hijos no les falte nada, comenzó a salir adelante y pensó en un negocio que le pudiera dar dinero para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante. Después de pensarlo, compró una máquina para elaborar tortillas de harina y fue así como comenzó. Primero vendía tortillas de harina y poco a poco fue incluyendo otros productos de comida, como chiles rellenos, o guisos para hacer banquetes.

Actualmente la demanda se le está incrementando, sin embargo no cuenta con recursos suficientes como para poder elaborarlos. Es por eso que Ramiro está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar materia prima para poder elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Ramiro saque adelante su negocio para que este pueda crecer poco a poco y se convierta en un patrimonio para sus tres hijos en caso de que algo le llegara a pasar a Ramiro.

loans.use: Purchase basic materials - Comprar materia prima

loans.name: Kabojja B2(B) Group

texts.en:
Sefuloza is a single mother of two children. She has a local market stall and mainly sells raw foods. She wants to use the KIVA loan to re-invest in the food business. Rose N. has a brick laying business and wants to use the loan to produce more bricks for sale. Justine is a herbalist and wants to expand business with the loan. Rose N. sells new clothes and intends to use the loan to add to her inventory.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase business inventory

loans.name: Butebe A(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She has a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more food. Ruth is 30 years old and single. She has 2 children aged 1 and 3. With the extra profits from her loan, Ruth hopes to be able to expand her business.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Hasifah N., Jane N., Harriet W., and Fill N.. Hasifah N. has a craft business and wants to add to her business. Jane N. has a local brewery and wants a loan to increase her working capital. Harriet W. operates a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Fill N. has a craft business and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add supplies and furniture to a restaurant

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Martínez is married and has two children. Her husband works in construction, so he is not salaried and sometimes doesn’t have work. Isabel decided to help her husband with the costs of feeding their children, paying bills and school fees. More than seven years ago a friend invited Isabel to help arrange flowers, and paid a bonus for the work. Afterward, Isabel learned the trade and started her own business.

Now Isabel needs $250 to purchase raw materials for her arrangements, which she will pay back in three months. Please contribute to the wellbeing of Isabel’s family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel Martínez es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la construcción, el trabajo de su esposo no es de nomina así que hay veces que no tiene trabajos, por lo que decidió apoyar a su esposo pago de la manutención de sus hijos, recibos de servicios y escuela. Hace mas de 7 años una amiga la invito a ayudarla a realizar arreglos de flores y pagarle una gratificación, después ella aprendió el oficio e inicio un negocio por su cuenta.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima para la realización de sus arreglos. Contribuyamos al bienestar de la familia de Isabel.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Materials

loans.name: Benkoma Iii Group

texts.en:
Mohamed Makie J. is the leader of the Benkoma group. He is 57 years old and is married with more than 7 children. He is well respected in the community for his efforts to encourage youth to engage in agricultural production.

The Benkoma III group wants to increase their production of rice this coming season and needs additonal capital to do so. The group members are also the members of the village bank. To increase their rice production, the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) for farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer Kemigisha`s Group

texts.en:
Jennifer is the leader of the group of five members who have stayed together since they joined MCDT. They are repaying their fourth loan. She is 30 years of age and a widow who has just lost her husband through an accident. He left her with 2 biological children 8 and 4 years old, and his own 16-year-old daughter. She left school due to pregnancy. Both of her children attend in school. Jennifer never had any loans until she joined MCDT. The community she lives in is urban within a slum in a low-lying area.

Jennifer has a retail shop and sells essential items and cold drinks. She acquired a refrigerator and a television set to attract more clients. She has many customers.

The main challenge is the flooded surroundings during the rainy season. The benefits of having her retail shop include being able to take her children to school, increased working capital, and providing for her family.

With a loan, Jennifer plans to acquire a public pay telephone. Her daughter will operate the phone, and this will increase their income. She also plans to build a house on the plot of land that her late husband left.

loans.use: Plans to acquire a public pay telephone

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en: Izzat E. is 51 years old and the father of seven children. He lives in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. Izzat makes a living repairing cars. Because costs have been high and income low in his current line of work, he is considering a new source of income. He has applied for a loan of $1,000, his first from Al Majmoua, to buy, repair and resell a used car.

loans.use: To buy, repair and resell a used car.

loans.name: Dorah's Miru Group

texts.en:
Dorah, a 32-year-old married woman with three children aged 15, 10 and 6, became a banana seller in 1998. Working daily from 8:30 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Dorah now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has a business selling bananas.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
On weekends, Raquel sells food by her neighbors requests. The other days of the week she works in a restaurant tending to customers from 6 to 11PM. In the mornings she takes care of her baby at home.

Raquel also sells clothing and sews for others.

The loans she has received have been used to buy a sandwich cart where she prepares the food she sells during the weekends. She has also invested some of the money on clothing to sell.

Raquel would like to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Todos los fines de semana, Raquel vende comida por pedido de sus vecinos. El resto de días de la semana trabaja en un restaurante atendiendo al público, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche. Por la mañana, cuida a un bebé en su casa.

Raquel también vende ropa por pedidos y hace arreglos de costura.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprarse un carrito sanguchero donde prepara la comida que vende los fines de semana. También lo ha invertido en la ropa que vende por pedidos.

A Raquel le gustaría tener un restaurante propio.

loans.use: To buy a sandwich cart to prepare the food she sells on weekends

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S. N., 30, is the mother of three children. She and her husband are brokers who buy rubber from the growers and resell it for a profit, making collectively around $5 each day. To increase their income, Mrs. Sor S. N. wants her husband to operate another business, which would enable him to earn a better income. She has humbly applied for a loan to purchase a motorbike, so that her husband can operate a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Estelí, la señora María Isabel B. se dedica al negocio de agricultura sembrando papas las cuales una vez que se da la cosecha ella la levanta y la almacena en grandes sacos para luego comercializarlos en su municipio.

La señora María Isabel hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de obtener el recurso financiero para la compra de insumos para los cultivos de papa y por este motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito oportuno que le permita dicha inversión. Es necesario destacar que ella tiene la tarea de mantener a su anciana madre y además debe de mantenerse en buena salud debido a que pronto será madre de un pequeño bebé. Por este motivo es que espera que su solicitud sea aprobada y así obtener el crédito para invertir en el negocio de siembra de papas y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su mamá y de su pequeño bebé que pronto nacerá.
texts.en:
In the city of Esteli, Mrs Maria Isabel Blandon is dedicated to the business of agriculture, planting potatoes which once they have been harvested she takes them and stores them in large bags to sell in her municipality.

Nowadays, Mrs Maria Isabel is experiencing the need to obtain financial resources to purchase items for the potato crops and that is why she is going to Ceprodel to get the appropriate credit that allows for this investment. It should be noted that she has the responsibility for taking care of her elderly mother and also to keep in good health because she will soon be the mother of a small baby. For this reason she hopes her application is approved, and thus get credit for investing in the business of planting potatoes and continue with taking care of her mother and her little baby who will be born soon.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of items for potato crop

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: LA FAMILIA DE SANTOS COMPUESTA POR 5  PERSONAS: ÉL, SU CONCUBINA Y SUS TRES HIJOS QUE TIENEN 8, 6 Y 4 AÑOS RESPECTIVAMENTE. ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN UNA CASA POR LA CUÁL PAGAN ALQUILER. SANTOS ES EMPLEADO FIJO DE LA EMPRESA DE ACEITE FINO, DONDE SE DESEMPEÑA EN EL CARGO DE OPERADOR DE SOYA DESDE EL AÑO 2003. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU VIVIENDA. SUS ANTERIORES OPERACIONES FUERON CANCELADAS CON UNA BUENA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD.
texts.en:
There are 5 people in Santos’s family: himself, his common-law wife, and their three children, aged 8, 6, and 4. They currently live in a home which they rent. Santos has worked full-time at the Fino soybean oil factory since 2003. He plans to use his loan to purchase materials for the construction of his home. He has paid off his prior loans very responsibly and punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es:
La señora Loyda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Románticas”, ubicado en el Jr. Sheshea Mz. 17 Lt. 7, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y viaja a las zonas rurales a vender la mercadería a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una docena de faldas, 2 docenas de polos, 2 docenas de blusas, 1 docena de sandalias y zapatos, etc.

Loyda manifiesta alegría porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su habilidad para el trabajo
texts.en:
Loyda belongs to “Las Románticas” Community Bank, located in Manantay district, Coronel Portillo province in the department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and the mother of two minor children who still depend on her. She is married, and her husband is employed independently.

With her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of soft drinks. She has been working with the community bank for two years.

Now she sells clothes and shoes and travels to rural areas to sell merchandise to her customers.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a dozen skirts, two dozen polo shirts, two dozen blouses, a dozen sandals and shoes, etc.

Loyda is happy because of everything she has achieved thanks to her ability to work.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1-2 dozen each of skirts, polo shirts, blouses, sandals, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica W. sells local brews and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Monica is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. They have four children, all of whom attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a small shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a small shop

loans.name: Fransisco Matilde

texts.es:
Don Francisco Matilde Hernández S. tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es casado y el numero de hijos que tiene son 7, el varón de 18 años cursa el sexto grado de primaria, el varón de 16 también cursa el sexto grado de primaria, la niña de 14 años cursa el primer año de secundaria, la niña de 12 años cursa el sexto grado de primaria, la niña de 10 años cursa el quinto grado de primaria, la niña de 8 años cursa el tercer grado de primaria y el niño menor que tiene 7 años de edad cursa el segundo grado, de primaria, su compañera de vida es ama de casa y le ayuda en el cuido del negocio, los propósitos de Don Francisco Hernández son ampliar su negocio y ser la mejor pulpería de su sector para abastecer a muchos clientes y de esta manera lograr mas ingresos que sustenten el bienestar de su familia, sus deseos son que sus hijos puedan salir adelante con la ayuda de el y su esposa, pero sobretodo de Dios, además desea que Dios le de salud para poder trabajar y terminar de encaminar a sus hijos en la vida, su sueño es salir de la pobreza y emprender variedades de negocios en el que sus hijos sean unos profesionales y puedan desempeñar sus carreras en estos, también construir una buena casa y tener una vejez feliz

La actividad económica en la que se desempeña Don Francisco es la venta de leña y una pulpería, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 9 años y que con mucha lucha ha podido mantener, ya que el es el único que trabaja porque su esposa se mantiene al cuidado de los niños, es de saber que Don Francisco ha tenido dificultades económicas pero como buen comerciante ha sabido hacerle frente a dichas situaciones, en su pulpería el vende productos tales como: jabón, pan, pastas, galletas, cepillos, productos higiénicos, granos básicos, y otros productos mas que con frecuencia la población cercana a su pulpería, le llega a comprar, con la ayuda de su esposa Don Francisco ha podido sacar adelante su negocio, mientras su esposa atiende el negocio, Don Francisco vende la leña, algunas veces en su misma casa de habitación y otras veces el las va a distribuir a sus clientes, Don Francisco necesita el financiamiento para invertir en el capital de trabajo, pues el desea comprar mayor cantidad de productos para surtir su negocio y facilitar a los pobladores aledaños a su negocio los artículos que ellos deseen.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Matilde Hernández S. is 37 years old, married, and has 7 children. His 18 year old son is in sixth grade of primary school, his 16 year old son is also in sixth grade of primary school, his 14 years old daughter is in first year of secondary school, his 12 years old daughter is in sixth grade of primary school, his 10 year old daughter is in fifth grade of primary school, his 8 years old daughter is in third grade of primary school, and the youngest 7 year old son is in second grade of primary school. His wife is a housewife and helps with the business. Francisco plans to expand his business and be the best grocery store in his area in order to meet his customer’s needs and in this way generate more income to support his family. His wishes include his children becoming successful with the help of him and his spouse, but above all with God’s help. In addition he wishes that God gives him good health to be able to work and finish guiding his children throughout life. His dream is rising out of poverty and starting various businesses in which his children can be professionals and can have their careers through these businesses. He also wishes to build a good house and have happy golden years. Francisco sells firewood and has his grocery store, businesses he has had for 9 years and with great effort has maintained. He is the only one that works because his wife takes care of the children. Francisco has had some economic difficulties but like any good businessman he has known how to confront these situations. In his store he sells products such as: Soap, bread, pasta, cookies, brushes, hygiene products, basic grains, and other products his neighborhood customers need that the come to buy from him. With the help of his wife Francisco has been able to be successful in his business. While his wife attends to the business Francisco sells firewood, sometimes from his home, other times he goes and delivers it to his customers. Francisco needs financing to have working capital for his business, as he wishes to buy a large quantity of products to stock his business and meet his customer’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy large quantities to stock his store

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Ayush J., 46, lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Her son is a university student and her daughter stays at home. In 1995, her family moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, because her daughter got sick and needed long-term medical help from a bigger hospital. Ayush's husband is employed by a privately held company as an electrician. 

Ayush stayed at home to take care of her daughter until 2006. In 2006, she began to work as a saleswoman at someone's food stall at the local market, Enhjin. In 2007, after she had gained experience, she started running her own tiny business by renting a food stall at the same market. Ayush took a loan from the bank to buy food products, including pickles, mayonnaise and several types of bottled salads to create a business inventory. From her business profits, she repaid the full amount of the loan. 

Now Ayush's son helps her business. The monthly rent she pays for her stall is 80,000 MNT ($1.00 USD=1500 MNT). Her daily average income is 40,000-60,000 MNT. She earns a profit of around 20 percent. From the business profit, she paid for her son's tuition. With this loan, Ayush will invest in more of the food products that she buys from wholesalers.

loans.use: Buy more food products for her food stall

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Dần, năm nay 54 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Từ sau khi tham gia Quỹ vào năm 2008, chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn để đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh của gia đình. Hiện nay, thu nhập chính của gia đình là  hơn 100.000/ ngày từ hoạt động bán lân đạm và ghim chiếu của chồng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 6.000.000 để mua thêm đạm về bán, tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 54 years old, lives in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. After joining the Fund in 2008, she has borrowed money to invest in the family's business. Currently, the income of the family is VND100,000 per day from selling fertilizers and her husband's mat weaving.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND6,000,000 to buy more nitrogenous fertilizer to resell to get extra income for the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to resell

loans.name: Djamal

texts.en: Djamal is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Mahmudlu-2 village. He was born in 1977. This man is married and has 4 children. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs for improving his business. He has 5 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Safarali

texts.en:
O. Safarali is a simple farmer with simple dreams – to uplift his family’s economic life and to be able to send his dearest little son to school in future. Farming has been his major source of income. Safarali produces wheat, rice and onion. Because of the expensive farm inputs, traders buy their rice products at a lower price. Hence, he requests a loan of US $850 to support his farming business and to avoid asking credits from traders who charge higher interest. He is grateful that he is able to borrow from Kiva lenders who offer lesser interest and create better opportunities for him, thus helping his family to become poverty free. Safarali believes that through prayers and hard work he can achieve his dreams someday. Educating his son is one of his priorities. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers to improve business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
"I started selling food since 2009. Every day I go out to the street and sell food to elementary pupils to earn a living. I am one of the maker of "puto" a special kind of delicacy in Talibon, Bohol", says Anecita D., 48-year-old mother of seven.

She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food business. She is also interested in venturing into other lines of business to better support her family.

CEVI aims to help small businesses like hers to grow. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
AMANDA Q. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO II-CAF” vive en la AA.HH.EL ENCANTO.Mz.C.Lt.6. en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 40 años de edad, 04 hijos, y su esposo es moto taxista (transportista).

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles inició en el negocio de venta de salchipapas (comida al paso) por las tardes y noches.  Con el pasar de tiempo su carrito salchipapero se malogró, actualmente durante el día vende frutas y verduras.  

La buena atención y carisma que la caracteriza ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes y ha sido necesario incrementar su capital.
Con este  préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en reparar su carrito salchipapero y el resto en insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene, y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Amanda Q. H. belongs to the “Rumbo al Éxito II-CAF” Communal Bank and lives at AA.HH. El Encanto, Mz. C., Lt. 6 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 40 years old, has 4 children, and her husband is a moto-taxi driver.
With her first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles, she started her business selling salchipapas (street food) in the afternoons and evenings. With the passing of time her salchipapero cart has broken down and now she sells fruits and vegetables during the day.
Her good service and charisma have attracted many customers and it has been necessary to increase her capital. With this loan of S/.1,200.00 nuevos soles, she will repair her salchipapero cart and use the rest to purchase ingredients used in making her dishes.
She says that Manuela Ramos is the only organisation she works with because they provide low interest and make it easy to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and to repair her street cart.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.en: B. Habibullo lives in the town of Isfara along with his family. Through much effort he dedicates himself to the production of potatoes, onions and watermelons. He tends to his crops himself, with the help of one brother. One of Habibullo’s biggest problems is the marketing of his product and, due to distance, he sells his crop piecemeal which reduces his income to support the family. He has asked for a loan of 2,500 Somoni that will be spent on the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. This would allow him greater earnings which, in turn, would improve his family’s standard of living. His biggest desire is to participate in this future venture so he can improve his profits and provide a better life for his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Edna is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture selling health and medicinal products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health and medicinal products to tourists and local community members. Edna has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth C., 35, has been involved in a business of selling very popular Cambodian noodles at a tourist place in Seim Reap Province near Tonle Sap Lake with a typical income of US $20 per day. C. and her husband work very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family.

C. and her husband are blessed with four school-aged children. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who usually earns an income of US $5 per day. He provides his transportation services to local people in his town and tourists as well. However, C. really wants to take a loan of US $200 for her husband to operate another business of buying fish from the fishermen at the lake and transporting them to sell at the local markets to make a plan for repairing her house feasible.

loans.use: buying fish and transporting to market

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Ms. Pisey C., age 30, is single and lives with her parents on an Island of the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three brothers, one of whom is a construction worker, and two sisters. One of her sisters has full-time employment and the other one weaves silk at home.

Pisey has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

Pisey is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her sister to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister to use to drive to work

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: La dame Aby D. est âgée de 61 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle tient un étal ou elle vend des fruits de saison. Les revenus générés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aby D. is a lady who is 61 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She has a stall where she sells seasonal fruit. The revenues generated enable her to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit in season

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren L. owns a 2-hectare rice field that he tills because it is his only source of income for his family. Now that his family needs more support for food, clothing and other basic needs, the income that he makes from growing rice is not enough. He is skillful in raising hogs, so he was encouraged to start a small piggery to supplement their income. 

In August 2008 he heard that CEV offers low interest rate, which is quite interesting and beneficial for business starts. So he decided to be a member of a cluster organization and used his 1st loan for hog supplements and also for some financing needs. 

Now, he is applying for a loan of Php 10,000.00 so he could buy feed for his hogs.

loans.use: Hog Feed

loans.name: James

texts.en: James W. has been making furniture in Naivasha town for the last eleven years. He is 50 years old and married to Pauline Wanjiku and they have two school-going children. James heard about KADET through the marketing promotions done by the company staff. This will be his second loan with the organization and he plans to buy more timber as material for his business. He paid off his first loan well and he used that money to buy new tools for his trade to replace the older ones. James intends to continue growing the size of his workshop and to employ someone who will help him in carpentry as his production and number of orders increase. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more timber for his business

loans.name: Toeng

texts.en: Toeng S., aged 51, is a married woman blessed with five children. Four of them are married and have already started new homes, while the other one is single and employed in the garment industry. She sells a variety of cakes, which her husband produces, in front of a factory for garment workers. After Toeng S. finishes selling, she goes to buy her essential ingredients at the market for her husband to make more cakes. Her sales are going well because her customers recognize the good quality of her cakes. To make her business more successful, Toeng S. is looking for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her business

loans.name: David Onyango

texts.en:
David Onyango is 27 years old. He operates a general retail shop in Manyatta, a low-cost settlement area in the outskirts of Kisumu city. He has been in this business for the last three years. 

This is David's third loan from KADET Ltd., a Kiva partner. He will use these funds to purchase more stock for his shop and to diversify into a number of items that he has not stocked before, like dairy products.

He aspires to purchase a plot of land and develop it, with an ultimate aim to move the business there.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase stock for his general retail shop, including dairy products

loans.name: On Time Traders Group

texts.en:
This is the On-Time Traders Group. They are small-scale businesspeople who live and work in the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT for the first time for a loan of Le 500,000 so that they can expand their businesses. This loan will allow them to buy more items to sell, generate more sales and earn more profits. This will, in turn, mean a better standard of living, including more clothing, food and education for their children. 

Adama Fornah (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Matotoka village, about eight miles from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is now about 45 years old and is married to a businessman. They have five children – one in secondary school, one in primary school and the others not yet old enough to attend classes. She makes a living selling cakes, rice and groundnuts, and has been in this line of work for many years.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies that can be made into cakes and snacks to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana, married with a grown daughter, lives in Nikopol and sells women’s suits and knitted wear. She owns two vending locations at different city markets. Her merchandise always sells well because of the lower price policy she has set in her kiosks. She has a loyal clientele, some whom even come from other cities to buy from her. A hard worker who usually works late hours, Tatyana has been in the trade for 10 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnyas. Monthly net profit is usually about 5,000 Grivnyas.

Tatyana, always very committed to her family, tries to provide the best for her daughter, a college student. She is now requesting a loan of 13,000 Grivnyas to buy assorted merchandise for her vending locations to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Zagdhuu

texts.en:
Zagdhuu L. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Two of her sons currently attend university and her only daughter is a secondary school student. L. and her husband operate a small grocery shop in their town, selling a variety of Mongolian and imported food products. L. started her business in 1999, at first selling only baked goods which she made at home. After having success with her baked goods she saved enough money to rent a small workroom which she now owns. L. is planning to expand her business in the near future and hopes to make a wider variety of baked goods. She is focused on supporting her children and says, “I need to save for my children's education.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tools and equipment for her business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans.
