La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su préstamo en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate ClotilD. is a member of the community bank "INTIWATANA”. She lives in the town of Pisac located in the province of Calca, department of Cusco. She is 40 minutes away from the city, in a small town with many beautiful Inca structures. It is a town that is visited by all tourists that come to the city of Cusco. The member is 58 years old, married and has two children of 33 and 30 years of age. She divides her time between activities of running her home and a retail business. She is a craftswoman, buys and sells crafts and silver goods. She has a stand in the main plaza of her town of Pisac. It is a few meters away from the archaeological complex of Pisac. She has beautiful works in silver such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, brooches, all very well crafted. Our member is requesting a loan to be able to invest it in raw materials for the making of her crafts, finishing materials of colors with natural oxides and purchase of stones and silver for the making of the jewelry. The member appreciates and values the opportunity that this medium offers her and therefore she promises to comply with the payment terms of the loan in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The associate requests a loan for the purchase of raw materials for the design and production of crafts and silver goods.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena es casada y tiene 1 hijo, el cual es ya mayor de edad y vive aparte con su propia familia. La señora tiene un negocio de sastrería y costura, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 21 años, debido a que ella siempre había deseado ser modista, la verdad aduce la señora, es que le gusto y desde ese tiempo se dedica a eso. Ella empezó con este negocio, después de que unas amigas le enseñaran a coser y sus mismas amigas le enviaban clientes para que practicara y se diera a conocer. Después fue ampliando su negocio, ya que ofrecía un buen servicio y los mismos clientes se encargaban de enviarles a otros clientes. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de telas y materiales para elaborar uniformes escolares, ya que la entrada a clases y quiere aprovechar esta fecha. El sueño que tiene la señora, es ampliar su negocio que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia, además la señora desea tener un negocio más grande para poder ofrecer empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is married and has an adult son who lives with his own family. She is a seamstress and has her shop in her home. She started this business 21 years ago because she always wanted to be a clothing designer. She states that she always liked this work and has been involved in it all this time. She began with this business after some friends taught her to sew. It was these very same friends that would recommend customers to her so that she could practice and become known. After, she began to expand because she gave good service and her customers then started to recommend others to her. The funds requested will be used to buy fabric and supplies to make school uniforms since the new school term is about to start and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity this offers. Her dream is to expand her business so that she and her family can have better economic stability. Besides, she would like to have a larger business so that she can offer employment to others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en:
Faleseu T. is 35 and married with 5 children (ages 2 - 15).  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Faleseu has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faleseu needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Faleseu joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faleseu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faleseu T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat E. is a happy and hard working woman. She sells maize at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually residents and friends. The demands for her maize are high in her community because maize can be used to cook various mouth-watering Nigerian foods. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more maize to sell. She is married with 4 children and her children are doing well at school. She is 37 years old and her husband also works to support their household. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina García C.  es un señora de 69 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.


Durante toda su vida Doña Marina  y su familia  se han dedicado  a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. 

Asegura que gracias a este proyecto su vida y la de su familia han mejorado de gran manera  por lo tanto, lo que en estos momentos solicita doña Carmen  es un micro crédito de ¢657,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y siete mil colones), para comprar 4 vacas mas que son de muy buena calidad  que ella ya conoce  y de esta manera  poder incrementar la producción. Ella es consciente de que contar con mayor número de vacas implica una mayor atención y cuidado. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa y mejorar las condiciones de vida propias y las de su familia la motivan a esforzarse con gran esmero.

Doña Marina forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo pero doña Marina destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Marina García C. is a 69 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the community of Caño Negro, located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community lies in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are ranching and farming, with a specific emphasis on the cultivation of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Throughout her life, Doña Marina and her family have been dedicated to raising cattle. She sells to her neighbors in her community, who are very satisfied with the quality of the products she offers. In her particular case, demand is greater than what she can currently offer.

Thanks to her life’s work, she says her family has improved greatly. At the moment, Doña Marina is requesting a loan of 657,000 CRC to buy four cows that are of good quality so that she can increase her production. She is aware that having more cows means providing more attention and care. Nonetheless, her desire to be a successful micro-entrepreneur and improve her family’s living conditions encourages her to strive with caution.

Doña Marina is part of the Emcrecoba Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan. Doña Marina expresses her thanks for these types of organizations and credit facilitators who are able to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four cows

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es:
Maria Veronica es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 5 años de edad en su vivienda ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace mas de un año. Empezó ofreciendo productos por catálogo en base a pedidos a sus vecinos y conocidos y luego pudo ampliar poco a poco su negocio, actualmente cuenta con un pequeño stock en su vivienda que ha podido adquirir con algunas de las ganancias obtenidas de ventas anteriores. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la economía de su familia por lo que ella da lo mejor de si para salir adelante.

María Verónica desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza de modo que pueda ampliar su stock y poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María Verónica es una mujer bastante trabajadora y empeñosa. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener una bodega mas grande donde pueda seguir ofreciendo sus productos cosméticos.
texts.en:
María Verónica is a 36 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 5, in her own home located in the District of Cayaltí. This community is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

María Verónica has been selling beauty products for more than a year. She began offering products by catalog and taking orders from her neighbors and acquaintances. Sometime later, she was able to gradually increase her business. María Verónica currently has a small stock of products at home, but she will be able to acquire some items with the earnings from her previous sales. This business is an important source of income for her to provide her family the best so that they can get ahead.

María Verónica wants to expand her business by purchasing more beauty products to increase her stock and offer a wider variety of merchandise to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can achieve this goal.

María Verónica is a hardworking determined woman. Her dream is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and have a large store where she can offer her cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Hemalatha

texts.en:
Hemalatha is a hard-working, 42-year-old married woman living with her husband, two sons, and two daughters in Telijjawila, in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She and her husband have managed a vegetable cultivation business for a long time. They are very close and work well together.  

Hemalatha has asked for a loan of  20,000 LKR from BRAC to purchase manure and seeds in hopes of improving their yield.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy manure and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Kev

texts.en: Mrs. S., 50, lives in the best territory of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia, where she has owned a plot of land since 1995. She grows vegetables, which she plants twice a year. She sells the matured crops to buyers who take them to sell retail at the market. S. is a good mother to her four school-aged children. Her husband works with her on the farm. Mrs. S. has a son who is unemployed. He wants to get a suitable job, but he needs money to pay for a service fee to have a job. This is why Mrs. S. has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To pay a service fee for a job.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella A. is from the village of District 3. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Bella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Bella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
37-year-old, Rebecca T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. She is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than twenty years now. She and her husband spend time at their farm making sure it will be productive. She says she dreams for her business to prosper and for her children to finish college someday.

Rebecca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rebecca from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Kausar Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Kausar parveen is the wife of S. A.. She is the mother of six children, three sons and three daughters. This family lives in a three-room brick house in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Kausar is a housewife and takes care of her young children and her family.

S. runs a grocery shop while his eldest son is a driver by trade. His son has nine years of driving experience. Kausar has applied for a loan for the second time from Asasah so her husband can expand his business. With the loan he will buy groceries in bulk and expand his grocery shop.  

They hope that from the profit of this loan they will make their brick house into a cement house.

loans.use: Purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona M. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old and married. To make a living, Alona owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alona is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.en:
Zulaikho is a 49 year old married mother of three children. Her husband is a taxi driever. Zulaikho started her business in 2001 in order to support her family. All year she sells fruits and vegetables that she buys from local farmers. With the loan of 5000 TJS from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her products and to buy apples, pears, grapes, peaches, and other fruits. Zulaikho strives to give her children a better life, including supporting them through a high level of education. With her business, she has been able to supply the community with fresh fruits and also provide for her family. Zulaikho is a well-spoken, friendly business woman who is worthy of the support of Kiva partners.   
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Tp increase selection of fruits

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel P. is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Hazel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hazel owns & operates a business selling cosmetic and fragrance products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic and fragrance to  local community members. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hazel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Hazel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Tommy

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Tommy. He is married and has two children aged 8 and 13 years. He has one additional dependant who lives with him because they need help with their education. In 2004, Tommy established a business selling ready-to-wear items such as shoes and clothes. He began his business to help him generate income to support his family. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. Tommy would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more stock and make more profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Tommy plans to open a shop and start an internal business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes

loans.name: Natsagmaa

texts.en:
Natsagmaa H. is 32 years old and lives with her father, husband, and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in their own apartment. Her father is retired and stays at home while her two daughters both attend local secondary school. 

Natsagmaa currently operates a small bakery in her local area. She started her own business in 2006 by importing cars from Japan to sell for a profit after working as a manager in the Best Land C., Ltd between 2003 and 2005. She operated a children's clothes trading business in the Narlag trade center in 2008 and has been managing a bakery business since 2009, making a variety of breads and baked pastries. She runs her bakery production in a rented space and produces eight types of bread and pastry to supply  to up to eight different places/organizations. She pays rental fees of 300,000 MNT per month. 

Over the short period of operation, she has managed to increase her working capital and has built up a stable and successful business. Also, she was able to hire two more workers. She pays a monthly salary of 500,000 MNT each to her employees. Her monthly average net profit is between 500,000 and 600,000 MNT. 

She is a very active, diligent and hardworking businesswoman and says, “ I am saving money for my children's future education." Natsagmaa is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT  loan. She will use this loan to purchase cake boxes at 700,000 MNT and with other monies left over from the loan plus her own cash, she is planning to buy a new micro bus for her bakery business.

loans.use: To buy a new micro bus for her bakery products

loans.name: Rafoatkhon

texts.en:
Rafoatkhon is married with two children. She runs a small business selling groceries at a local market. Rafoatkhon has been in this business for 10 years. She is very industrious and a hard worker. Her integrity, determination and perseverance have ensured the sustainability and growth of her business. Rafoatkhon has gradually been able to save some money and reinvest it in her business. Between these savings and loans from IMON International, she has been able to increase her inventory and sales volume. Rafoatkhon is requesting a loan for 12,000 Somoni that will allow her to increase her assortment of inventory. She is planning to buy food products wholesale for further retail sales. This loan will help Rafoatkhon increase her inventory and cater to an ever-increasing number of customers, further promoting stable expansion for her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of products

loans.name: Noly

texts.en:
Noly D. is a 61-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Food Vending businesses. She lives in Gatuslao Street, Brgy. 3, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her   General Store and Food Vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 8,000. Noly is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Noly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N., 18, lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is not currently in school. Susan has a stone quarrying business, which she has had for two years, as well as a salon.

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a dryer and oil treatment for her salon. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Susan hopes to own a plot. Susan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer and oil treatment for hair

loans.name: Unisi

texts.en:
Unisi N. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.     Unisi has a business of selling new shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Unisi sells her products in the Old tax park in Kampala city by means of retail.

Unisi has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand shoes. The main business challenge(s) for Unisi include the rainy season and ever increasing prices of second hand shoes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second hand shoes and also to be a wholesaler. Unisi lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man and the father of two young children still attending primary school. He is an experienced carpenter, who has owned his shop for almost 15 years. He works very hard because he is the main income provider and he is responsible for two young children. As he says, he wants to offer the best life for them. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a wood-sanding machine in order to expand his business operation. In the future, he hopes to conduct his work properly and continue the development of his business.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-sanding machine

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 40 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 1 month and 16 years old. Jean takes care of two other dependents. 

Jean works as a motorbike taxi driver and this is his fourth year in his business. He gets up at 5 a.m. every day and works until 8 p.m. 

Jean has requested a loan to buy his own motorbike taxi. With the profits from this loan, he will save for the future, pay school fees and be able to build his own house for the family.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Sulaika's Group

texts.en:
Sulaika T., 61, is treasurer of this four-person loan group. She lives in the town of Toktogul and is a widow who has raised six children. She receives a pension, but supplements her income by breeding livestock. She started her business 10 years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, and now earns about 3,000 soms a month. With the money she earns from this loan, she plans to buy more cattle for breeding. Her goal is to continue expanding her business so that she can help her children support their families. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and watch a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy cattle for breeding

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is a 33-year-old single man who supports his family by operating two business ventures: seaweed culturing and fishing. He lives in Bantayan, Cebu. Bonifacio joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bonifacio has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for his 10th loan, he is borrowing PHP 11,000, which he intends to use to buy fishing gear and equipment so that he can continue to save up for the future expansion of his business. Bonifacio is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Cintya Rosana

texts.en:
Ms. Cintya is married with two school-aged children. She works in the soft drink business in downtown Ciudad del Este. Her business is going very well and generating a good income. Her husband and family help with the business and they are moving forward with a lot of sacrifice and hard work.

Today, Ms. Cintya is a successful micro-entrepreneur with a growing number of customers. She is an honest and responsible person who is committed to expanding her business.

loans.use: buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his house.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Carlos O. esta pidiendo un crédito para poder comprar herramientas para su trabajo el cual es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia.
El tiene tiempo con su taller de auto mecánica al cual le están haciendo falta algunas herramientas para poder dar el servicio esperado  de los clientes,  por lo cual el señor Carlos desea poder comprar las herramientas necesarias  para así no perder clientes por dar un mal servicio, ya que él es el sustento de su esposa y sus dos hijos a los cuales desea brindarles lo mejor.
El pagara este adeudo con los ingresos de su taller.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos O. has requested a loan to buy tools for his work which is the main source of income for his family.  He has an auto repair shop which he has been running for some time but he is in need of tools so he can provide better service to customers.  With the necessary tools he won't stand the risk of losing customers due to bad service.  He is the sole provider for his wife and two children and he wants to be able to give them the best lifestyle he can.

He will make payments on the loan with the income he receives from the workshop.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Junior

texts.en:
Junior B., age 46, raises pigs for fattening and sale. Junior has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP during every quarter that pigs are sold. Junior is from the village of Baracbac Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya. He and his wife have three school-aged children. 

Junior has just recently joined ASKI in order to gain access to financial services. He wants to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Junior is requesting his first loan from ASKI in the amount of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien T. T., 27 years old with one small child, lives in Ly nhan village. Being a farmer,she grows rice and vegetables, and also raises pigs for meat. A part of the agricultural products is used to support her family, and the rest is sold for money to provide her daily income.

In order to create savings, she bought a rice making machine - a machine that turns raw rice into a product for daily food. Every day, she gets 100,000 Vietnamese dong profit. Ms. Lien has been a client of our program since 2007, and she has used loans effectively in expanding her business. For this new loan cycle, she wants to borrow money to maintain the machine.

loans.use: to maintain the machine.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. He is 42 years old and still single. Marlon grows rice and sells his harvest to the market. He also raises pigs in his backyard. Marlon works hard to improve his businesses. 

Marlon's loan will be used to purchase feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso A. tiene 63 años de edad, esta casado y vive con su esposa y dos de sus hijos.
Celso se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion ubicada en la aldea La Caucara de San Lorenzo. 
don Celso es muy trabajador y responsable, por las noches trabaja en una empacadora de camarones en el area de limpieza.
cuando el sale a trabajar por las noches su esposa es quien se dedica a la pulperia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.
Su sueño es que todos sus hijos esten bien y que busquen de Dios.
texts.en:
Mr. Celso A. is 63 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife and their two children. Celso sells groceries from a store installed in his house. It is located in the village of La Caucara in San Lorenzo.

Celso is very hard working and responsible. During the night he works as a janitor at a shrimp packaging plant. When he goes out to work at night his wife is who manages the store. 

The loan will be used to purchase groceries to supply his business.

His dream is that all of his children be well and that they look to God.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply his store.

loans.name: Anahi

texts.es: Anahi, de 26 años es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Almendra de 6 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Anahi esta ubicado en el ovalo el Zapallal del distrito de Puente Piedra en Lima, ella se dedica a la venta de bisutería y su tienda es una de las más concurridas, ya que la joyería que vende es muy bonita y de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual poco a poco su negocio esta creciendo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus joyas ya que siempre hay personas que quieren robarle. En adelante espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio, para poder vender más joyas. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy cumplida y activa. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más bisutería para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Anahi, who is 26 years old, is a very kind and uncomplicated woman. She lives in her own house with her beloved daughter, Almendra, who is 6 years old and to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.

Anahi's business is located in the Zapallal oval in the district of Puente Piedra in Lima. She sells costume jewelry, and her store is one of the busiest, since the jewelry that she sells is very pretty and of good quality, which is the reason why her business is growing little by little. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers. She has had this business for a year, and she finds that the most difficult part is having to care for her jewelry, since there are always people who would like to rob her. In the future she wants to expand the installations at her business, so that she will be able to sell more jewels. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to make all her payments on time if she wants to have access to another loan. In her communal bank, she is a very courteous and active member. With the 600 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more jewelry to stock her store better.

loans.use: to buy more costume jewelry to stock her store.

loans.name: Lida Mercedes

texts.es:
Lida Mercedes tiene 28 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Lida Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un acasa para lo hijos.

Le gusta bailar en las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Lida Merecedes is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of De los Rios. 

The members of the “Señor de la Salud” communal bank, located in Recinto Soloma, part of the cantón of Echeandia. This communal bank works in agriculture, planting corn and rice.

Lida Merecedes works in agriculture and plants corn and rice. She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells them in the markets every day, especially the one on Sundays.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. With the support of this loan, she will be able to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as insect infestations and plant diseases in her plants, and also variable weather. Her dream is to buy a house for her children.

She likes to dance at the fiestas in her town.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling cosmetics in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the holiday and wedding season, the demand is high compared to other seasons. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Abla Emefa

texts.fr: Abla  est à son premier  crédit  dans notre institution  et est une bonne revendeuse  de charbon de bois car elle maîtrise bien son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Anié(Atakpamé) puis revend  à domicile Abla est célibataire sans enfant et à 35 ans, elle  fait de son mieux pour prendre soin d’elle.
texts.en: Abla is on her first loan with our institution and is a skilled retailer of charcoal, since she manages her business well. She gets her supplies at Anié (Atakpamé), and then re-sells them at her home. Abla is unmarried, has no children, and at 35 years of age does her best to take care of herself.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Liza Jane

texts.en:
Liza Jane is married with two children. Liza Jane is 22 years old and lives in El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Liza Jane has a general store business. She has had this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns approximately 12,000 PHP. She has requested for 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Liza Jane has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Liza Jane hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

location.town: Liloy-El Paraiso, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa de treinta y ocho años de edad vive en casa propia con sus siete hijos. Ella posee un puesto de verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de la localidad donde reside, vende todo tipo de verduras y la gente la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan a un buen precio y con excelente servicio. Nicolasa es una mujer emprendedora y llena de energía en el trabajo para ella la clave de su futuro está escondida en su vida diaria y está dispuesta a encontrarla es por eso que le solicita a integral un crédito que le permita comprar verduras para surtir el puesto como ayote, pipianes, ejotes, limones, hiervas, yuca entre otros, así lograra mantener a flote su negocio y lo verá crecer día con día. Nicolasa tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her seven children.  She owns a vegetable stall in the market in her town where she sells all types of vegetables.  People prefer to buy from her because she always has what they need at a good price and she provides excellent service.  Nicolasa is an entrepreneurial woman who is full of energy for her work.

For Nicolasa, the key to her future is hidden in her daily life and she is ready to find it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow her to buy vegetables with which to stock her stall such as squash, pipian (a type of squash), green beans, lemons, herbs, cassava, etc.  In this way, she will keep her business afloat and she will watch it grow day by day.  Nicolasa is confident that, in this way, she will be able to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy squash, pipian, green beans, lemons, herbs and cassava

loans.name: Raquel Jacqueline

texts.es:
Raquel de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Raquel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, patos y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Raquel es una madre trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es poder superarse y  mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Raquel, 24, lives with her husband and children in their own home, which lacks basic utilities and is located in a rural area in the Mochumi district of the department of Lambayeque.  This area is known for its farming and animal husbandry.

Raquel has been raising and selling poultry (hens, ducks and turkeys) for a number of years.  Her corral is located in the back of her house, and it is adequate and roomy.  She feeds them with balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they reach an optimal size, she sells them in different markets in the area and thus obtains good earnings to pay her household expenses.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles to buy more balanced feed for her animals.  With the income that she will earn, she will pay off the loan and improve her quality of life.  Raquel is a hardworking and dedicated woman.  The only thing that she wants is to be able to get ahead and improve economically.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nelfa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nelfa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Germain

texts.es:
Germain, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, todos dependen económicamente de él, Germain aprendió la actividad agropecuaria con unos amigos, no tiene horario establecido para atender dichas labores.
Actualmente comprara insumos para realizar la siembra de granos básicos, como lo son abono y herbicidas, para el cuido de la plantación, esto le permitirá estar al pendiente y evitar que se dañe el cultivo.
El objetivo de él es crecer en la agricultura, que sean provechosas sus cosechas y vivir en armonía en el hogar.
texts.en:
Germain works in agriculture and lives with his wife and two children, all of whom depend on him financially. Germain learned about farming from his friends. He does not have a fixed schedule for his duties.

He will purchase supplies, like fertilizer and herbicides, so that he can care for his crop fields. This will allow him to avoid any damage to his crops.

His goal is to grow in agriculture, to have profitable harvests, and to have harmony in the home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides for his cornfield.

loans.name: Benedeta

texts.en:
Benedeta runs a grocery business. She has been in this business for five years and she has one employee. 

She started by selling only bananas, and she was able to add a variety of fruits and vegetables after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya. Her business has improved as a result, and she can now afford to pay school fees for her children without strain.

Benedeta hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy tomatoes, bananas, onions, and potatoes to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bananas, onions, and potatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.es:
Emeterio de 32 años, soltero, pero tiene 01 hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia.
Cuando era joven, siempre tuvo el anhelo de tener una profesión, y gracias a su esfuerzo logró culminar sus estudios en un instituto técnico, en la carrera de agricultura, pero aún no lo ejerce. Si embargo, monto un restaurante vendiendo pollo a la brasa, actualmente le va bien, por lo que tiene afliencia de gente. Hasta el momento le va bien el negocio,  lo único que debe hacre es tartar de dar un mejor servicio y ganar más clientes. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en efectivizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará más muebles para acondicionar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Emeterio, 32, is single and has a child.  They live together in his own home which is located in the Sivia district.

When he was young, he always had the desire to become a professional.  Thanks to his hard work he managed to get a degree in agriculture from a technical institute, but as of yet he is not working in this area.  However, he started up a roasted chicken restaurant that is now doing very well, as he is getting a lot of customers.  So far, his business has done well; all he needs to do now is to continue to provide good service and attract more customers.  This will be his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

With the 2,000 Peruvian soles, he will buy more furniture in order to better equip his restaurant.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his restaurant

loans.name: Ledie Claire

texts.en:
Ledie Claire is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Ledie Claire has a food shop where she sells barbecue and hotdog kebabs. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for her business.
Ledie Claire has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ledie Claire hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for barbecue and hotdog sales.

loans.name: Maria Emma

texts.es: La señora Maria  es cliente nueva, es una persona joven que se dedica a l servicio de peluquería, realiza cortes, masajes, peinados, depilaciones, etc. en su domicilio donde tiene un salón de belleza y a veces en los domicilios de sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios, ella tiene bastante experiencia y esta muy actualizada en su campo, la señora vive con sus dos hijos pequeños, por esa razón realiza ese trabajo a domicilio, su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería, ambos son muy trabajadores y con ganas de superación, solicita el préstamo para la compra de un sillón para su salón y también para la compra de materiales para su trabajo como tintes, cremas ,etc. , se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Maria is a new customer.  This young lady runs a beauty salon in her home where she cuts and styles hair, gives massages, offers hair removal service, etc.   She also provides these services to customers in their homes if requested to do so.  She has a fair amount of experience and is very up-to-date in her field.  She lives with her two small children and this is why she works at home.  Her husband is a locksmith.  Both are hard workers who have a great desire to get ahead.  She is requesting a loan to buy a beauty salon chair as well as other materials for her work such as hair color, creams, etc.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support received.

loans.use: To buy a salon chair and other work tools.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 34 años, es una mujer amable y muy responsables. Viven en compañía de su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 10 y 5 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia junto a su padre. EL trabajo de Rosario consiste en la venta de comida, todos los días ella vende menú en su casa pero solo a personas a quienes ella da pensión, trabaja en este negocio desde hace diez años, y lo hace sola. Asimismo los domingos se dirige a un centro educativo, donde se realizan campeonatos de ex alumnos y ahí aprovecha a vender parrilladas, cebiches y otros platos que sus clientes saben que llevará y esperan con ansias para deleitarse con su exquisita sazón. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene independencia además de poder manejar ella su tiempo como mejor le parece, le esta yendo bien ya que genera mucho buenos ingresos, además tiene el apoyo de su pareja quien es el sostén en la economía de su hogar. Este será el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de trabajar con su grupo ya que todos desde el principio le dieron muchos ánimos para ser una buena socia. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio en su casa, además comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la preparación de sus deliciosos platos todos los días y fin de semana.
texts.en: Rosario, 34, is a very friendly and responsible woman.  She lives with her partner and their three children: 15, 10 and 5, in their own house next to her father.  Rosario sells food every day in her house but only to those people who rent from her.  She has been in this business for ten years and she handles it on her own.  She also works on Sundays at an educational center where ex alumni have camps.  There she sells grilled meat, ceviche (marinated shellfish) and other dishes that her customers know she will bring and they wait eagerly to enjoy her delicious food.  What she likes most about her work is that she is independent and she can work around her schedule as she sees fit.  The business is going well and generates good money.  She also has her partner’s support since he covers their  living expenses.  This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to work with this group since from the beginning they encouraged her to be a good member.  With the amount requested she will buy materials to improve the infrastructure of her home business, as well as to purchase ingredients and supplies to continue preparing her delicious food weekdays and weekends.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Lydia Wairimu

texts.en: Lydiah Wairimu, 39 years old, is single and has two children. She has been selling clothes to businesswomen for the last fifteen years. Her business is faced with the problem of high prices of the materials, which she imports from the neighboring country, Uganda.  She wants a loan of Kshs.25,000 to buy more materials.  Lydiah sees herself in five years operating a boutique and being a wholesaler.  She describes herself as a determined, obedient, trustworthy and God-fearing person.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: 11 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 11 de Septiembre es de la ciudad de Asunción, esta integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de darle a sus familias e hijos una vida son privaciones ni limitaciones.
Gregoria es una de las miembros, ella comenta que trabaja arduamente, pues sabe que trabajando es la única forma en la que se puede sobresalir y ayudar a la familia. Ella es modista y cuenta que se dedica a esto hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella tiene el sueño de convertirse en una gran modista, y lo quiere lograr a través de su trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos necesaR. para su taller. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan de acceder a una ayuda.
texts.en:
The 11 de Septiembre group is located in the city of Asunción. It is made up of 20 women, all friends and neighbours from Asuncion. They are currently in the second cycle of the Female Entrepreneurs' Program in Fundación Paraguaya. They joined together with the goal of giving their families a life without hardship or limitations.
Gregoria is one of the members. She says that she works very hard, since she knows that working is the only way to succeed and help her family. She is modest and tells us that she has been working for some time now, so she has a very good customer base. Her dream is to become a largescale designer, and she hopes to achieve this through her work.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, clasps, and other items for her workshop. She thanks the Fundacion and Kiva for the opportunity that they are providing her to access help.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, clasps, and more tools.

loans.name: Tete Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tete Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Tete group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had a good maize yield harvesting 22 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tete group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar, 46, is a humble villager who has been living in Pouk district. She has a fish selling business and raises poultry to earn a livelihood. She has a life partner in her husband who manages all the farming work and takes some time to catch fish from the river for her. This couple is blessed with 4 children, all of whom are single and living together at home. 

Mrs. Sar would to take out a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorcycle to use for the whole family and in their business, because they don’t own a motorcycle yet. This loan will better her family and make it comfortable to go anywhere they wish.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady vit  au Sénégal et est âgée  de 42 ans. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et vend  tissus et  chaussures. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle n’a jamais contracté de prêt au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite  un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de nouveaux produits destinés a la vente.  Son objectif est d’augmenter ses bénéfices pour acquérir un  niveau  de vie meilleur.
texts.en:
Madam Khady lives in Sénégal and is 42 years old. She is active in business and sells fabric and shoes. She chose her business out of necessity with the goal of bringing in income. 

She has never requested a loan within this institution. She is requesting a 100,000f loan to buy new products to sell. Her objective is to increase her profits to achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Karina

texts.es: Elizabeth Karina tiene 27 años de edad, su actividad económica  a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos, ya tiene varios años de experiencia en el cual sus clientes que tienen confían en la calidad de productos que les ofrece esto lo realiza de forma ambulante visita  a sus cliente que ya son fijos y los eventuales. Elizabeth Karina está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de variedad de ropa y estilo y cosméticos.
texts.en: Elizabeth Karina is 27 years old and earns her living by selling new clothes and cosmetics. She has already several years of experience and her customers have confidence in the quality of her products. She hawks her products by visiting her existing customers at their home and by approaching potential new customers. Elizabeth Karina applies for a loan to invest in her business. She will buy clothes of various styles and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothes of various styles and cosmetics.

loans.name: Florence Need Photo

texts.en:
Florence aged 34 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 10 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 13 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat and to renovate her house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh is a 49-year-old divorced woman who has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. Lanh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household and her family is very poor. She must work hard to care for her daughter. Lanh's house has no latrine or clean water to use. She and her daughter have to use the neighbor's latrine.

She can not get a loan from other banks or credit institution. Lanh is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

This is Lanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution. Lanh hopes for her business to do well, her family to be healthy and happy, and her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start up a business

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en: Kossiwa L. is an exceptionally hard-working illiterate woman of 48 years of age.  She is married and is mother to 8 children.  Her husband is a poor peasant with no means of reliable income.  Kossiwa sells produce of all kinds, specializing in dried red hot chili peppers (yes, red hot chili peppers! [piments]. This industry thrives during periods of drought or between rainy seasons.  The areas where the peppers are grown is far from her home. She is asking for $1200 in order for her to buy at a quantity discount and sell at a greater profit.  She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase, Stock and Sale of RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS!

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used on air conditioning for the store and to purchase products to stock it.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Miss Diep is 34 and her husband is 35 years old. They have 4 children between 10 and 2. Her first and second are going school in grades 3 and 1. They only have 2000 square meters for rice cultivation. Mr Minh, her husband, works as a day laborer but he can’t find work easily. So her selling soya from to door helped to increase her income by about $1.5/person/month to an average income of $10/person/month. Now she asks to borrow $75 for her soya selling business and she will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Selling soya

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 26 years old and has 2 children. She has been separated for a long time from her husband, and since then she works selling typical foods of the region in small markets known as "tianguis campesinos". She makes snacks such as tamales, "atole", a traditional beverage made from corn, and other local foods. She carries her food snacks with her and sells them in different locations. With the loan, she will invest in the materials she needs to make her products. She is part of Grupo Solidario 9.

CATALINA , tiene 26 años y dos hijos , está separada desde hace mucho tiempo con su esposo y desde entonces ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos típicos en pequeños mercaditos llamados “ tianguis campesinos “ ella elabora sus productos tales como tamales , atole , etc. Y los vende de forma ambulante, su préstamo lo invertirá comprando la materia prima que necesita para elaborar sus productos. Pertenece al Grupo Solidario 9.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of food typical to the region

loans.name: Felícitas

texts.en:
Felícitas L. D. G. is part of the village bank “Arco Iris,” which means “rainbow” in Spanish.

Felícitas has been selling fresh meat door-to-door in her community for the past forty years. Her mother had been selling meat for as long as she is able to remember, and when she was very young she began to learn the ins and outs of the business. Eventually, when her mother grew too old to continue, Felícitas took over the business, and today it is her principal source of income. Every Tuesday she travels several hours outsiD. the city limits into the countrysiD. of Ayacucho to buy her weekly supply of meat. Her Wednesdays and Fridays are dedicated to the sale of the product.

As an additional source of income, Felícitas and her husband also sell “papas secas,” or dried potatoes, which are a popular and very traditional staple among the highlands of Peru, as they keep for a very long time without spoiling. These she prepares in her home through a process that begins with cooking a large batch of potatoes. After they are done cooking and have cooled, her husband cuts them into thin slices and lays them under the sun to dry. These she then also sells door-to-door throughout the local community.

Felícitas says she is very happy to be a part of her village bank because it has helped her very much with both of her businesses. Through the profits she has earned and the savings she has accumulated, Felícitas is able to care for her large family of five children. With the $1,000 loan she is asking for, Felícitas will be able to buy larger quantities of meat to sell, as well as pay for the transportation that takes her into the countrysiD.. She will also be able to buy larger quantities of potatoes to dry and sell.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of meat and potatoes to sell, and pay for transportation into the countryside

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen is a woman who married with the dream of building a life at her husband’s side. Unfortunately, he abandoned her after they had three children. The time that followed was a sad one for María, who also experienced depression. For a long time, she let herself go, had no will to live, and neglected her children completely. Regardless, one day she realized she could not continue in this manner and that the ones suffering the most from these problems were her children. She began looking for something to occupy her and that would, at the same time, generate some income to help her support the family. This led to her beginning to sell beauty products by catalog. She began building her customer base little-by-little, as well as her self-esteem.

Regardless, even though eight years have passed, she has not been able to get ahead because she cannot always generate enough sales and living expenses are too high. María is asking for a $700USD loan which she is prepared to repay over a period of six months. With this money she can purchase more merchandise, and therefore have more items to offer her customers. With your support, María can get ahead and prove to herself that she can succeed on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Carmen es una mujer que se casó ilusionada pensando que su vida la podría hacer alado de su esposo. Sin embargo después de tres hijos la abandonó. María entró en una terrible tristeza y depresión. Durante mucho tiempo se dejó caer y sin esperanzas para vivir, descuidando totalmente a sus hijos. Sin embargo un día se dio cuenta que ella no podía seguir así puesto que quienes más estaban resintiendo este problema eran sus hijos y fue así que comenzó a buscar algo en qué ocupar su mente, tiempo y que a su vez le dejara dinero para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Fue así como comenzó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo y poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes y recuperando su autoestima.

Sin embargo a 8 años de haber pasado esto. No a podido salir totalmente adelante puesto que en muchas ocasiones las ventas no son muy altas y los gastos en su casa son muchos. María está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía que le servirá para poder tener más cosas que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir adelante y demostrarse a ella misma que no necesita a un hombre para ser feliz.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the holiday season.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina O. owns a shop in which bags, clothing, and others are sold. She also has a canteen where she prepares food for sale. She is married to a commercial driver whose daily income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. However, Amina is working very hard to support husband with the family’s finances. Amina wants to improve upon her canteen business.

She is asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to buy more food supplies for her canteen and also more bags, clothing materials and others for her shop.

loans.use: Buy more food supplies for her canteen and also more bags, clothing materials and others for her shop.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C., 43, is married with five children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, whose soil is favorable for growing rubber trees.

Mrs. Sim C. and her husband benefit from the rubber by purchasing large quantities of rubbers and reselling them for a profit. They can collectively make around $7 each day. One of her children is employed by a garment factory located in the city and another one works in a rubber plantation as a laborer earning around $2 each day. The rest are unemployed.

Mrs. Sim C. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is in the business of food production and sale. She is a single parent of 6 children. Ama prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’ (a steamed fermented corn dough dish) which is highly patronized by Ghanaians. She wants to increase her sales and meet the needs of her ever increasing clientele.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more corn and other raw materials for her food production.

loans.use: to buy more corn and other raw materials for her food production

loans.name: Tekove Pora Group

texts.es:
The committee is composed of 15 hard-working women from the Kennedy neighborhood of Caacupe. The majority of the members work in the production and street sale of chipas (a typical Paraguayan dish made with eggs, cheese, and corn starch), other group members sell clothing, home-made candy, and groceries. They are currently in the 7th cycle of the Entrepreneurial Women program and manage an average line of credit per person of ~$199.

The committee’s first meetings were in Mrs. Dora C.’s home, who was the first to find out about the program and gathered her hard-working neighbors to propose that they work together as a committee. She rounded up 15 very entrepreneurial women, each with a lot of desire to progress.

Since the formation of the group, they have worked very hard and have punctually paid off each of their previous loans. There have been no problems or arguments amongst group members, rather, each day they are more united and work as a team. They support each other a lot, and one of the norms they’ve adopted as a group is buying their goods wholesale in order to get better prices and discounts in their purchases.

Maria G., the committee president, states that they have learned a lot with this program since, more than just receiving a loan, they have received training in matters of public relations, self-esteem, business administration, and marketing among others.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Kennedy de la ciudad de Caacupé, la gran mayoría de las integrantes de este comité se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas (comida típica paraguaya muy consumida, esta hecha a base de huevos, queso y almidón) en forma ambulante, otras se dedican a la venta de ropas, dulces caseros y despensa. Ellas están actualmente en en el 7to. Ciclo del programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 900.000 por cada integrante.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Dora C., quién fue la primera en tener conocimiento del programa y reunió a sus vecinas trabajadoras para proponerles trabajar juntas como comité. Ella logró juntar el mínimo requerido de 15 señoras todas ellas mujeres emprendedoras y con muchas ganas de progresar.

Durante todos estos meses han trabajado y cumplido puntualmente con sus préstamos anteriores, no han surgido problemas ni diferencias entre ellas, por el contrario, cada día están más unidas y trabajan en equipo. Ellas se apoyan bastante y una de las formas de trabajo que adoptaron es la de comprar sus materias primas en cantidades mayoristas para lograr así obtener mejores precios y descuentos en sus compras.
