Maria G., presidenta del comité, manifiesta que aprendieron bastante con este programa ya que aparte de recibir un préstamo también recibieron capacitación tales como relaciones públicas, el autoestima, como administrar su negocio, marketing, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of commodities such as corn starch, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, milk, clothing for men, women, and children, and groceries such as fruit, sugar, milk, flour, etc.

loans.name: Consesa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Consesa is soliciting a second loan to build a bedroom and meet the needs of the family. She is an exemplary and enterprising woman in her community of Almendro. She is a mother, caring for a twelve-year-old child who is in secondary school at the Padre Lucinio Institute. She works selling cosmetic brands such as Avon, Zermat, and Oriflame, at which she generates a satisfactory income. Her husband also helps with the household expenses, working as a salesman and bricklayer. Both are very hard working and have a great desire to get ahead and provide an education and dignified place to live for their child. The dream of this client is to have a proper dwelling with the basic necessities required by the family. She is very responsible, honest and dignified in her tasks as head of household and her goal is to get ahead and have a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Concesa solicita su segundo refinanciamiento para construir un dormitorio y poder satisfacer la demanda de la familia, es una mujer ejemplar emprendedora en su comunidad del Almendro, es madre de familia, tiene un niño a su cargo, de 12 años de edad estudia primer años de segundaria en instituto padre Lucinio M; labora como agente vendedora de las empresa de cosmético de Avon, Zermat, oriflame, donde obtiene ganancias satisfactoria, él marido también colabora en sus gasto del hogar, es comerciante y albañil, ambos son personas trabajadoras que desean poder salir adelante con la educación de su hijo y así poder dejarle una vivienda digna humana ante la sociedad. Son los sueños de esta clienta tener una casa justa con las condiciones básicas necesaria que requiere la familia, es muy responsable, honesta, digna de sus valores y principios como jefa de familia, su aspiración es de superar por un futuro mejor

loans.use: Make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Maria Gabina

texts.es:
María started her business in order to help her husband with household and personal expenses as well as school expenses for their children. Mayra, 16, studies in secondary school, and 9-year old Alvaro is in primary school; her oldest daughter Carla Susana, 21, works. She started her business more than 3 years ago selling cosmetics to family and friends, little by little sales increased and in this way she has been able to contribute to her children’s education.

She now needs a loan for $250 that she will pay in 3 months in order to buy merchandise and be able to deliver some pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

María inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los recibos de servicios, gastos personales asi como gastos de escuela de sus hijos: Mayra de 16 años cursa la secundaria y Alvaro de 9 años estudia primaria; su hija mayor Carla Susana 21 años, quien trabaja. Comenzó su negocio hace mas de 3 años vendiendo cosmeticos con familiares y amigos, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas, y asi ha podido contibuir con la educacion de sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y poder entregar unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.en:
Ubaidullo K. is 47 years old. He’s married with four children. His wife looks after their children and their home. Ubaidullo is the only breadwinner in the family and he is really hard working. Ubaidullo has a cafe where he is selling national meals and other foodstuffs. He has been in the business for 10 years. Ubaidullo tries to have fresh foodstuffs and tasty meals in his cafe and to ensure his clients have a rest. His business is stable and allows him to generate significant income and to ensure the worthy living for his family.

Now Ubaidullo’s children are growing and the expenses for them are growing, too. Thus Ubaidullo wants to increase his business to earn more money to be able to cover expenses. For this purpose he requests $US400 to expand his cafe. He is planning to pay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Expanding his cafe business in order to increase income.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo O., is 24 years old, has a daughter, and lives with his parents. From a very early age he's been interested in auto mechanics, and was as an apprentice at his uncle’s auto shop. After completing high school he migrated to the capital to study auto mechanics at the SNPP (National Service of Vocational Promotion). Upon graduating as a mechanic, he returned to his hometown and set up his own auto shop at home with the help of his parents. Over the years he has formed a strong customer base since he is one of very few professionals in the area.

The loan request is for the renovation of his house and to buy various tools he is lacking to provide his customers with better services.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Gerardo O., cuenta con 24 años de edad, tiene una hija, quien vive con sus padres. Desde muy joven se ha interesado en la mecánica de autos, por lo cual estuvo como aprendiz en el taller de su tío; luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios migró a la capital del país para estudiar mecánica automotriz en el SNPP (Servicio Nacional de Promoción Profesional), al recibirse como mecánico, regresó a su ciudad y montó su propio taller con la ayuda de sus padres, en su propia casa. Con el correr de los años ya tiene una clientela formada, ya que es uno de los pocos profesionales en la zona.

El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de la casa y compra de algunas herramientas que le están haciendo falta para la prestación de un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Home restoration and tool purchase.

loans.name: Pleanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Pleanh P. is a 45 year old widowed farmer, who grows rice. She has been farming since 1990 in Phteah Rung Commune, and typically earns about $1.50 per day. She has no children and lives in Ptas Rong Commune, Siem Pursat Province. Although she lives alone she is delighted with her daily farm work, which is the main income for covering the family's expenses.

The farming season has begun and she needs capital for her business, so she decided to request a loan of US$125 to expand her farmland. She hopes that the loan will generate more income to sustain her daily life.

loans.use: To expand her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of new items to add to her stock of clothing and beauty products.

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Digna Mercedes Gutiérrez C. tiene 36 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Decididas II, vive en la calle las Casuarinas Mz 22B  lote 7 de la Urbanización La Rinconada provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando  porque se trasladó  de ciudad y tubo que trabajar para sobrevivir.
Es madre soltera y con ella vive su único hijo por el cual lucha y trabaja con gran entusiasmo.
Empezó su negocio con una pequeña bodeguita, donde vendía tres o cuatro cosas dice, ahora su negocio a crecido y está en su propia casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas implementó su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en su negocio comprando artículos de primera necesidad.
Conocer junto a su hijo el Perú y el extranjero.
texts.en:
Señora Digna Mercedes Gutiérrez C. is 36-years-old and belongs to the communal bank, "Mujeres Decididas II" (Determined Women). She lives on Casuarinas street, block 22b, lot 7 of La Rinconada development in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad. She studied until her third year of secondary school and didn't continue studying because she moved from the city and had to work to survive. She is a single mother, and her only son, for whom she fights and works with great enthusiasm, lives with her. She started her business with a small grocery store, where she began selling three or four items. Now her business is growing, and it's in her own home. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 months, she implemented her business. With this credit of 1,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in her business and purchase basic goods. She would like to travel through Peru and abroad with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (groceries)

loans.name: Debaki

texts.en:
Mrs. Debaki K. is 31 years-old and lives with her husband and two children in Sainbu Bhaishepati. Her son is in grade 12, and her daughter is in grade 10.
Debaki and her husband, Mr. Manohar, opened their grocery store 2 years ago. They sell different types of groceries such as rice, maize, biscuits, and various snacks. Their children help in the shop, so all the members of the family contribute equally to the family's income. They depend solely upon the store's income to fulfill their needs. Mrs. K. is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 ($150) to buy various types of goods to sell in their shop.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica was born in 1950.  She later married and was blessed with two children, though her husband died.  As a widow, she has struggled to raise money and care for her children, making life very difficult for her.  In the year 2007, Margaret found GHAPE and enrolled herself in the program.  She was first given a loan of 40,000 FRS, and she managed to successfully pay off the loan promptly. 

Monica is now requesting a loan of 200,000 FRS, in which she plans to buy coco yams for “achu” production.  “Achu” is one of the most common foods in the Northwest region of Cameroon; it is produced from matched coco yams and is eaten with yellow soup.  She will spend her 200,000 FRS loan accordingly: 40,000 FRS for coco yams, 10,000 FRS for palm wine and 150,000 FRS for drinks.

Monica promises to start repaying her loan the day it is disbursed. She is convinced her business will succeed due to her experience in the industry, the business location and customer loyalty.  Her business will also help the community by providing food for them at moderate prices, reducing their costs of living.

Monica also promises to pay for her grandchildren's school fees, food for her family and needed medications with the profit from her business. She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because no collateral security is needed in order for the loan to be disbursed.  Also, the repayment schedule is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying coco yams for "achu", palm wine, and beer

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua K. is a trader of plantains and other food items. She buys food from farmers in her community and nearby towns. She treks to Accra, Ghana to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. Akua has been in business for over fifteen years and has lots of experience. She says when plantains becomes scarce, she resorts to fruits like pears, oranges, and pineapples.  Akua wants a loan to buy plantains on a large scale so she can supply to a number of customers and increase her profit margin.
 
Akua is thirty–seven years old, married with five children– one girl and four boys.  Four of her children are in basic school and the youngest is still crawling. Akua’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es: La señora Julia Estela Pérez A. tiene la edad de 45 años habita en el barrio las conchitas ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe,  ella es madre soltera tiene a su cargo tres hijos los cuales le apoyan en su negocio,  cuando ella va de compras, desde hace dos año tiene una pulpería que con mucho esfuerzos a logrado mantener, los planes hacia su familia es incrementar mas su negocio para poder darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. Ella trabajaba para la compañía de TIP-TOP y con su indemnización logro incrementar un poco su pulpería. Esta vez la demanda es más pero no tiene recursos para poder ampliar de productos de canasta básica. Como granos básicos, y insumos diarios, para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julia Estela Pérez A. is 45 years old and lives the Conchitas neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality. She is a single mother caring for three children who help her with the business when she goes shopping. Two years ago she established a grocery store that she has managed to maintain with a great deal of effort. Her plan for her family is to build up her business so that she can provide better living conditions for her children. She worked for the TIP-TOP company and with her earnings she was able to establish her store. Now there is a greater demand but she does not have the resources to augment the assortment of products that make up the basic food basket, including basic grains and daily supplies that can be offered to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and daily supplies to improve assortment of goods offered.

loans.name: I Made Weneh

texts.id: Walaupun hasil yang didapat tidak seperti yang diharapkan karena rendahnya harga vanili, namun I Made Weneh tidak merasa dirugikan karena selain mendapat dana, dia juga mendapat pelatihan membuat pupuk organik dan perawatan tanaman dari staf Dinari. Kegagalan yang sudah lalu dipakainya sebagai pengalaman untuk mencoba usaha sejenis yang tidak jauh berbeda, yaitu menanam pohon kakao. Tanaman kakao mudah dalam perawatan dan berbuah sepanjang minggu. Harganya stabil dan setiap seminggu sekali bisa dipanen. I Made Weneh merencanakan pinjaman kedua ini untuk mengembangkan usahanya diperkebunan kakao. Pinjaman itu akan dipergunakan untuk biaya mengolah tanah dan membeli bibit kakao. I Made Weneh optimis usahanya akan lebih baik dan bisa mendapatkan hasil yang optimal untuk kesejahteraan keluarganya
texts.en:
I Made Weneh participated in DINARI loan program and used the funding for his vanilla (Vanilla planifolia) farming venture. However due to vanilla price dropped significantly during the last harvest season, he cannot get optimal earning from his harvest. However he is not disappointed. Even though he cannot earn as expected he had a good experience and he was trained by DINARI staff on how to make organic fertilizer. He is optimistic that he can leverage his new learned skills for his future cacao farming venture.

He thinks cacao is better than vanilla as cacao is easier to grow and the market price is more stabile. It can also be harvested once a week. He is applying for a new loan with DINARI and he will use it to fund his cacao farming activities.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cacao sedds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna and her husband Noel C. lived in Barangay Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya, together with their four children namely, Kathleen Mae, 15 years old, Krisha Mae, 12 years old, Ian, 10 years old and Kevin, 6 years old. The two eldest children are in secondary education while the other two are studying in the elementary school. The couple's greatest desire is to give their children the best education they need, because they know that it is the only treasure they can give to their children. Despite financial difficulty, they still have the courage to work hard for the welfare of their children.

Lorna and Noel are simple farmers in Barangay Banganan trying their best to overcome life's difficulties. They help each other in their planting of onions, their only source of income to support the needs in the family. They want to plant more onions in order to increase their income, so Lorna decided to find additional capital to turn their plan into reality. She is requesting a loan amount of 5,000 pesos to use in purchasing insecticide, fertilizers and other agricultural supplies they needed.

loans.use: To buy insecticides, fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Funyang

texts.en:
A mother of three and a widow, B. makes her living by working on her farm, growing beans and cassava year round.  This loan of 60,000 CFA will be her second from GHAPE and she plans to use the money to pay for the rent of her farmland, for the clearing and tilling of land, and to purchase bean seeds.

Having joined GHAPE in 2007, B. used her past loan for farming cassava, which helped pay her child's school fees.  Since she sells products that are needed in her community and has experience as a farmer, B. is confident that her farm will do very well.  She is also helping her neighbors by employing some to help clear and till the land.

Like her previous loan, this additional money will help B. provide food for her family, medical care when needed, and improve the way she lives her life in general.

B. has faced adversity in her life, like deaths in her family, sickness, and poverty, but with the help of GHAPE and Kiva, B. has persevered through her work on the farm. She also appreciates GHAPE because of the organization's gradual repayment plan and for providing training on how to manage a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Rent of farmland, clearing and tilling land, purchase bean seeds

loans.name: Fasilat

texts.en: Fasilat is 40 years old and married with five children. She has a shop where she sells medicines and provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en:
Rejina J. currently sells cooking oil, bread, and cakes and is requesting a loan to stock more cooking oil to sell. All around her are her customers who always buy bread and cakes from her. Rejina is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a police officer. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Marka

texts.en:
Marka J. currently sells ice cream and is requesting for a loan to buy a fridge and more sugar to make tea in order to enhance her business. She is 34 years old and married to a man who is a driver. Marka has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy a fridge and purchase more sugar to make tea.

loans.name: Dilbaroy

texts.ru: Дилбарой – 40 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Она занимается продажей яиц и конфет. Она торгует на рынке "Афганбазар" находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Дилбарой закупает конфеты от фирм поставщиков а яйца и оптовиков ранним утром. Её муж плотник. Дилбарой кредитуется у нас с 2007 года. Когда она начинала, у нее было небольшое место торговли. Но сейчас Дилбарой расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию новых импортных конфет. Теперь у Дилбарой увеличился ассортимент. Новый займ она просит для закупки разных конфет от Российской фирмы "Сладко".
texts.en:
Dilbaroy is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells eggs and candy at the Afganbazar market in the Panchshanbe district of Khujand. Dilbaroy buys candy from supplier firms and eggs from wholesalers early every morning. Her husband is a carpenter. Dilbaroy has been our client since 2007. When she first started her business, her retail stand was very small. Since then, Dilbaroy expanded and used her last loan to buy a stock of new imported candies. Her merchandise assortment increased. Dilbaroy is requesting this new loan in order to purchase different candies from the Russian firm Sladko.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy from the Sladko firm

loans.name: Đặng Thị

texts.en:
D. Đặng Thị (254991507) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has four adult children.

D. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 1999, D. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

D. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Salohidin

texts.en: Since he was young, Salohidin has known work. His parents taught him how be successful as an farmer, and he learned very well. Now that he is father, he still works as an farmer. Thanks to his parents, Salohidin now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs. They are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. You can help Salohidin keep moving forward with his development plans. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Francisca Cristina

texts.es: Francisca Cristina D. D. G. resiD. en Colon municipio del departamento D. La Libertad. Mujer casada con 54 años D. edad, y madre D. un niño. Francisca y su esposo se apoyan económicamente Jose trabaja como comerciante y genera un aproximado D. $200.00 US mensuales los que destina para los gastos D. la familia y Francisca se dedica a su negocio una tienda ubicada en su domicilio donD. posee una clientela muy estable por que manifiestan sus clientes que Francisca es una persona honrada y amable con ellos. Francisca  solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con lo que lograra generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca Cristina lives in Colon, a county in the state of La Libertad. She is married, 54 years old, and has one son. Francisca and her husband help each other financially. Jose works in retail and generates approximately $200.00 US dollars per month which he uses to pay for household's expenses. Francisca has a convenience store at her home which already has stable customers who express Francisca is an honest and friendly person with them. Francisca is asking for this loan to replenish her store's stock to generate more income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replenish store stock

loans.name: Francisco Anselmo

texts.es: El señor Francisco Anselmo M. , tiene la edad de 62 años , habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos ya independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Francisco desde hace 40 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ya que el cultivo carece de fertilizantes e insumos , los planes futuros hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo .Con el préstamo va a comprar abono para obtener una mejor producción. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los prestamos ya que ha salido adelante con las siembras y ha podido suplirse de las necesidades diarias, este es su séptimo crédito y espera seguir en trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Francisco Anselmo M. is 62 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of San Juan de la Concepción with his wife, who works and helps him with the household expenses. They have two children, both of whom support themselves. His family’s goal is to improve their standard of living. Francisco has made a living from farming for 40 years. The biggest difficulty he is facing is a lack of funds, since he needs fertilizer and supplies for his crop. His plan for the future is to diversify his crop. Francisco is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer so he can improve his yield. He thanks the lending institution for the assistance it has given him through their loans, since he has been able to get ahead with his crops and supply his daily needs. This is Francisco’s seventh loan and he hopes to continue working with the lending institution.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies and fertilizer to improve his crop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther P. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old. Esther is married and has one young child. To make a living, Esther runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in her local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esther from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Raelonda

texts.en:
Raelonda C. is from the village of Waterfall in Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Raelonda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Raelonda sells a variety of daily-use products in the local community. Raelonda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Raelonda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raelonda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Raelonda is requesting same amount of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Raelonda's sixth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to educate her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
This is Estrelita E., a young entrepreneur from Pangarap, Caloocan City. She is 34 years-old. Her husband Jonathan, 32, is a street vendor. Three of their five children are already in grade school.

Estrelita owns and manages a general store which she started ten years ago. She sells small toys and fun items for kids. She earns P12,000.00 a month.

She has applied for a loan with Kiva Partner the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the amount of P12,000.00 in order to provide additional capital for her business to purchase new toy designs. It has been Lilia’s dream for a long time to eventually have her own toy store in a big shopping mall.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase new toys.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en: Lucresia D., 47 years of age and a resident of Datu Tangkilan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, is married to Antonio D. and blessed with 4 children. One of them is already married while the rest are studying. She started her business with an initial capital of 200 pesos in 1995. Her future plan is to own a junk shop. This is her first  loan.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn A. is from the village of Cawa-cawa. She is 26 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Jonalyn owns and operates a business providing carpentry services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for her child's education in the future. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools needed to provide service

loans.name: Jhannet

texts.es: "doña Jhannet tiene 23 años de edad, vive en casa de su cuñada, se encuentra casada con don Edgar,el mismo que trabaja como chofer asalariado, doña Jhannet tiene como actividad principal la venta de CD's y juguetes, el mismo que lo vende en la feria de la 16 de julio, de la ciudad de El Alto, en su puesto fijo. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de juguetes por temporada de navidad, ya que los precios aun se encuentran bajos."
texts.en:
Jhannet is 23 years old and lives in her sister-in-law's house. She is married to Edgar who works as a salaried chauffeur. Jhannet's principal activity is selling CDs and toys from her fixed post at the July 16th Fair in the City of El Alto.

The credit she is soliciting is to buy toys for the Christmas season while prices are still low.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INVEST IN CDs AND TOYS AT WHOLESALE

loans.name: Nappy Town Group

texts.en:
Jebbeh G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Nappy Town Group. She is a widow with four children between the ages of 9 and 19. Their educational levels range between 6th grade and university student. Jebbeh herself is an illiterate due to lack of financial support.

She lives and works in the Old Road Community, south of the capital city of Liberia, Monrovia. Jebbeh started in business with only 1,000 LRD, selling cooked food. Now, her business is the sales of food, such as rice, water, soft drinks and so on. She buys goods wholesale and sells at retail prices to residents of her community in Monrovia. Jebbeh has been running this business for five years, and hopes to upgrade to a restaurant. She always encourages customers to continue buying from her.

Jebbeh faces the problem of the lack of capital to expand her business. She needs this loan to improve her business.

Jebbeh dreams of giving her children a good education.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, el señor Julio V. se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y por haber suplido su pulpería de diversos productos para ser ofertados a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.
Con mucho sacrificio el señor Julio ha logrado llevar el sustento a su mesa y hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de los productos comestibles y a la vez para la compra de algunos cosméticos para ofrecerlos en su establecimiento y obtener ingresos para seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the county of San Rafael del Sur, Mr. Julio V. has stood out because of his hard work and for having stocked his general store with a diversity of products to be offered daily from the early hours of the morning until dusk. Through a lot sacrifice, Mr. Julio has been able to bring sustenance to his table and nowadays he is in need of investing in buying food products and at the same time cosmetics to offer them in his store in order to obtain income to keep supporting his household.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for general store

loans.name: Rafaela De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela de Jesús Calderón R. es originaria del departamento de Estelí ella va usar el crédito para comprar lo útiles  escolares  y matricula de sus hijo solicita el crédito porque no tiene todo el dinero para  hacerlo actualmente  y desea matricular a sus hijos sin que ellos tengan ninguna dificultad 

Rafaela es maestra y tiene mas de 10 años de estar trabajando para el ministerio de educación y toda la vida se a dedicado a esto desde que su padres le dieron su estudio ella espera que el crédito le sirva de mucho ya que resolverá sus problemas persónales Rafaela es madre soltera  y tiene tres hijos pero solo dos están bajo su cargo estudiando actualmente  el cual uno de ellos esta en al universidad y el otro en secundaria además sus padres no viven con ella ya que ellos se dedican a la agricultura  este es el primer crédito que    se le otorga a Rafaela y expresa que quedara agradecida con ceprodel por la ayuda que se le esta brindando ya que le ayudara a solucionar los problemas  que tiene por ahora y desea seguir trabajando con ceprodel .
texts.en:
Sra. Rafaela de Jesús Calderón R. is a native of the department of Estelí. She will use this loan to purchase school supplies and pay for registration fees for her children. Rafaela does not have all the money to do this now, but she wants to enroll her children without facing any difficulties.

Rafaela is a teacher and has been working for the Ministry of Education for more than ten years. She has devoted her life to this profession as a result of her parents providing her with an education. Rafaela hopes this loan will solve her personal problems. She is a single mother with three children, but only two of them live with her and are in high school. The other one is attending university. Rafaella’s parents do not live with her and make their living in agriculture.

This is Rafaela’s first loan. She says she is grateful to CEPRODEL for its assistance in helping her solve her problems and looks forward to continue working with the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for school supplies & registration fees for her children

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mr. Heang H. is 53 years old and he lives in Prey Prum Village, Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sao Hay, are farmers who own 1.40-hectare (~ 3.5-acre) on which they grow rice. He and his wife also are pig breeders and wine makers. 

Since their businesses are doing well, Mr. Heang H. wants to expand them, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy ten pigs and pig food. With the rest of the loan, he will to support his wine making business. With the loans, his standard of living is improving and his income is increasing, too. Mr. Heang H. has three children. One of his children is a farmer and the other two are students in the local school. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy ten pigs and pig food, and to support his wine-making business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 35, operates video games to earn a living. Her video game machines are placed in different locations around her community. During fiesta, her business earns a lot. She wishes that she could expand her business. She started her business in 2004. Now she’s requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help her financially to operate the business. She has three children to support. The eldest child is 12 years old. The loan will be helpful for her to purchase more video game machines.

loans.use: To buy video game equipment

loans.name: Luz De Madre Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group, Luz De Madre (Light of Mother), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty industrial town north of the Capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Altagracia is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by purchasing deodorants, hair products, diapers and jewellery to sell in her salon. She will use the profits to invest in her children by saving towards sending them to university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy deodorants, hair products, diapers and jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Es propietario de una despensa y carniceria bien surtida, y con una clientela bien formada, que le produce buenos ingresos mensuales, ella atiende su negocio con la ayuda de su marido.
El señor tambien tiene una camioneta con la cual reparte mercaderías en las zonas aledañas, es muy trabajador, honesto y responsable. 
    El cliente solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías(carne, pastas, panificados, queso, leche, harina, granos) ya que se aproxima la época de la cosecha  y  en esos tiempos hay mucha venta.
texts.en:
He owns a well-stocked grocery and butcher shop. He has a well-established customer base that produces good monthly income. She and her husband tend to their business together. He also has a delivery truck with which he delivers merchandise to outlying neighboring areas. He is hard-working, honest and responsible. He is requesting funds to buy merchandise (meats, pasta, baked goods, cheese, milk, flour, grains) since harvest time in approaching and this means increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, baked goods, milk, cheese and other products.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años 
de edad. El  vive en casa de su cónyuge, El adquirió la mototaxi con ahorros obtenidos 
de los más de 5 años laborando como obrero de campo en los fundos de la zona. El tiene 
amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda. Policarpio  y su cónyuge sueñan con 
tener su casa propia ya que el terremoto les destruyo su vivienda. Policarpio sueña   
ver su casa construida y también que su menor hijo pueda estudiar y así poder 
brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su hijo, por lo que solicita el credito para realizarle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Policarpio is 23 years old, has lived in a common-law marriage for seven years and is the father of a 6-year-old boy. He lives in his partner's house. He bought a motortaxi with his savings earned from working for more than 5 years as a field laborer on the farms in his area. He has extensive experience in the service he provides. Policarpio and his spouse dream of owning their own house, because their home was destroyed by the earthquake. Policarpio is eager to see his house built and also to see his young son being able to study, thus providing him with safety and comfort. Policarpio applies for this loan to perform maintenance of his working tools.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his working tools

loans.name: Gulbara Idrisova's Group

texts.ru:
Гулбаре 42 года. ее супруг занимается скупкой-продажей КРС и МРС на местном скотном рынке. У нее также 5 детей, самому старшему 18 лет, а самому младшему 1 годик. Самый старший сын работает пастухом в селе, а остальные ходят в школу, кроме самой маленькой дочери. Клиент занимается выращиванием арбузов, земельный надел находится рядом с ее домом. Половина кредита будет использована для закупа скота, а остальная часть использована для весеннего посева. 

Гулийпа, 41, замужем. Ее супруг работает строителем в селе. У нее 4 детей: 3 сына и дочь. Клиент также занимается вырашиванием арбузов и риса. Все сыновья помогаю матери в сельском хозяйстве. Кредит будет использован для посева риса.

Урматхан, 45, мать 3 детей. Ее супруг работает в РФ шофером и регулярно отправляет деньги для содержания семьи. кроме этого Урматхан вместе с детьми занимается сельским хозяйством. Кредит нужен для весеннего посева арбуза. 

Гулаим, 43, замужем. Ее супруг работает строителем,  также вместе с семьей вырашивает сельхоз продукты. У нее 5 детей. Кредит будет направлен на закуп семян арбуза. 
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulbara is 42 years old. Her husband buys and sells large and small cattle on the local cattle market. She also has five children, her oldest son is eighteen years old and her youngest one is one years old. Her oldest son works as a shepherd and the rest of the children go to school besides the youngest daughter. Gulbara grows watermelons and has a plot of land next to her house. Half of the loan will be used to buy cattle and the rest of it for the spring sowing season. Guliypa is 41 years old, she is married. Her husband works as a construction worker in the village. She has four children: three sons and one daughter. The client also grows watermelons and rice. Her sons are helping their mother in this farming business. The loan will be used to sow rice. Urmatkhan is 45 years old, she is a mother of three children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation as a driver and sends money back regularly to support the family. Besides that Urmatkhan together with children does farming. She needs the loan to sow watermelons in the spring. Gulaim is 43 years old. She is married. Her husband works as a construction worker and also grows crops together with family. They have five children. The loan will be used to buy watermelon seeds.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Half of the loan will be used to buy cattle and the other half to sowing

loans.name: Tamthekeh Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Tamthekeh”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch.  This will be their first Kiva loan through SMT.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. They are therefore requesting for a loan of SLL 1,700,000 for the entire group in order to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Their leader is 31-year-old Mariatu I. J. (pictured second from left) who sells oil, flour, sugar, rice, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste) and other market-foods. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now. Mariatu will use her share of the loan to buy sugar, oil, Maggi cubes, etc. wholesale to add to her business inventory.  

Mariatu was born in a place called Rotufunk in southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a building contractor and they have two children – one in class six and the other is not of school-going age.

loans.use: Buy sugar, oil, Maggi cubes, etc. wholesale for resale

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong N., 49, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Phnom Penh City, the most populated city in Cambodia. She sells food in front of her house for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed as an officer at the ministry of planning, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy a motorbike for commuting to work. In the future she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida L. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Nylon Shell, Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish. Zenaida’s husband, Hernando, is a security guard and they have two children who are 19 and 32 years old. Their younger child is currently going to school and also helps in the business as part of its daily chores while their older child has work elsewhere. Zenaida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of P13,000 from her business activities. Zenaida is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of P12,000 was used to fund operations of her fish-vending business and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing P15,000 for her 18th loan which she intends to use in her fish-vending business. Zenaida is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita G. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has a 26-year-old child. Pacita owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily use products in the local community. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She makes sure it is free of weeds and pests. Her wishes for the future are for her business to grow and for her family's living conditions to be improved.

Pacita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Pacita from CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira B. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business. She lives in Purok II, Barangay Gargato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Elvira has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income per month of PHP 4,000. Elvira is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can expand her general store. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elvira aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en: Erdenebaatar T. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Erdenebaatar's three children attend a local middle school, while his wife milks some goats they raise and sells the milk at a local market. Erdenebaatar purchased a car with the sales of goat cashmere, and now he is providing transportation throughout his town. He is planning on selling a variety of goods and machinery spare parts out of a container which he bought. Erdenebaatar is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for his current car and some spare parts to resell.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina S. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer in the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Celina is 57 years old and is married with a husband that is a security guard. She has 6 children and 4 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta J. is from the city of Carig Highway, Tuguegarao City. She is 55 years old, married and has 4 adult children.  For a living, Julieta has just started the business of owning & operating a restaurant.  The main source of income for the business comes from serving food to customers in the local community. 

In 2010, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be Julieta's 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas se encuentra formado por 8 mujeres  y 2 hombres, quienes luchan para sacar adelante a sus familias con su trabajo diario. Viven por diferentes sectores de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de la población joven sale a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.  

La Señora María Andrea M. se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación. Vive en la comunidad del Despacho que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Doña María tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos que son mayores de edad, casados y viven  independientemente. Su esposo se dedica  al trabajo en la agricultura. Tiene casa propia la misma que  han construido con el trabajo conyugal en su juventud.
La Señora María se dedica a su negocio, tiene un kiosco donde vende variedad de productos, el mismo que lo tiene hace 6 meses y  trabaja en el los días sábados y domingos, los demás  días de la semana se dedica a la cría de animales como aves de corral  y chanchos a  los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de galletas, gaseosas, chupetes, cigarrillos, etc.  para incrementar su kiosco.
 
su meta es crecer en su negocio.

La Señora María Felicia S. vive en la comunidad de Maluay que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Tiene de 40 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de  23, 20, 17, 15, 14, 12, y 2 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo son casados y viven de manera independiente su segundo hijo es quien trabaja y le ayuda en la economía de la casa, sus hijos de 15 y 14 años no estudian pero le ayudan en los quehaceres domésticos, su hijo de 12 años estudia en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo es albañil y con su trabajo saca adelante a su familia.  Con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña María se dedica hace 6 meses a trabajar como empleada domestica,  labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 a.m. hasta la 1 p.m., el resto de su tiempo se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos, espera que los créditos le ayuden para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es de superarse junto  a su  familia.
texts.en:
The Las Minas community bank is composed of 8 women and 2 men, who fight in their daily work to get their families ahead. They live in different sectors of the Valle parish. This parish is characterized by its population's work in agriculture and the raising of animals. Much of the young population leaves the city to work in different areas; also, many have migrated in search of better work. This is María Andrea M.'s first loan with the Fundación. She lives in the Despacho community which belongs to the Valle parish. Maria is 62, married and has 6 children who are grown, married and live on their own. Her husband works in agriculture. She has her own home which she and her husband built together in their youth. Maria has a kiosk where she sells a variety of products. She has had it for 6 months and works Saturdays and Sundays. The rest of the days of the week, she raises animals such as barnyard birds and pigs, which she sells when she has any economic need. She will invest her loan in the purchase of cookies, pop, lollipops, cigarettes, etc. in order to stock her kiosk. Her goal is to expand her business. María Felicia S. lives in the Maluay community which belongs to the Valle parish. She is 40, married and has 7 children ages 23, 20, 17, 15, 14, 12, and 2. Her oldest and third children are married and live independently. Her second child works and helps her with the household costs. Her 15 and 14 year old children aren't in school but help her with the housework. Her 12-year-old child goes to a school in the community. Her husband is a bricklayer and he gets his family ahead with his work. With Maria and her husband's work, they were able to build their own home. For 6 months, Maria has worked as a maid. She works Monday to Friday from 8 am. to 1 pm. The rest of her time is spent raising chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community. This is her first loan in the community bank and she will invest it in the purchase of hogs and chickens. She hopes that the loans will help her to expand her business. Her goal is to improve herself with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cookies, pop, lollipops, cigarettes, etc.  / pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Fena Fena Tukore Group, Mubende

texts.en:
K. Frank of Fena Fena Tukore Group is a hard working and ever-optimistic 33-year-old married father of one child. He operates a growing agro produce business in Kanseera Trading Centre, Mubende. He buys and sells cereals like maize, beans, millet and more. 

With a business longevity span of three years, Frank has managed to significantly sustain and improve his family’s welfare by paying his bills and general family welfare. To all appearances, his future business prospects look promising with 600,000 Ugandan shillings coming in monthly out of his business. He envisions an even greater profit margin as he gets this loan, anticipating being in position to buy more stock for the business. This will enable him to expand business by opening more stores, earning more revenue and living a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is a new business owner. He opened a vegetable shop in 2007. In addition, he has prepared a corner where he buys fresh juices. He is the main income provider for his wife and two children. He takes care of the family expenses and the school fees. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sickness and schooling and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and increase his purchases. In the future, he is planning to open a juice shop.

loans.use: To improve his business and increase his stock

loans.name: Bautista

texts.en: Bautista D. is a 42-year-old from Malabor, Tibiao, Antique, Philippines. She stands as father and mother to her six children since her husband left them five years ago. Being a single mother, she has difficulty meeting the needs of her family. Four of her children are still studying so she works hard in order to survive. But through her industry and courage, two of her children are already finished college. This business is very important to the family because this is where she gets the money to meet their basic needs and the daily allowance of her children for schooling. Bautista earns her living with a sari-sari store and food vending. They say, "Life begins at 40." These days, people are serious about their businesses. In the last few months, Bautista joined ASHI because she wants to have additional capital for her business, and she like the free training and orientation offered by ASHI. She really appreciates the training because it is a big help to her and expands her dreams for her family. Bautista's first loan from ASHI was for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which she used as additional capital for her variety store. Her business improved because she already knew how to handle the business and she is friendly. So, for her second loan, she has requested 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store and food vending business. According to her, "In business, if you are wise, the bigger the investment, the bigger the income." She hopes that with the strength given to her by our Almighty, and with the support of ASHI and people around the world, she will be able to finish sending her children to college.

loans.use: For a variety store and food vending

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia L. is from the village of San Juan, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Amelia is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Amelia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste, and junk foods in the local community. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Amelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Amelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Yeraldy

texts.es: La Sra. Yeraldy se dedica al comercio de edredones, juegos de olla, vajillas y otros desde hace tres años; generalmente deja la mercadería a crédito y posteriormente realiza los cobros de manera semanal, debido a que la mayoría de su capital esta en las cuentas por cobrar y se acercan las fiestas de fin de año necesita capital para comprar mercadería, razon por la cual solicito el credito, la venta es de forma ambulante a personas ya conocidas por ella, también ofrece en los mercados a personas que tienen puestos fijos para así poder cobrar  sin ningún problema, la Sra. Yeraldy es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Yeraldy has been dedicated to the sale of comforters, pots & pans, dishes and other things for three years.  Generally she sells the merchandise on credit and subsequently carries out the collections weekly.  Since the majority of her capital is tied up in her accounts receivable and the year end festivals are approaching, she needs capital to buy merchandise.  For this reason she requests a loan.  Her sales are performed door-to-door to people already known to her.  She also offers her merchandise in the markets to people that have stalls in order to be able to charge with no problem.  Señora  Yeraldy is a very hard-working person and is very thankful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for resale

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah L. is thirty years old supporting a family of four people. She is married to Jackson Chemase who produces additional income for the family. Her children are 10, 7, and 2 and a half years old.

She runs a retail shop and also does maize farming. She has been in business for four years and right now her monthly income from the business is Ksh 40,000. She is borrowing Ksh 45,000 to use as follows: Ksh 2,500 to buy seeds; Ksh 10,500 to buy fertilizer; Ksh 6000 for ploughing and Ksh 26,000 to pay wages and other expenses. She will reinvest profits from her expanded business into the retail shop and to plant passion fruits. This is her third loan and she paid her previous loans successfully.  Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses in her plot at Tambach town and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds,fertilizer and ploughing

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 22 years old and is still single. He has three years of experience in the business of selling goods in his shop. His shop includes a variety of goods such as soap, toilette papers, lotion, sugar, etc., and is open from 6am to 8pm every day except on Sunday. He currently employs two people in his business.

Felicien will use this loan to purchase a variety of products, mainly rice, sugar, beans, soap etc. Felicien will use any profits to start saving for further reinvestment in his business and plans to buy a house.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for a general store

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members. They are located in Thmei village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Chin C. is 41 years old and she has been selected as the group leader by its members. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chin C. stays at home and takes care of her two children who all are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mao Hieng, is 45 years old and he works as a soldier. With the soldier's salary, they still earn too little of an income to support and improve the family's living conditions. In order to increase their income to improve the family living’s conditions, Mrs. Chin C. would like to ask for a loan to buy groceries for selling in the local village.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for selling in the local village.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo, tiene 45 años de edad y es casado, él vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El socio Guillermo y su pareja tienen una pequeña librería donde vende cuadernos, papeles y muchas cosas más,   el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, instrumentos de ingeniería.

Guillermo pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in Cuzco, Peru.  Guillermo and his wife have a small stationery store, where they sell notebooks, papers, and many other items.  He needs a loan to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil holders, and drafting instruments.

Guillermo belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank (“let’s walk together”), part of the UMF Arariwa Association in Cuzco, Peru.  The communal bank is made up of hard-working, enterprising people who are always looking for opportunities to improve the lives of their children.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil holders, drafting instruments.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas, del Distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 62 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores D. edad (independientes).
Ella se dedica a la costura y confección D. prendas D. vestir, gracias a su dedicación trabajo no le falta y con eso puD. solventar sus gastos. 

Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará una maquina industrial, 10 metro D. tela, diferentes colores, 2 conos D. hilos D. remalle, 3 doc. D. cierre, 1 ciento D. botones para pantalón D. diferentes colores, 1 ciento D. botones para camisa.
Isabel trabaja porque eso es lo que ha hecho siempre y le gusta su oficio, por años esta conservando su clientela y tiene para muchos años más.
Gracais a los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos ha ido cambiando D. máquinas para obtener mejor acabado en las prendas que cose.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank Vecinas Unidas of the Calleria district, in Ucayali state.  She is 62 years old, married, and has 5 adult children who live independently.  She is a seamstress and makes clothes.  Since she is a hard worker, she has plenty of work to cover her expenses.  

This new loan for 3,000.00 new soles will be used to purchase an industrial sewing machine, 10 meters of fabric in different colors, 2 cones of thread, 3 dozen zippers, one hundred pants buttons in various colors, and one hundred shirt buttons.  Isabel works because this is what she has always done and she enjoys her traD..  She has had her customers for many years and has many more years ahead of her.  

Thanks to the loans from Manual Ramos she has been changing out her machines to have better finishing details on the clothes she sews.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine, 10 meters of fabric in different colors, 2 cones of thread, 3 dozen zippers, one hundred pants buttons in different colors, one hundred shirt buttons.

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan. They are located in Prey PraS. village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Uk P., born in 1947, was selected to be the group leader by the other members. 

Mrs. Uk P. is a widow with two children. One is a truck driver and one is seamstress in a garment factory.

She is a farmer who owns a field that she uses to grow rice. She also owns a truck for transporting sand, from which she is able to earn a small income to support her family. 

Now her house is old, so she would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to fix up her house.

loans.use: To add to her savings to fix her house

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru: Эргашева Шахринисо жительница Шахринавского района. Ей 48 лет. Она вдова, имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее. Работает на рынке "Дехкон". Арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shahriniso E. lives in Shahrinav district. She is 48 years old, widowed with four children. She has a secondary education. Ms. E. works at the Dekhkon market where she rents a small space to sell fruit. She has been in this business for 15 years and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and sales.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Normurod

texts.ru: Гулямгусейнов Нормурод проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 24 года. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Нормурод занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает метровые ленточки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки метровых ленточек и новых материалов.
texts.en: Normurod G. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 24 years old, married, and has one child. His wife is a housewife. Normurod works in trade. He rents a shop where he sells lengths of tape. He has been doing this work for six years.  He is taking out a loan to buy more tape and new materials.

loans.use: to buy lengths of tape and new materials

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 52 year old married woman who is a mother to 3 children.  Zainab lives in Nabatieh,  She started her own business a year ago and sells clotheing that she exports from Turkey and Syria. 

Zainab is a hard worker and she has 25 years of experience in this field and she had the her courage was to start her own business.  Zainab is ambitious and her husband, children and friends are very proud of her.  She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase the capital she has to travel to Turkey and buy new clothing collections.  She is a borrower in good standing and all of her payments are on time.  She is looking to open a new branch very soon to reach a wider customers target.

loans.use: To Travel to Turkey and buy a new clothes collection

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Maria Liz A., ella invitó y organizó a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La sra. Maria Liz A. se dedica a la venta de ropas y ahora quiere emprender su venta de cosméticos.
Ella tiene pareja, con quien vive desde hace 16 años, es el señor Ignacio R., quien trabaja en una empresa grande, tienen cuatro hijos estudiantes, tres en la secundaria y una niña de tres años.
La señora Maria Liz solicitó el crédito para la compra de productos que la ayuden a surtir mejor sus negocios (abrigos en general, sábanas, cremas, colonias, y cosméticos).
Ella sueña con abrir un negocio de mercería en el centro de Luque y de esa manera aumentar su ingresos para brindar lo mejor a sus hijos.
Todas las integrantes del comité son mujeres luchadoras y esperanzadas en un mejor vivir, en una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias, por eso acuden a esta institución confiando ciegamente en que conseguirán la ayuda que requieren.
texts.en:
Maria Liz A. was the focal point for beginning this group.  She invited and organized her friends to form the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee for Entrepreneurial Women).

Maria Liz A. sells clothing and now she wants to begin selling cosmetics.  She’s been married to Ignacio R. for 16 years.  He works for a large company.  They have four children, three in junior high school and one three year old daughter.
