Maria Liz requested a loan to buy products that will provide a better assortment in her businesses (coats, sheets, creams, colognes, and cosmetics).

Some day she would like to open a store in downtown Luque and in that way be able to increase her income to provide the best for her children.

All the members of the committee are hard working women hoping for a better quality of life for their families.  They have approached this institution hoping that they will get the assistance that they need.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of recharge cards

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del Banco comunal “El Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante, específicamente venta de artículos de bazar, entre estos se encuentran la venta de cepillos, peinetas, artículos de aseo personal, juguetes y artículos de cocina. María instala su puesto en una feria libre, los días martes, jueves, viernes y domingos, en un horario de 9ºº a 14ºº horas. Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora, en ésta venden diversos productos y a un bajo costo, por lo que es más conveniente para su negocio.  Ella se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 7 años, comenzó vendiendo CD con música, DVD con películas y juegos para PlayStation.
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería específicamente peinetas y cepillos para el cabello, un toldo para su puesto en la feria y un triciclo de reparto, especialmente para trasladar su mercadería. 
Sus metas son prosperar con su negocio, abastecerlo con mercadería y comprarse un vehículo.  
María vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 14 y 11 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad en su educación. Además de tener una casa con acceso a patio, ya que actualmente vive en un departamento y desearía contar con una mayor comodidad para su vejez. 
María está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha servido para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones se siente muy cómoda, ya que se distrae y conoce a las demás socias. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “El Progreso” community bank in the community of Independencia, in the city of Santiago. She is a street vendor, specifically of variety store items. She sells brushes, combs, personal hygiene items, toys, and cooking items. María sets up her stall in a market on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays and Sundays from 9:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. She buys her merchandise at a distributor where they sell diverse products at a low cost, and it is convenient for her business. She has done this for 7 years. She started selling music CDs, DVDs and PlayStation games.

With the loan, she will buy merchandise, specifically combs and hair brushes and an awning for her market stall and a delivery tricycle to transport her merchandise. Her goals are to prosper in her business, supply it with merchandise and buy a vehicle.  
  
María lives with her husband and their two children, aged 14 and 11 years old. Her dreams are to offer her children a better quality education. Also, to have a house with patio access, since at this time she lives in an apartment and she wants to have more comfort in her old age. María is very happy and grateful for the loan offered by the Fondo Esperanza, since it has been used to invest in her business. She feels very comfortable in the meetings, since she is entertained and knows the other members. 

Independencia is one of 34 communities in the city of Santiago (capital of Chile), located in the north-central sector. It began in the beginning of the XIX century as a traditional sector of the city. It's main street is Av. Independencia, where the old Inca Trail passed through, the northern entrance to the city of Santiago. Given its large indigenous population, the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile is found in Independencia. It also has important historical buildings, among them historical monuments of Chile.

loans.use: to buy combs and hair brushes, as well as an awning for her market stall and a delivery tricycle.

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Janett del Socorro tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Tiene más de 30 años de experiencia en su actividad, es una persona que le gusta conversar con sus clientes y que ha demostrado ser una futura empresaria que ha sabido manejar sus ingresos. Inicio como una alternativa de empleo, pues ella no tenía un empleo además necesitaba ayudar a su familia y surgió esta alternativa. El crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, cremas para el pelo, pan y productos para el hogar.
texts.en: Janett del Socorro is 42 years old, and her business is a small general store. She has more than 30 years of experience with this work. She is a person who likes to have conversations with her customers. She has shown herself to be a businessperson with a future, who has managed her income wisely. She started the business as an alternative to a job, since she did not find work. She needed to help her family, and this alternative arose. The loan is to buy basic grains, detergents, hair creams, bread and household products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, hair creams, bread and household products.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 56 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of 10 adult-aged children. Corazon is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables like cucumber, eggplant, bitter gourd and tomatoes to earn a living. She has cultivated land for 10 years with a monthly income of PHP 1,500. Corazon depends on land cultivation as a way of generating income for the family. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay the labor cost for weeding. Corazon has been a good member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Corazon hopes to have more hectares of land to cultivate for vegetable farming.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for weeding.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: La Sra. María de Jesús  ella es trabajadora activa de la empresa de Enacal SRS desempeñándose como Afanadora  tiene  siete   años de trabajar para esta institución, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha obtenido  trece créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: María de Jesús works for Enacal SRS as a cleaner.  She has been working for this institution for seven years.  She has two school-age children.  María de Jesús has obtained thirteen loans from CEPRODEL and she has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc.  She would like to extend and improve her home.  She has greatly benefited from Ceprodel loans which have enabled her to improve her own living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, stone, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, Mrs. Him is a 41-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with two kids; one is a motor repairer in Phnom Penh City while the other one attends the public high school. Her husband, Leng, is 46 and works in the farming business. Mrs. Him inherited farmland from her grandmother and she and her husband grow different kinds of crops on it. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Mrs. Him doesn’t have the capital needed for her farm.  Mrs. Him is, therefore, looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting. She will use some of the money to buy a few pigs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, seeds for planting and to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Orfi Maria

texts.es: Orfi de 42 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella tiene una miscelánea,  donde vende variedades de productos, artículos de papelería, detalles para el hogar, el cual inició con mucho sacrificio y la oportunidad de un pequeño crédito. Gradualmente fue creciendo y hoy en su negocio tiene de todo un poco; sus principales clientes son su vecinos y los habitantes de barrios de su alrededor, ella vende principalmente de contado, aunque maneja algunos créditos. Como orfi es una mujer progresista, desea aumentar sus ingresos especializando cada vez más el surtido de mercancías, sobre todo las que rotan constantemente, para manejar un stock, que disminuya los costos del transporte y genere un ahorro por la compra de contado y en volumen. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará papelería, detalles y accesorios femeninos.    Su meta es continuar inyectándole capital a su negocio, porque es el origen de su sustento y ella está decidida a cuidar esta gran alternativa empresarial.
texts.en: Orfi is 42 years old and lives in Cartagena with her husband and three children.  She has a general store where she sells a variety of products, including stationary and home accents.  She was able to start the business with a lot of sacrifice and the opportunity from a small loan.  Gradually the business grew and now she sells a little of everything.  Her main customers are her neighbors and the people in the surrounding area.  Her sales are done mostly in cash, although she handles a credit accounts.  Since Orfi is a progressive woman, she wants to increase her income by specializing the assortment of goods, especially those that rotate constantly, to handle stock, lesson transportation costs, and generate savings to make purchases with cash in large volume.  For this reason she requests this Kiva loan, her first funding with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy stationary, home accents, and accessories.  Her goal is to continue injecting capital in her business because it is her primary source of income and she is determined to care for this great business venture.

loans.use: to buy stationary, home accents, and accessories.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor  de 44 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algunos años Nestor se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Nestor es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Nestor, age 44, lives with his wife and children in his own house, which has no basic services.  They live in the Tambogrande district in the Piura department.  This zone is known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For years Nestor has been selling basic needs items (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, and tuna, etc.) and drinks.  His business is located in his house for his comfort and safety.  With the income he gets from selling his products he tries to cover all of the expenses and improve his family’s standard of living.

In order to be able to expand his business he has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternative so that he can buy more merchandise.  His only thought is for his business to grow and that he has more products to sell his customers.

Nestor is a responsible, devoted, and hard-working person.  He is concerned about giving his wife and children more amenities.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Paizilatkhan's Group

texts.en: Paizilatkhan is the leader of this group. She is 44 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised three sons and a daughter. Two sons are working in Russia, the daughter studies at university and the youngest son is a farmer. In order to earn money for her livelihood, Paizilatkhan cultivates cotton. She earns 3000 soms per month selling part of the harvest. With the profits gained from this business, she has repaired her house. Paizilatkhan applied for this loan because she needs financial help to purchase mineral fertilizers for cultivating cotton and to buy building materials for the house. In the near future, she plans to finish house construction and celebrate her son’s wedding. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and building materials

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel  tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria. Ahora ha ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. Con este crédito comprará diferentes tipos de productos como leche, carnes, golosinas, avena en paquetes,  utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal. Maria está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día por  el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en: Maria Isabel owns a general store. Her determined spirit has always characterized her, and her desire to get ahead by her own means has helped her to become an enterprising woman. She has gained experience and trust because she is very well-known and liked by her customers. With this loan, she will purchase different types of products, like milk, meats, candy, packages of oats, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products. Maria is happy with the job that she does day to day because she has achieved her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase milk, meats, candy, packages of oats, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 38 years old and married to Mary. Together they have five children aged seven, nine, 11, 13 and 15 years. He runs a hardware shop as his primary business. He has been in the business for the past 15 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD . He plans to use the loan amount to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to expand his hardware store and educate his children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for  his children

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno y tiene 52 años. Está casada y tiene 7 hijos que tienen entre 10 y 32 años. A su cargo vive una hija que es madre soltera y su bebé.
Antes de ser socia de Manuela Ramos tuvo sólo un puesto de golosinas que estableció ella misma. Hace cuatro años que una amiga la invitó a ser parte de Manuela, ella tiene un negocio de venta de detergentes y querosene que inició con S./ 400.00. Una de sus hijas se quedó con el primero puesto. 
Con el nuevo préstamo de S./ 2,500.00 va a comprar detergentes y dos cilindros de querosene.
Le gusta con Manuela Ramos que el ahorro que gana interés y además los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
52-year old Clara is a member of the Nueva Generación Community Bank in Ilave district in the department of Puno. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 32. Clara still supports one daughter who is a single mother with a baby.

Before becoming a client with Manuela Ramos, she had a stand selling candy which she started herself. Then four years ago a friend invited her to be part of the Manuela Ramos organization. Now she has a business selling detergent and kerosene which she started with a loan of S/.400. One of her daughters now runs the candy stall. With this new loan of S/.2000 Clara is going to buy detergent and two cylinders of kerosene.

She enjoys working with Manuela Ramos because of the interest she earns from her savings and also the sporting events that are organized.

loans.use: to buy kerosene and detergent

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is married and has 7 children. He is 58 years of age, and he lives in Canibungan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He raises bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 8,500 doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for his farm. Eugenio has  been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future he hopes to improve his business so that he can give a brighter future to his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Meris Del Socorro

texts.es: Meris es una mujer de 45 años que vive en el barrio La pradera  al sur occidente de la ciudad y se dedica a  dos actividades, por un lado es comerciante de productos mediante guías especializadas y por otro es estilista; la primera actividad le genera más ingresos y sus clientes de los productos que comercializa mediante catalogo los consiguió con su actividad como estilista de belleza. Con sus negocios le aporta a los gastos familiares, que antes estaban solo en manos de su esposo, quien conforma su grupo familiar con sus   dos hijos. La labor de estilista la realiza principalmente a domicilio, pero también sus clientes la visitan para ser atendidos en su vivienda  donde cuenta con los equipos necesarios para prestar el servicio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza para el consumo de su negocio y también para venderlos a sus clientes, a quienes ha asesorado como  parte del valor agregado que ofrece a su más selecta clientela.
texts.en: Meris is 45 years old and lives in La Pradera, to the south west of the city. She has two businesses; on the one hand she is sells products using specialist catalogues and on the other hand she is a stylist. The first business generates more income and the clients who buy her products by catalogue were initially her beauty salon customers. With her two businesses she contributes to the household expenses which were previously solely in her husband's hands. He, together with their 2 children, makes up her household. She works at her clients' homes but she also sees to clients in her own home where she has the equipment necessary. Currently she is applying to Credikiva, the 1st loan she taking with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, for a loan to buy beauty products to be used in her own business and also sold to clients, as part of the value-addedness she offers her most select clientele.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for use in her own business and to sell to clients.

loans.name: Kheam

texts.en:
Kheam is 44 years old and the mother of five children. One of her children recently married and lives with her husband out of the house. Kheam is a local farmer as well as a plastic-kindling maker. She lives in the Ornlong Veng district. Kheam grows rice crops in the rainy season and spends most of her time during the dry season making plastic kindling that is normally used by housewives to produce fire. She can generate approximately 6 USD daily through her effort and skills. 

Kheam is requesting a loan to purchase an additional plot of land for farming.  She will use her remaining loan to buy the raw materials to make plastic kindling. She hopes that her loan will help increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Maame Ekua

texts.en: Maame Ekua sells palm oil and dry peppers in Eguafo. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a tailor. Maame has been selling dry peppers for15 years. She helps her husband care for their children. She will use her loan to buy palm fruit and peppers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit and peppers

loans.name: Sozar

texts.en:
Sozar is a farmer from the village Aghaiani, East Georgia. He is 36 years old, married and lives with his big family: his wife, Ledi, his two daughters (12 and 5 years old), his 3-year-old son and his retired parents. Sozar’s elder daughter goes to school. Ledi is a housewife. Sozar and his parents are involved in the family agricultural business. They have 3 milk cows and sell home made cheese in grocery stores in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country). Sozar also runs a bakery where he sells bread. The total average income of the family is 500 Laris per month. 

Sozar requested credit to expand his agricultural business. He plans to purchase three calves and grow them during the winter months. In spring Sozar will sell the calves at a higher price and make a profit. The family will use the additional profit to improve the living conditions of their children and the other family members.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been operating her retail store for eighteen-years and she is glad because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about PHP500 a day and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Susan suffered difficulties in her business due to many unpaid credit charges from her customers. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of PHP15,000 to allow her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads and other items for her general store business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads and other items for her general store business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, aged 42 years old, is married to Charles and they are blessed with two children aged 20 and 14 years old. She has been tailoring for two years and earns a monthly income of Kes.5000.

This is her first loan with KADET. She intends to use the funds to buy an over-lock sewing machine. Monica hopes to start a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase an over-lock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and tools

loans.name: David Edison's Group

texts.en:
Meet this group of teachers from the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their immediate financial challenges, and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

David is the featured leader of this group. The 58-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a businesswoman and has nine children, some of whom are attending primary and secondary school. David has been a school teacher for a number of years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay his childrens' school fees.

loans.name: Piedad Coralia

texts.es:
Piedad es una joven ecuatoriana de 20  años,  es soltera, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria , la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella no se negó a seguir estudiando y es por eso que por sus propios medios  ahora tiene titulo superior.
Por circunstancias adversas sufrió el abandono de su padre pero esto no le fue impedimento para superarse en su vida personal y laboral.. Ahora Piedad vive con su madre y hermano en una casa de familiares ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Este sector se llama Pujili conocido por sus tradiciones folkloricas . En cuanto a su economía, es una zona netamente musical y agrícola. 
Piedad se dedica a la elaboración y repartición de breaks  en las diferentes oficinas de la localidad se dedica a esta actividad desde hace algunos años atrás,  envista de que el negocio ha resultado muy bueno y con ganancias rentables se ha visto en la obligación y necesidad de incrementar con un horno y para  lo cual solicita un crédito. Además a Piedad  le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto. Piedad  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Piedad is a young, 20 year-old Ecuadorean who is single. Thanks to her parent's efforts, she managed to finish high school, but due to a lack of financial resources she was sent out to work from the time she was very young in order to support the household's needs. In spite of having a job that demands a lot of her time and effort, she did not neglect her studies and because of this, by her own rights, she has a higher education. She has dealt with adverse circumstances, including the abandonment of her father, but this did not stop her from excelling in her personal and work life. Now Piedad lives with her mother and her brother in a family house located in the Cotopaxi province in the Republic of Ecuador. This area is called Pujili, and is known for its folkloric traditions. As far as the economy, it is an area that is particularly devoted to music and agriculture. Piedad works making and delivering breakfasts and snacks to the various offices in the area. She's been doing this work for a few years. Given that the business has done very well and is profitable, she has seen the need to expand with an oven. This is why she is requesting a loan. In addition, Piedad would like to buy a vehicle in the future, so that she could get to more of the customers who demand her products. Piedad thanks Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in her personal and work life.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and in the future, she would like to purchase a vehicle to deliver to more customers.

loans.name: Massogblé

texts.en:
Waterproofness man by trade, Mr Massogblé T. is married and father of five (05) children. Having not the means to create his own enterprise which necessitates enough high cost and to exercise his career, he was launched in the market of gardening in order to have at his disposal an income resource. Realizing that this activity is profitable, Mr T. has trade in that domain for another specialization. The market gardening production. Particularly, the dry season cultures are very profitable because at that period the products are nearly nonexistent on the markets and those who are doing it, make much benefits. To that purpose, motor pumps are needed, what Mr T. does not have unfortunately. What limits his production and his income could help to save his family from poverty and misery. To increase the size of his production and make much profits, Mr T. needs a credit of $ 700 to acquire a motor pump and fertilizers. He has at his disposal several advantages of lake Togo which crosses his village.

Etanchéiste de profession, Monsieur T. est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. N’ayant pas de moyen pour créer son entreprise qui nécessite un coût assez élevé et exercer son métier, il s’est lancé dans le maraîchage pour pouvoir disposer d’une source de revenu. Voyant que cette activité est rentable, Monsieur T. s’est fait former en la matière pour une autre professionnalisation. La production maraîchère, particulièrement, les cultures de contre saison (pendant les saisons sèches) sont très rentables car en cette période les produits sont presque inexistants sur les marchés et ceux qui en font, en tirent beaucoup de profits. Pour cela, il faut disposer de motopompe, ce que Monsieur T. ne dispose pas malheureusement. Ce qui limite sa production et ses revenus pouvant permettre de sortir sa famille de la pauvreté et de la misère. Pour augmenter la taille de sa production et en tirer beaucoup de profits, Monsieur T. a besoin d’un crédit de $700 pour acquérir une motopompe et des intrants. Il dispose de plusieurs atouts dont le lac Togo qui traverse son village.

loans.use: Motor pomp and fertilizers purchase

loans.name: Wotoe

texts.en:
At 37 years old, Ms S. Wotoe is an illiterate mother of seven children, in a polygamous family. All of her children are entirely under her care and she would not be able to care for them as she does if it were not for the aid of the Catholic Sisters who educate the children, including the triplets. Thanks to the small loans, she has gotten a taste for small business and the results of various supports she receives. She sells bread as well as grilled fish. Currently, she has the ambition to add to her fish sales that of selling condiments, so that at her place her customers can find all they need for their meal. It is for this that she is asking for a loan of $1,200.00 that will be repayed over a period of 12 months, which will allow her to increase her number of customers and to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Agée de 37 ans, Madame S. Wotoe est une femme analphabète mère de sept (07) enfants dans un foyer polygame. Tous ses enfants sont abandonnés à sa charge et elle n’arrive à s’en sortir péniblement que grâce aux aides que lui apportent les sœurs catholiques pour la scolarité de ses enfants surtout pour ses triplés. Mais grâce aux petits crédits, elle a pris goût à la micro entreprise et surtout à la suite de diverses formations de renforcement de capacité qu’elle a reçues. Elle vend du pain et surtout du poisson grillé. Aujourd’hui, elle nourrit beaucoup d’ambitions en voulant ajouter au commerce du poisson des condiments de façon que, chez elle seule, le client arrive à trouver tout pour faire la cuisine. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 à rembourser en 12 mois afin de lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase and resell fish and condiments.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She and her husband (in the photo) have two children. They started the family business in 1995. Sona is planning to use the loan to increase the assortment of food in the business.

loans.use: To increase product inventory

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Mr. Cheam S. works as a tailor in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  He earns only about $1/day from his business, while his wife (pictured here) earns $2/day as a grocer.  Together, their earnings are just enough to support their 2 children, although they would like to start earning more.  Mr. Cheam S. has a good clientbase and would like to take this loan so he can purchase more cloth for his business.  As he attracts more and more clients, he dreams of one day of hiring two other employees and opening a bigger tailoring shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for his inventory

loans.name: Juana Salustia

texts.es:
JUANA is 22 years old; she’s married and has two children. She has been separated from her husband for a year since he left her to go to the United States in search for a new life. He forgot about her and their family and now she makes a living by selling table clothes, napkins and shawls. She then hand embroiders them and sells them to the wholesalers of the city every two weeks by the dozen. The pay is not comparative to the quality of her embroidery, this is why she wants the loan, so she can buy more fabric and embroidery floss and divide it with the other ladies in the Esqui Pulas 3 group. Mrs. Rosenda Lopez Perez (artisan) and Mrs. Maria Teresa Perez Vasquez (artisan) belong to this group; they want to sell their products to the tourists without intermediaries.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA, tiene 22 años esta casada , 2 hijos , esta separada de su esposo hace un año y medio ya que el la abandono por irse a vivir a los EE.UU. en busca de una nueva vida, pero se olvido de su familia , ella se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando manteles , servilletas, chales los cuales después borda y vende entre los mayoristas de la ciudad cada quince días por docenas, como el pago no es comparativo en relación con la calidad de su bordado es que espera con el préstamo comprar mas telas e hilos y repartirse entre las otras señoras de su grupo llamado Esquí pulas 3 al cual pertenecen doña Rosenda López Pérez ( artesana ) y Maria Teresa Pérez Vásquez ( artesana ) y además de esta forma poder vender ellas mismas sus productos a los turistas que visitan la zona .

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Raisa María

texts.en:
Raisa is about to reach one of her great dreams: to contribute to the entertainment of the young people of her sector. She always has felt pain for the boys of Haina; she sees them without any activity to enjoy themselves. For more than two years she has been saving money to open a video game center. She has already acquired a TV, 2 computers, many CD games, joysticks and a Super Nintendo. Currently, she is selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics products. She makes a weekly profit of $130 USD. Raisa is requesting a loan to transform a room of her house into the gaming room or amusement arcade. She has already made contact with some technicians responsible for laying out the space so as to install the computers, TV and other materials in a handy way so that the customers can play easily.

Raisa thinks that this activity will have a very positive impact on the young people. It will help to elevate their self-esteem, since they will be more self-confident when they win a game or when in a competition with other friends, they can do their best to obtain victory.

loans.use: To transform a room of her house into a gaming room so that the young people of her sector can enjoy themselves, playing video games by computer or Super Nintendo.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is 44 years old, married, and has 1 child. She has been in the clothing business for over 4 years. Her business is located in the Isfara clothing market. She buys her goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. For the coming winter she wants to purchase winter assortment of children clothes which will be in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase winter assortment of children clothes

loans.name: Eira Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Eira Hernández began a business 5 years ago in the city of Managua selling flavored refreshments, pop, and juices of different flavors.

It is necessary to note that this type of business is very strong because Eira began as a street vendor in the streets of Managua before establishing herself in the capital’s market.

Ceprodel has supported Eira for a year, and she has had 6 loans which she has used wisely to maintain her locale and to continue working hard to succeed and provide for her two small children who need her so.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hace cinco años, en la ciudad de Managua, para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos, la señora Eira Hernández inicia un negocio de venta de agua helada, gaseosa y jugos de diferentes sabores.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy fuerte por el hecho de que la señora S. comenzó vendiendo ambulante en las calles de Managua hasta establecerse en el mercado de la capital.

Desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Eira con la realización de 6 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado sabiamente para darle mantenimiento a su localidad y seguir esforzándose por sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto la necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business inventory

loans.name: Denny

texts.es:
Denny is a member of the communal bank "Honesty and Work", and lives in San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the Juanjui district. She manufactures and sells bricks in the area of Bello Horizonte, a high place in the city of Juanjui. She is a nurse by profession, but is also a woman with an eye for business - an ability that enabled her to advance her business with products that are in great demand in the province.

With a loan of S/ 3,000, which she will repay in six months, she will buy a large quantity of firewood, molds for different types of bricks she manufactures, as well as gas for the machine with which she mixes the supplies, and to pay her staff because it is a manual process.

Denny is 46 years old, and lives together with her husband and four children - two girls and two boys, who are still studying and who support her in the household tasks. Denny feels peaceful and content with the success she has achieved up to this point.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Denny es socia del banco comunal “ Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos, ubicado en el sector Bello Horizonte parte alta de la ciudad de Juanjui. Es enfermera de profesión, pero también una mujer con visión para los negocios, habilidad que le permitió llevar adelante su negocio, cuyo producto tiene gran demanda en la provincia. El préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará leña en gran cantidad, amoldadores para los distintos tipos de ladrillos que fabrica, además gasolina para la maquina mezcladora de los insumos y parte del pago del personal, porque la elaboración en manual. Denny tiene 46 años, vive junto a su esposo y tiene 4 hijos, 2 mujeres y 2 varones que aún están estudiando y quienes la apoyan en las actividades de la casa. Ella se siente tranquila y contenta con los logros alcanzados hasta hoy.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, brick molds, gasoline for the mixing machine, and personnel wages

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
Anali was able to obtain a motorcycle taxi with the help of her dear husband after much hard work. They use this work tool as a means of support for the family. Despite this investment, things have not improved much at home, so they found the need to render domestic services to that families who require them. Because of her great talent and dedication, she plans on setting up a space in her home to offer a variety of high-quality meals in her community. She is convinced that her daily work performance will raise her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

ANALI, con mucho esfuerzo y con la importante ayuda de su querido esposo ha podido adquirir un mototaxi para que su familia obtenga de esta herramienta de trabajo el sustento diario. A pesar de esta inversión las cosas en casa no parecen haber mejorado mucho y se ha visto en la necesidad de prestar sus servicios domésticos a las familias que la requieran. Debido a su gran talento y a su dedicación tiene proyectado instalar en casa un espacio para ofertar diversos platillos de excelente calidad a su comunidad, esta convencida que este desempeño diario hará que su familia eleve su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Increase capital to set up a space for food sales in the house

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov S. is a widow in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She is only 41 years old and still has all three of her children living with her in the family home. Only her oldest daughter can work with her at her grocery store. The grocery store earns the family US$5 per day. A unique economic opportunity has presented itself in that rice prices in Cambodia are currently soaring. She wants to take advantage of this situation by purchasing a stock of rice to sell at her grocery store to increase her profits as the prices only seem to be going up with no sign of slowing down.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy natural medicines to retail in her community.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat Y., 35, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. To help support her family, she sells porridge and can earn up to $5/day in revenue. Her husband earns around $4/day. Together the couple has four children.

Mrs. Sat is now hoping to embark on a new business venture in firewood sales and would like to borrow $300 in order to purchase a trailer. With a trailer, she will be able to transport mass quantities of firewood to sell. She hopes that this new business will be profitable and benefit her family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport firewood to sell.

loans.name: Comité Santa Lucia I Group

texts.es:
The committee is made up of 15 working women from the San Isidro neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. All of the women are small businesswomen. The group is currently in the ninth cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Women Entrepreneurs] program. Each group member receives on average about $300.

The committee started thanks to Hilda M.’s leadership skills. Hilda heard that the Fundación had an education program designed exclusively for working women. After that, working with other women from the neighborhood, she invited other working women from the neighborhood and in no time was holding the first meetings to appoint Santa Lucia committee members. The committee currently is developing a campaign to clean up sidewalks and vacant lots and has the support of the city government. The goal of the campaign is to prevent the spread of any kind of disease that can put the women’s families and children at risk.

Hilda would like to thank the Fundación Paraguaya for admitting her to the group and be part of the program. The women are learning a lot and feel very proud to be members of a group of such hard-working women who always are united. Each week they organize activities with the goal of increasing the group’s savings, which are in turn used to help members who are having problems.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas son pequeñas comerciantes, actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 9 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y las misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de gs. 1.213.333 por cada integrantes.

El comité se inició gracias a la capacidad de liderazgo de la señora Hilda M., quién se enteró que la Fundación tenía un programa educativo destinado exclusivamente para mujeres trabajadoras, y de ahi en mas conjuntamente con otras vecinas del barrio invitó a sus demás colegas trabajadoras del barrio y en corto tiempo ya se inicio las primeras reuniones dónde se conformó el comité Santa Lucia. El comité actualmente se encuentra desarrollando un proyecto de limpieza de veredas, patios baldios, con la ayuda de la municipalidad de la ciudad, pues el objetivo es la prevenir la proliferación de algún tipo de plaga que pueda poner en peligro la salud de sus hijos y de toda su familia.

La señora Hilda, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya porque le admitio a su grupo a ser parte de este programa, dónde están aprendiendo muchisimo, además se siente muy orgullosa de ser parte integrante de un grupo de señoras muy trabajadoras que siempre estan muy unidas y cada semana realizan actividades con la finalidad de ir aumentando su ahorro interno, como así también los ingresos son utilizados para ayudar a las integrantes que tengan algún tipo de problemas.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making traditional Paraguayan bread, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil; as well as small grocery store merchandise such as sugar, meat, tea, flour, milk, charcoal and all types of drinks

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Mrs. Tem R. is a farmer in Thmei Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, and her husband, Mr. Lon Song, is a firewood seller whose small income helps to support the family. Currently, Mrs. R. is requesting a loan to buy an additional ox to pair with the old one in order to cultivate her field. 

Mrs. R. is 53 years old and the mother of two children who are attending school. Previously, she obtained a loan, now fully repaid, to buy a piece of land for rice cultivation.

loans.use: To buy an additional ox to pair with the old one in order to cultivate her rice field

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam O. D. is married and has 6 children. He has received schooling through Basic level. Sam manufactures palm oil for sale at Braman in Cape Coast, which he has done since 2001. His wife is an oil producer.

Sam uses his income to pay for feeding the family and utility bills. Sam will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil. With the new profits from his expanded business, Sam plans to reinvest to expand his oil palm plantation.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: De La Paz

texts.es:
D. la Paz nació el 24 D. Enero D. 1,958, estudió hasta el tercer año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 05 hijos varones D. 23, 19, 17, 14 y 09 años D. edad. Vive en la Parcialidad D. Huaripujo, distrito D. Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno.

DesD. hace 01 año es socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Prado D. Bellido” en Conduriri. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300 compró cueros y fibra D. alpaca. Siempre se dedica al engorD. D. alpacas, ovinos y trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. 

Con este crédito D. S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar S/.300, 30 libras D. fibra D. alpaca D. primera y con S/.200.00 comprará cueros D. alpaca y ovino para ser comercializado a los mayoristas.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
D. la Paz was born on January 24, 1958. She studied up to the third graD. of primary school, is married and the mother of 5 sons who are 23, 19, 17, 14 and 9 years of age. She lives in the village of Huaripujo, in the district of Conduriri, province of El Collao, Puno. For the past year she has been a member of the "Maria Prado D. Bellido" Communal Bank in Conduriri. With her first loan for S/.300 she bought alpaca leather and wool. She has always been involved in raising alpacas and sheep and works alongsiD. her husband. With this loan for S/.500, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she has budgeted S/.300 to buy 30 pounds of top-quality alpaca wool and with S/.200 will buy alpaca and sheep leather to be sold to wholesalers. Her dream is that her sons continue studying and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy good quality alpaca wool and alpaca and sheep leather.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao K. breeds pigs in Takom village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Nget Sarom, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Two of their four children work in a garment factory and the others attend the local school. Mrs. Mao K.'s business is going well and she wants to expand it. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and pig feed. She hopes to thereby increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị Tỉnh tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Gia đình chị Tỉnh có 5 người con trong đó có 4 con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại gia chị đang có một cửa hàng ăn tại  huyện Bình Xuyên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Với mức thu nhập ổn định này kinh tế gia đình chị Tỉnh đang ngày càng  phát triển hơn. Vì vậy gia định chị cũng có điều kiện hơn trong việc chăm sóc và đầu tư cho các con đi học,
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để thêm vốn đầu tư mua thực phẩm và đồ dùng phục vụ cho việc kinh doanh hàng ăn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Dương Thị Tỉnh participates in TYM fund since 2003. She has 5 children, 4 of which are still in school. Her family runs a restaurant in Bình Xuyên district, province of Vĩnh Phúc. Her family income is 5.000.000 VND a month. With a stable income, her family financial condition improves and it allows her to provide a good education for her children. This round of loan she is requesting 15.000.000 VND to stock up on food and some needed things for her family restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more stock for her restaurant

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one boy and a girl. She says her son has completed senior high school and is currently working for a while. She says he will continue his education in due course. The girl however, is in the junior high school. Yaa’s husband is a professional nurse. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. She is a trader. She trades mainly in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says city dwellers come to buy with big cargo cars and go to retail to food vendors. Yaa has been in business for over four years. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of her customers and increase her profit margin. She yearns to help her children climb the academic ladder.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Anorkhon

texts.en:
Anorkhon V. is 50 years old. She is married with three children. She started her own business 7 years ago because her husband’s salary as a teacher was not enough to cover their family expenses. Anorkhon runs a confectionery where she sells candies, cookies and pastries. The income she generates helps her support her family. Recently she married off her daughter.

Anorkhon dreams of educating all of her children with higher education. Today she requests 1500 Somoni for the term of 12 months. She is going to use the loan to purchase more goods for her confectionery. She will continue to use the income from her business to take care of her family and educate her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the confectionery
